Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOOMBOOM50
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night. Fantastic service and decor. The view of LA at night is amazing. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Lancburm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a 3 day business trip to LA. The hotel is very conveniently located right downtown. The layout is a little quirky - very circular - but they have excellent signage to help. The fitness center is great and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge hotel but minimal amenities and $38/nt to park!!!”
Reviews.Author: gsl10408
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice but very pricy for what you get. For the price and the $38/nt for guest to park, you would think it would come with more amenities-at least a continental breakfast but everything had a fee. Even if you get a go deal on this place plan on spending your money on the rest of the stuff. Everything is overpriced. On the plus side, it's nice and our hotel had a nice view from our window. Sheets smelt though and had stains on them, almost called to have them changed but since my husband and I were only staying for one night we figured it wasn't that big of a deal. If your okay paying for all the extra's than with that all set aside, it's overall fairly nice, just couldn't get over the amount for parking and food.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel where you get lost...”
Reviews.Author: JDCNECSCV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Bonaventure Hotel twice. Once in 1994 and last week. The hotel is massive, has many shops, restaurants and things to do such as a running track, pool, and meeting rooms. The color coded elevators are very confusing if you are going to the ballrooms for meetings or finding your room. The elevators did not go to the 2nd level for the meeting rooms. I ended up taking a service elevator where I found myself somewhere in the bowels of the hotel. My room was big, but my bathroom was so small I thought I was in an airplane. The counter tops have not changed. I understand the shape of the hotel, but they have to make the bathrooms bigger. There is a pungent, musty and moldy smell which is a shame as I love the Westin candles/aroma stick oils. The service however is outstanding from the valet who retrieved my blackberry cable and had the bellhop bring it up to my room without hesitation, the check in employee who made me feel welcome, and the gentleman I ran into in the basement, who redirected me without making me feel as if I was intruding on private territory. Service is outstanding but the hotel is outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Durak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for two weeks on business. Overall, the hotel was fine. It's definitely a structure designed in the 1970s. Very modern then; very outdated now. The rooms are smaller that you'd expect in a hotel with the Westin name. The walls were a bit thin as well; I could hear the neighbor's tv. The most interesting aspect were the elevators -- an amazing view of LA in the glass elevators. Just don't be agoraphobic. The hotel bragged of having six floors of shops in the bottom, but most were closed, and the food was pretty terrible (except for The Brewery: great restaurant). The wait staff in the hotel restaurant ranged from outstanding and friendly to surly and unattentive. The hotel staff were outgoing and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: imetmadonna
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here. I was by myself, and found staff helpful and friendly. The location is good if you have business in the city. Otherwise, a car is a must, although you do have to pay for parking. The hotel and rooms are beautiful. Spa was wonderful, as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Night Experience”
Reviews.Author: SouvenirGal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a huge conference center and I was there to attend a meeting. The registration staff were friendly and helped me understand how to navigate with the 4 different glass elevators (they are marked with different colors and shapes). The elevators provide great views of the city. Friendly warning: My room was near one of the elevator tracks in such a way I could see who was in the elevator and what they were doing when it was dark outside (the elevators are lit). Also knew to keep my blinds closed for privacy. Did I mention the staff is top-notch? One evening my key card didn't work and a Westin employee happened by. I explained the situation and he got someone from security to come up and let me in. After she verified my identity, she let me in and apologized for the inconvenience. She offered me complimentary breakfast the next day. She later returned with a new key and slipped it under my door. When the WiFi wouldn't connect, the staff gave me a courtesy code so I could get on-line. The doormen gave great directions and were quite friendly. The room was very clean and looked recently renovated. The bed, linens, and pillows were very comfortable. All-in-all, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like Having Neighboring Room In Mine”
Reviews.Author: Jnjtiger
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA location - if there is a Downtown LA. There for business meeting at bank, basically attached to this hotel, so convenient location. Hotel is large, rambling, hard to navigate, multiple elevator banks. Room was very pleasant until neighbors began talking and listening to TV - both done basically ALL NIGHT. Might as well have been in my room. Heard every word! Many other hotels in the area, so make another choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Attention to details, Trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: chuck f
Reviews.Content: Hotel remodeled since last visit. Rooms and furnishings are first class. Amenities are great. Beds perfect. Restrooms are spacious and provide high quality amenities. Lobby is well done, great feel, and frankly with the age of the hotel it seems like they really did a nice job with the remodel Housekeeping and Front Desk were very friendly and sharp

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: shayre21
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience in this hotel. The rooms were very nice and clean, the view was great and the price was decent as well. I really liked the location as there are many food options nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were there while the Vice President was staying there was a ton of security there. The hardest thing I found about this hotel was the lobby was a big circle. It took me a while to figure out how to get out of the hotel as its a big circle.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with great staff and heavenly beds!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: Loved my 2 night stay at the Westin Bonaventure hotel. I truly enjoyed cocktails and dinner in the rooftop restaurant. The hotel wasn't a far drive for me to visit Hollywood Blvd either. Overall, I had a restful stay at the Bonaventure and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - Good value”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the more interesting hotels I've stayed at for business. Four towers with different colour names go to different "wings" of the hotel. First the lobby - very big and basically goes around in a large circle which made it a little challenging to meet with business associates but I managed. Plenty of seating which was good. Room - It was fine, clean, bed was comfortable however the room itself was quite small which doesn't tend to bother me except that there was a door to an adjoining room hence it felt a little intimate being able to hear someone russling about on the other side. I was however annoyed about the card swipe into the room (which is amusing seeing someone else comment on this.) After checking in, I had to return to the reception as my cards didn't work to get into the room and to get them re-magnetized..... lo and behold, they still didn't work when I returned and after trying them again and again, finally managed to get the door open. Every time I returned I would have to swipe 15-20 times to get the card to register (and I stay at hotels regularly hence am not unfamiliar with how these work!) They need to look at fixing this as it's frustrating. One very positive note, after finally going to get some dinner at around 9pm I decided to eat in the lobby bar and had an amazing prawn fajita....great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: lovewine
Reviews.Content: A "good enough" business hotel in downtown LA. I'm not impressed by the movies that were filmed here, I don't care much about "signature scents" or "heavenly beds"...my ratings are solely based on a pass/fail system involving the following criteria. Comfortable, clean, bed - pass. Good sized, spotless bathroom - pass Free wifi with good connectivity - epic fail Relatively quiet - pass Being able to get into my room with my keycard - epic fail. I was in two rooms here and had issues with the keycard in both. Lack of glass elevators which scare the crap out of me - fail Relatively helpful staffers if I have an issue - pass Decent eating choices - big pass! (just skip all the other restaurants and eat all your meals at the Health Winner & thank me later) I had big problems with wifi (not free btw - WTF?). My original room had a bad signal and the response was "well, you can connect in the lobby". After I pointed out that I really didn't went to be spending all night in the lobby reviewing my presentation + the sight of me in my PJ's would drive customers away, they moved me to a different room. If you have a fear of heights or glass elevators this hotel will give you palpitations. Otherwise, there are lots of small take out places here to get a cheap, healthy to go meal which I like. And there's a liquor store - woohoo! It's a good place to stay if you're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but expensive, hotel for watching Laker games”
Reviews.Author: daalfonso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to catch a Laker game, location is a ~15 min walk to Staples. Overall great hotel, good location, clean lobby, clean rooms. If you get a room with a view, that's also a plus. Only downside is paying for parking and paid internet access in the room is pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & good value”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure was located in the heart of the LA Downtown - good for business travellers and for corporate meetings. It's situated in a business district so don't expect to have a lot of exciting nightlife in the neighborhood. The hotel was pretty big with 4 towers assigned to different color codes but were inter-connected on all floors. The directional signage could be better placed with clearer indications. A bridge connected the hotel with the adjacent World Trade Center on the 6th floor. My room was spacious enough and clean; bed was comfortable. Since I only stayed for one night I didn't have a chance to use its fitness facilities or the restaurant so cannot comment of those.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: FrancesIII
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a convention, it was a very nice place, we stayed on the 20th floor to keep the traffic noise down and away from the elevators so that we were assured privacy because we didn't want to close our curtains. We found nice places to eat and shop although I wish that there were more places open, with the economy that just isn't happening. I am looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better the 2nd time!”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to the westin bonaventure, and last time I enjoyed the hotel but I had major wifi issues on my iPad that left me less than pleased with my stay. On my first stay they admitted that wifi on iPads was a consistent problem, I asked about it upon check in and they assured me it was fixed, I am pleased to say this is true they have fixed their wifi issues!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Starwood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLance
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I are "SPG's" and stay at the Bonaventure every few months or so. The hotel itself is okay, as long as you stay on a "preferred" floor. We stayed once, before joining the SPG program, and were moved to 3 different rooms, each one as "beaten" as the previous until we finally ended up on a preferred floor, which is actually why we joined the program. The rooms not on those floors had everything from cigarette burns in the carpets to rust running down the shower from the handrails. The desk employees are always welcoming and the valets quick....though sometimes a bit understaffed. The location in downtown is perfect, as you are within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, Fig at 7th, a few museums, the library and even staples/nokia. If like me you forget to eat while out there are several places within the hotel but they close at around 10pm..I think. The hotel has a gym, heated pool and both are decent. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here as opposed to some others in the area, as you will find that the others can be rather noisy from the street and staff are sometimes less than professional. Could the price be better? Maybe, but considering where you are....

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable service”
Reviews.Author: Cypan
Reviews.Content: The room was nice with incredble views. The lounge was nice on a revolving platform. The concierge service was outstanding! Location downtown is great. The price is pretty high but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: DisgustedGuest_54903
Reviews.Content: It's in Downtown LA and; therefore, pricey, I get that, but for the prices I expect much better. First off, I couldn't even purchase a drink from a vending machine. I had to order room service. Not cool. It took between 15-20 minutes for the shower water to warm up to a tolerable level (cold, fast showers were the norm). There was a coffee machine provided, but no creamer or sweetener of any kind. I travel a lot and I have NEVER seen that. Worst of all, there were blood stains on the linens and the edges of the comforter was held together by safety pins. For the price, I expect much better. I will never again stay at a Westin hotel especially this one. Thank God I was not the one who was paying the bill or I would have demanded my money back and found other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BlancheNoir
Reviews.Content: The thing that impressed me the most about this hotel was the service. It is a beautiful hotel, as one would expect, but there was something extra professional about the service that I really enjoyed. I could tell that the employees were trained to speak to us in a certain manner, i.e., use our name, etc. but I have to say that every single staff member was not only professional in conduct, but sincere and genuine in providing service. I have stayed in a number of equally beautiful hotels, and been treated with impersonal and even contemptuous service. They go the extra mile to provide impressive professionalism, and genuine congeniality to the guests. I highly recommend the Westin Bonaventure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Westin quality; If I paid, I would want my money back”
Reviews.Author: FMDtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last week for business. Check in was seamless, though it was 10:30 PM. I got to the room easily enough, the outdoor elevator was pretty cool. I was on the 29th floor, again, great. It ended there. The room stunk - I'll assume it was LA smog. The TV was cheap and took me a while to get it turned on - I know how to use a TV. I went to set the alarm clock - sorry, doesn't work. Didn't even display the time. Though they apparently work in other rooms because my neighbor's went off at 7 AM and never stopped. It was incredible noisy for being so far removed from street level, and that's not including my other neighbor who was, for some reason, up and making tons of noise at 2AM. Get this - two of the four receptacles I tried, didn't work. The toilet sit didn't go up all the way - it hit the counter-top and rested on my back while using the toilet. Finally, the iron worked terribly and leaked water all over my shirt . . . here's a tip there, turn the iron dial far past the Maximum point, like 360 degrees past, and it finally gets hot. Overall, I love Starwood hotels and wish I had just tried the Sheraton down the street. Maybe next time. And PS, you can see in other people's rooms pretty clearly.

Reviews.Title: “get away to LA”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Nice property with great service staff. Spend there 3 days. Great for downtown destinations but not very convenient for an airport and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Huge but enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: If you need a luxurious (heavenly) bed in a full service hotel in LA, this is a good choice. The rooms are clean and well designed for work. Food (late night room service and breakfast buffet) are good quality but pricey. It's a huge hotel, but the staff was approachable and pleasant. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: RickStone70
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here as part of a short trip to LA. Pretty much what you would expect from a 4 star downtown hotel. Expansive lobby, large hotel with lots of rooms, expensive parking, plenty of dining choices in hotel and surrounding area. The rooms themselves were a little on the small side but just fine for our purposes. The location was quite good as we were able to walk to/from the Staples Center for a basketball game and a hockey game. Very good food/beer at their onsite brewery and decent prices. Especially during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Actuary
Reviews.Content: We stay here a few times every every year as a couples getaway. The first floor dining and bar area are quite comfortable. The rooms are modest in size, but the view is fantastic. We highly recommend the spa. The spa staff is great and we feel fantastic when we are done.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel; you get lost in the building”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: room was ok with a nice view over downtown. the windows are thin so even on the 20th floor you have quite some street noise. there is supposed to be a huge area with restaurants in the hotel but unfortunately most of the shops are empty and there are only some fast food places and a brewery place. but it's hard to find something as it feels like a labyrinth. parking is super expensive and this applies also to the parking lot across the street. we drove in but there was no sign outside showing the prices. inside we saw a sign and we wanted to leave the building literally within 3 mins and they wanted us to pay like 30usd. we argued with them until they opened the barrier without charge. they must be nuts. put a sign outside and you avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DeBaryTigerFan
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the staff of the Westin Bonaventure. I'm a seasoned traveler and appreciate good service. The staff was extremely attentive during my recent visit when I had an issue with some lost items. I misplaced them--they were not stolen. It took some help from the housekeeping and engineering staff to recover my items because of where they had fallen. It's a lovely hotel, but service makes all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “"Pillars of the Earth" for the Business Warrior”
Reviews.Author: LLFauntleroy
Reviews.Content: Business warriors need inspiration and juice, and this place provides it in its grand lobby cathedral, like the great churches of medieval Europe gave the folk in Ken Follett's epic novel "Pillars of the Earth". The rooms are standard 4 star fare of medium size, and you won't draw inspiration there. But the lobby, with towering pillars, fountains, glass rocket elevators, and tiered platform architecture-- that's what will make you feel good about yourself. I travel 4 stars only for business, and it helps me to be psyched up and juiced with winner drive. Plus, there is a full self service 24 hour Fed Ex Office (Kinko's) off the lobby that trumps any hotel's "business center". The circular lobby cafe doubles as workspace, we were all with our laptops, meeting clients (the fountain white noise gives confidentiality), no pressure to order any food, more like a concierge asking if you want anything to eat or drink. Plus, those glass elevators were filmed in "True Lies", with Arnold chasing the terrorist to the roof, who escaped by a motorcycle leap to the poor below. I looked at that pool from the elevator and thought of the movie with every ride. So, if you are after a large luxury room at any price, this isn't the place. But if you are ok with a medium sized room and a good rate down the cavernous corridor in the Taj Mahal, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view. Ok standard. Noisy.”
Reviews.Author: StockholmMoa
Reviews.Content: Get a room high up for the full l.a. Experiment. You will see and hear the traffic. Amazing with the view but the noises are a bit disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room, good business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Well, its big! The architecture is a bit strange with 'cavernous' lobby 'levels. The first through 5 floors are mixed with strange dining options, retail stores, offices and the like in what appears to have been an attempt at a Mall of shops when the property was conceived. It appears to struggle to be leased, and is filled with an odd mix. It is also a bit confusing to navigate. Very strange. Health club is large. Lobby bar is nice. Room was average size, very clean...and comfortable. Pretty much standard business hotel room. The room appears to have been completely renovated of recent. Actually, the complete hotel was renovated. Lobby areas, hallways and all public areas are fresh and new. Service was good. The place is HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “Central downtown location, massive hotel”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: There are 4 towers in the hotel all are connected, but it is a massive hotel. I was on a SPG preferred floor. I believe I was in a newly remodeled room. It was a decent size, large bed. I was only there for a night, but it had it been more the bathroom and closet size would have been in a factor as they were quite small. They have a nice outdoor pool. The gym is large with several treadmills, elliptical, and machine weights as well as free weights. There are many dining options in the hotel. The bona vista lounge actually rotates which is cool and weird all at once. I didn't dine at the steak house.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure offers the business traveler a perfect haven. The newly furnished rooms are sleek, soothing, and well designed. The linens were lovely, the bed comfortable, the staff helpful, and my view was outstanding. After a long business trip, I landed at the Bonaventure and loved every aspect of my stay. Don't forget to head to the revolving bar on the top floor for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The Bona Vista lounge at the Bonaventure......a must”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I was not a guest at the Westin Bonaventure but I spent a whole afternoon and evening at The Bona Vista lounge which is the revolving lounge at the top of the hotel. I couldn't find it on tripadvisor so I am putting down my review as part of the hotel entry. I visited the lounge with friends while on a leisure trip with friends in January 2012. I was referred to the place by a friend and I can say that it was one of the best referrals I ever got fro a fellow traveler. The lounge is located at the top of The Westin Bonaventure hotel in the LA financial center. It has a magnificent view on all of LA, Hollywood and Santa Monica. the view is simply breathtaking regardless of what time of the day you are in. It it probably the best attraction of the lounge. If you come in the afternoon you will sure experience the wonderful LA skyline and the great residential plains scattered all across the city. At night the scene changes into something out of a fairly tale. The view transforms into a dazzling festival of lights, you can see all LA lights shining everywhere among the darkness of the clear Californian sky. The lounge is revolving, so it turns at 360 degrees each 50 minutes and it gives you the benefit at looking at all sides of the city without leaving the comfort of your seat, although I doubt that you will stay put as you will want to snap pictures from every single angle. At some point you become facing the tall skyscrapers of the commercial district and that's another magical show of lights. The service at the lounge is worthy of a 5 star. All employees are simply perfect at what they do, they are always smiley and help in anyway possible to show you around, point at the best things to see, suggesting the nicest cocktails and meals on the menu. They are always surrounding you without barging in. I loved how I was treated knowing that I did not have a huge bill. This shows great value and great respect to customers. Needless to say the menus were also fantastic, very easy to understand and very easy to order from, they hold all what one requires from a lounge. The drinks, cocktails and wines are just great. The list is endless and very refined. Prices are very balanced for such a place and you can sure enjoy the best of the menu at very reasonable prices knowing that you are being served in a 5 star place. I fully recommend the lounge for all visitors to LA and even to residents of the city. you don;t need a reservation if you are going for drinks, just let the elevator lift you to a dazzling world of lights amidst a gorgeous sky. trust me you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Business of making me feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NurseBethany
Reviews.Content: I was in LA on a short business trip. I have never stayed at the Westin Bonaventure..what a treat. The staff were incredible. I felt like a queen my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, well appointed hotel - but eat elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: CultureSleuth
Reviews.Content: Five night stay for business. Hotel service was accomodating and reasonably friendly. Room was quiet, bed comfy, heat and air worked well. Hotel is massive, but the colored "tower" elevators allow for easy navigation. Only drawback - and it was really a drawback - was the food was simply horrendous! We had @ 500 people in our group, so maybe this is not a fair assessment, but I simply never had a good meal. Also, a little over the top with the A/C - but again, may have been due to the large group.

Reviews.Title: “This is a LARGE downtown business hotel, but does a great job of it.”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Having seen the Westin Bonaventure used in movies for years (True Lies, In the Line of Fire, etc), I stayed here for a business meeting being held at the JW Marriott down the street. For a large, downtown I was extremely pleasantly surprised. The rooms have very recently been refurbished (new carpet, furniture, wall covering). My room was a 31st floor suite (thank you SPG platinum), with a very comfortable bed, great furnishings, and incredibly spacious. Views were unbelievable, and I got to make fun of my colleague who could not face the windows in the elevator (cowered against the door due to fear of heights). Breakfast in the restaurant was very well done, albeit at large downtown business hotel prices. Staff in the restaurant, front desk, bell desk, and doorman were great. My only critical comment would be a softball I threw to the concierge. I asked if he could have a bottle of champagne couriered to a business associate who is taking a new job. The request befuddled him, offering room service on the telephone. I know I was looking for a creative solution (the Ritz or the St Regis would take an address, and charge me out the wazoo to do it, but they'd do it). Instead I had to make other arrangements. No big deal. I recommend this hotel and will return if given the need to return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff put this hotel up there”
Reviews.Author: Haarpoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently for a national sales meeting held in the hotel. Rooms were a bit smaller than I expected, but the bed was very comfortable, so I didn't really mind. When in LA, one doesn't really stay in their room too much anyway. I did have an issue with my sink on the second day, it started leaking profusely from the bottom, I called down to the front desk before I left for my meeting, and when I came back 2 hours later the bathroom had been cleaned up and sink repaired as if nothing had ever happened. I give great credit to the maintenance and front desk staff for getting that problem fixed up in a hurry, especially for such a large hotel. I also really like the complementary WiFi you get in your hotel room, you don't find that in many of the larger chains. I did expected the soundproofing to be better than it was. On the third night, the person in the room next to me apparently had too much to drink, and I got to hear in every gory detail as he became quite sick in his bathroom... so loudly that it sounded like he was in my room. I suggest getting a room away from the elevator, because you can hear the hallway noise quite well if you don't have a TV on. As for the location, don't stay here if you expect to be in the middle of everything. The Staples Center is about a 10 minute walk from here, but other than that there isn't really anything to do outside of the hotel that doesn't mean taking a cab to. Now the hotel has several dining options, and several different bars. I suggest the Bonaventure Lounge, a rotating eatery/bar at the top of the hotel. All in all, I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: nkashyap
Reviews.Content: + Great location in downtown LA, lots of onsite restaurants, easy valet parking, no street noise (at least on 26th floor), good sized rooms, a couple of specials for SPG members, coffee bar - registration was slow - too many guests and too few checkin agents

Reviews.Title: “Great..slightly expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Creasians
Reviews.Content: I've camped at this hotel for over 5 months now and found this a great place to stay at along with some other downtown hotels I've reviewed earlier. Expensive, if you dont have a priceline price or a govt rate. Else, this place is super comfortable. Well appointed rooms, the beds and linens - nice, great newly done bathrooms etc. Onsite restaurants that are open until 10pm, food that you may not find anywhere else nearby if you decided to eat a late dinner. Some of the previous reviewers have mentioned bedbugs here. I,ve never been putup in a room with one though so I would doubt those claims. The downside..noisy elevators if your room happens to be close to one. In a nutshell, I'd always stay here if in the area..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Henriette_11
Reviews.Content: We prefer staying at the Bonaventure Hotel when we have a Trade-Show in downtown Los Angeles. It is close to all stores and it has a great gym and on the floor below the hotel is a whole selection of different restaurants and fast foods. Sometimes we like to eat out and other times we just like something quick.

Reviews.Title: “great if you are comfortable with downtown la”
Reviews.Author: harleysvillesue
Reviews.Content: stayed here Jan 2012 for 4 nights after getting it thru Hotwire, about 107 per night weekend, had to pay a higher rate to add on Thurs night. since my husband was very familiar with the area and loves cities, walking all over downtown to see some great buildings was fun and easy to do from Westin location. If I was here by myself, not sure if I would felt as comfortable, it is pretty dead downtown in the evenings and on the weekends. Parking at hotel is steep,38 per day. after our first day we moved the car to theWorld Trade Center lot nearby which was about 8 per day. we were able to get.a room on 27th floor in the yellow tower, which had a nice view of the mountains and the Hollywood sign. the hotel is so huge it can take you a couple of days to get acclimated. elevators were fun and fast, never had to wait. A big highlight was hotels proximity to Border Grill across the street, which has a great happy hour menu every days, cheap eats and drinks. the revolving bar at the top of hotel has great views.

Reviews.Title: “Giant Roaches Don't Faze the Staff... Avoid at all cost...”
Reviews.Author: Snowpocalypse
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE 4 STAR DOWNTOWN LA HOTEL LISTED FOR ABOUT $100 ON PRICELINE & HOTWIRE.... NASTY I woke early one morning at this hotel, opened the door to the bathroom and saw the largest roaches I have ever seen. I captured one but it in a coffee cup and went to the front desk... The staff acted like it was no big deal and since it was a third party reservation said they could do nothing about my desire to not spend the rest of my stay at their hotel...

Reviews.Title: “great service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 21SanDiego21
Reviews.Content: this hotel is so nice, great location everything you need is walking distance. Staple Center too. Beaware the coctail lounge is expensive, two house glasses of red wine was $28. Our first morning the hot water was gone. None in the entire hotel. We called guest service and they where so nice we got comps. went out for the day and came back to find a apology note and and some fruit. I was so surprised how they went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. I will always stay here when we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure isn't the luxury hotel that it used to be. It's shabby despite the lobby upgrade, weirdly empty (like the set of a scary movie) and the food is awful. But the rates reflect its reduced station in life, and the location is perfect for downtown business trips, and lets you walk to the library, Disney, MOCA, even Nokia Theater with ease. I've stayed here 5 times in recent years. The beds don't seem to have that Westin loft any more (or maybe it was just this one) but in other ways the service was fine. Parking is outrageous, so park nearby instead. Or even better, take the FlyAway shuttle to Union Station and then walk around downtown. Lots of good restaurants in the area, so no need to eat in the hotel. Especially avoid the overpriced LA Prime, where the food is just plain bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed weekly for over 14 months...”
Reviews.Author: Joseph M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure in LA for about 14 months traveling from San Francisco on a weekly basis. The hotel is very large and one can get a bit lost, but they recently revamped their lobby area - I believe a $30m upgrade. The changes give the hotel a much warmer and modern feel. The rooms are a good size and very clean, modern and the heavenly beds are second to none. I often ate at the Bonaventure Brewing Company and there are a lot of restaurants and bars nearby. Gym on 3rd floor does the trick. Everyone I encountered was very nice. During this entire 14 month stay, I may have had 4 or 5 minor issues (tv not working properly, etc.) that were quickly fixed with an apology and follow up. Some times even adding points for my stay, etc. I was taken aback at how nice and apologetic they were. You could just tell that the team there is all about customer service first and foremost. I stayed at the Marriott across the street and the Wishire down the street and there is no comparison. Their lobbies are nice, but the rooms I was given were antiquated. If I had to stay at either of those hotels, I think I would have been pretty sad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amasnyc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and the staff are very pleasant. Stop by the SPG Preferred Guest Desk and ask for Sophia, she is very pleasant and helpful At check in, I was offered my choice of the LA Times or US Today to be delivered to my room. I chose LA Times but it was never delivered to my room. I had to go to the desk on the ground floor to pick it up. Check out the 4th Floor High Rise Cafe breakfast special is $5.00 and the Brewery is also a great place for lunch. The elevators take forever.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: stetson
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum traveler I was upgraded to a suite which was a fairly large layout with a separate powder room. I was in room 1811 which was quiet and a decent view (higher would have been better). Valet parking was very expensive at $38, but I did not see much choice (nor did I investigate alternatives) I had a business dinner at LA Prime which was on the 38th floor and did have a nice view. Workout room was relatively small for a large hotel and was VERY busy at 5:45AM PT.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: MemoryCamera
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Great service at front desk check in. Disappointed with amenities, not a great coffee option, restaurant options were average. Room was large, bed was excellent, nice desk, average bathroom. Overall hotel is fading a little. I would stay again at the right price although I would check other options next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LauraShanks
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with this hotel for a part of our honeymoon for new years. I didn't know where we were staying so I was suitably impressed when we pulled up outside the bonaventure. We were greeted by helpful staff at the checkin counter and told that they would send out bags up to our room. We checked in nice and easily and were told the best elevator to take to our room. When we got to our room (on the 25th floor) it was brilliant. It had recently been renovated so it was nice and clean and the room was of a decent size for a inner city hotel. The bed was a king bed and we both slept really well. The bathroom was really clean and the shower was powerful even in the bath tap dripped while we were taking a shower. We had breakfast in the hotel every day and were never disappointed, they didn't have the same thing every day which was nice to get a change even if we could have eaten the pancakes every day! We found the concierge to be helpful but he didn't go above and beyond, for example we were trying to get tickets to see the LA Lakers game on new years eve and he told us where we could get tickets but we both thought that he could of found out if tickets were still available from the ticket broker before we made the 20 minute walk in the heat to find out. But maybe this is how things are done in LA hotels as we've never been before. We didn't mind in the end as we got great tickets and we found the grammy museum! My husband used the pool as the weather was great on new years, while I relaxed by the poolside, if you closed your eyes you wouldn't of known you were in downtown LA! I would recommend this hotel to any of our friends or family, we are coming back to America in September and we will be staying at the Bonaventure for a couple of nights without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CostasDaGreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Hotel with my family and the experience was great. The lobby was beautiful and we ate Breakfast there in the mornings. Great food. We also ate at the Restaurant that was at the top floor of the Hotel. Great food and amazing view. The rooms were nice, and had a good view of downtown LA, and many skyscrapers that surrounded the hotel. The idea if having "Towers" separate the rooms was interesting. We were in the Blue Tower. The only problem was the pool as when we stayed. the quality of it was pretty bad. But there are good beaches to make up for it. Overall our stay at the Westin was great and next time we return to LA we will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One would expect more...”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravellerz06
Reviews.Content: The hotel's pricelist puts it in competiotion with the likes of the Hilton but I am sad to say its amenities are outdated. Do not expect to get anything deliscious to eat at this hotel, it is either extremely overpriced or has hairs sticking out of...

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed...........”
Reviews.Author: scotta63
Reviews.Content: I have to say I expected a little more than what this particular Westin offered. We picked it because of the location of where we were spending our New Years Eve. So, the pro was the location. We also enjoyed a sandwich we picked up from a little sandwich shop in the hotel. We were told the rooms had been renovated recently. Although they looked okay, the beds were extremely hard. In fact, both our bed and the other couple who stayed next door to us, complained about how UN-heavenly the beds were, not to mention the shower and shower head, which needs some renovation. When we complained to someone at the front desk she stated, "Oh it's probably because the bed is new and needs to be broken in." Trust me that is not it at all. There was also a weird creaking sound coming form the bed frame every time I sat down on it. I would have to say the Westin Bonaventure is a "Has been.". One last thing, when we went to check out we saw some dog feces sitting on the Starwood Preferred mat, in front of the reception desk. I have stayed at other Westins and have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, rude staff, a room worse than a cheap Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: misspiggy65
Reviews.Content: We sent an email as we knew they would be busy for New Year and received a nice reply stating they would try and accomodate our needs as we had requested a king bed. We were not able to have one, and the reception Manager's answer was 'What do you expect when you book through Priceline.' The valet parking staff were abrupt and rushed us, and the way to the room from parking is not good. Our room was right next to elevator, lights shining in from elevator, all noise heard from everyone exiting the elevator. Our room was a disabled room, and looked like my late fathers hospital room. I was very upset by this and asked to be moved, sorry you are Priceline people was the answer, thats what you get. The room had a lot of damage, and curtains would not close properly. I am not normally one to complain, or expect too much, but this was ridiculous. A call to a Manager did not help...............so we spent as little time as possible in the hotel. The lobby area is nice, so its a shock to have such a bad room and feel about the place. I have stayed at Westin marque hotels before - these guys should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “A City within the City”
Reviews.Author: Ozma
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Bonaventure was exactly the opposite of what I'd expect from a downtown L.A. hotel: the atmosphere inside its five towers is peaceful and calm. Everything I could possibly want was right there inside the building: I needed to go outside only if there was something I wanted to do in the city. Inside, I was invited simply to Be (at a price, of course.) My room was small, as some reviewers have commented, but the view was magnificent, the bed incredibly comfortable, and the wifi so fast that I almost didn't mind paying for it. ($13 per 24 hour period, although it's free in the lobby.) The television service included Showtime but not HBO. Room service is very expensive; I found the prices a bit deceptive given that they tack on a $3.50 delivery charge plus a 19% gratuity. The price of room service is the reason I gave it four stars, not five; the food was fine, but not worth what they are charging. Tip: If you cannot live without Diet Coke or some such, bring your own. There's a nice fridge in the room, and room service charges almost 5 bucks for a soda. If you don't want to bring your own, you can get them for a bit less in the hotel gift shop, lobby level. All that said, it's an environment with priceless views of the city from every room, a bed I would stuff in my suitcase and take home if I could, and housekeeping service as unobtrusive and thorough as I've ever seen. The desk was set up for business (a power strip! a power strip! bless them!) and everything was immaculately clean. They talk about each room having "spa amenities" and while I don't care about terry robes, I enjoyed the truly luxurious shower head and bathroom details. It's a city within the city, with many places to shop, to eat, to drink, and to enjoy. Here and here you will see little plaques mentioning that such-and-such a movie scene was filmed here. It's a big flashy building with many small delights.

Reviews.Title: “No heat in the room”
Reviews.Author: nancy l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been waiting all year to stay at the Bonaventure. We are not rich people and had saved all year for this experience. We do not have heating at home so we were really looking forward to a nice warm room. The room was cold when we arrived. The thermostat did not work. We called the front desk, they sent up a technician immediately. He got the heat going. We went out for something to eat, came back and went to sleep and when we woke up in the morning it was really cold. Thermostat was not working again. Being private people we did not want to have the technician come in the room while we were in our pj's and in bed. We just left after breakfast. Other than that, everything was really nice. LA is a great city (we both have lived 15 miles south of LA our entire lives) and we never had experienced the city life. We would recommend going to downtown and stay and enjoy the scene but will we stay at the Bonaventure...probably not. Expensive with no heat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few details lacking”
Reviews.Author: gapoi99
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin before, and chose to stay there again recently. The hotel is nicely located right downtown, and if you are a Y member, you can use the Y on top of the parking garage right across the street. Overall, I like the place, and I'd stay there again. Great architecture, the rooms are well laid out, and have great views, are clean and the beds are comfortable. Everyone on staff was very pleasant. A small annoyance: being a guy, I should not have to hold the toilet seat up with one hand while I'm standing there using it. I thought this was a problem unique to the first room I had stayed in there at the Westin, but apparently it's all of them. The marble shelf sticks out too far so the toilet seat cannot be put back to where it will stay up on its own. Not a problem for women, but a bit of an annoyance for us guys. And for the price I paid for a Friday night, I think all of the outlets in the room should work. On one outlet, neither plug worked, so I wound up unplugging something in order to charge my laptop. This was a one night extension of a business trip. Would I stay at the Westin again? Yes, but I hope that some more things get detailed before then.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tasha M
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here. A little hard to get into though as there is no street entrance. Staff were very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Energy.”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: There is something exciting about staying downtown. The lights. The busy office people. The hustle and bustle. The sounds. Stayed at the hotel for one night. This place is HUGE! Really something to look at. Calming in a strange sort of way. I was one of the lucky ones and did NOT have a car to park. Avoided the $400/night parking fee. Ok, not $400, but not cheap. Hate paying for wifi at hotels, so I didn't. **I think the time has come for luxury hotels to STOP charging for wifi! The room cost should cover that, especially at these rates. If even a 2 star hotel can cover the cost of wifi for the guests as most do, pretty sure, Hilton, Weston, Marriott etc. can afford to do so. I had a King room. Small room, but decorated nicely. Flat Panel TV. Good coffee. FREE water (Good job on the "free" water Westin) and a small, but well appointed bathroom. Loved the leaf formed soap! The views from the 25th floor were OUTSTANDING. Open the curtain and you are faced with a sea of lights. Thousands and thousands of lights! Loved it. Even this high up in the sky, you hear a lot of city noise. But I liked the noise. Felt like I was in New York for a night. The only lights I did NOT like, were the lights in the room while I was trying to sleep. I like it dark when I sleep, but it seems more and more hotels are using TVs, Clocks, Phones, all with lights that emit all-night-long. A green light. A red light. My room looked like a lazer light show was going on! Had to use my shoe to block the green light from the TV. Had to use my other shoe to block the light from the clock. Had to cover the phones with books. Had to put a towel by the base of the door- you get the idea. What ever happened to dark rooms? In the morning I found USA Today at my door. I also found, at my door, 2 empty drinking glasses that had been there since the night before, when I checked in. I know the place is huge, but someone really should have picked those up. Overall, I really enjoyed the place. Felt very comfortable and clean. Was looking forward to taking a shower in the morning with the nice shampoo and soap. Bummer. The shower sucked. The curtain smelled of mildew and the actual space to take a shower could not have been any smaller. My arm kept touching the nasty curtain! Oh, and after 2 minutes, I was standing in about 5 inches of water. Gross. Horrible draining problems. But WOW! My hair smelled amazing after! I think if the shower would have been a better experience, this place would be at the top of my list as far as Downtown Hotels go. Of course, this is the ONLY Downtown hotel I have ever stayed at, but you get the idea...

Reviews.Title: “An old favorite back to form”
Reviews.Author: kapohokine
Reviews.Content: I love the Bonaventure. I have stayed there for many years, but the last couple of stays the old girl was starting to age a bit. Arriving in the underground carpark this time, I knew instantly that something had changed. It's been about a year since my last visit, and right off I noticed the proper desk for the valets and the fresh paint and wood accents. That feeling carried over up the series of escalators to the lobby where I felt like I was looking at an old friend for the first time and thinking something is different, then realizing that everything is different. Reception is a sleek desk of the same colors and wood accents used throughout the hotel now. It was inviting and chic, although the wood couldn't look anymore like plastic than it does. Check in was the usual quick en efficient affair, and then up in the famous glass elevators to my room. I booked a Tower Suite, which is love at the Bonaventure. They are two regular rooms adjoining through a sliding door. Both rooms are curved with stunning and iconic views of LA. I remember when the Bonaventure was the tallest building in LA. Now it's dwarfed by it's neighbors, but that just makes the views better, more dramatic. The Tower Suites have been completely refurbed, and look great. Still 1.5 baths, which is really handy, but everything has been upgraded and improved. The wet bar area is now attractive and useful, and there are shelves in the bathroom. The furniture is very comfortable, and the TV is now flat panel. The desk still faces the windows, so it's hard to work there because you end up staring at the activity going on below you. But it's a very useful desk, and there is plenty of light throughout the suite. My rate included breakfast, so down I went. The lobby restaurant has been thoughtfully redesigned and organized, and is bright, attractive, and welcoming. A far cry from the dark abyss of yore. And the food at the buffet was delicious, a big surprise and huge improvement from years past. Parking this time around was expensive, more than I remember from before. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even talkative without being chatty. Comprehensive improvements to this old favorite has breathed new life into it, and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: veliac
Reviews.Content: Mgr.,Marco Romero and his whole hotel staff, especially Ricardo Otis, made sure that our travel experiece exceeded our expectations. Stayed in renovated room on 26th floor--Heavenly beds were fantastic as well as amenities in the room (free water bottles were nice touches). We had a great view and such a relaxing stay. Parking was expensive, but Customer Service made up for it. Thanks again, Gil.

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: sdotkdotc
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire.com. Friendly check-in. Beautiful view (27th floor) and comfy and clean room. Parking is NOT FREE, didn't know this until I checked out. The deal I got through Hotwire made up for it though. I'd try something else before coming back. The location was perfect for why I needed a place in dtLA. Met up friends for a 30th birthday at a restaurant 10 minutes away, and then met up afterwards at Silo vodka bar which was 5 blocks from the hotel. After the bar, we ended up walking back to the hotel just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room nice view, but parking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: SoccerCA
Reviews.Content: Expedient and friendly check-in. Comfortable and clean room. Great view from high floor. Had reservation for 2 people but towels and robe only provided for 1 person, needed two calls to correct. Shower head partially clogged, needs replacement. A word of caution: parking fee is $38/night, valet only, no self-parking available.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: MissME3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a leisure trip with some friends, and I have to say, the view is excellent of the skyline of LA, and it is in the heart of Downtown, with so many attractions and sights - it seems to be like the NYC in LA - and so much to do and see. The hotel itself was nice- would have liked it to be a but more renovated, and the parking is $$$$ but overall the deal was good in terms of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay- Very large, impersonal hotel. Okay choice if you need to be downtown.”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: Pros: Downtown location - good if you need to be in the financial district and close enough to walk to the Staples Center. It is a good venue for conventions. About 3 miles to USC and close to highway access. Clean rooms and practical bathrooms (has the essentials) Comfortable bed Nice work out/exercise room Higher floors have nice views Cons: The hotel is large and very impersonal Valet parking expensive at $38/night Additional charge for internet service Rooms are small but efficient for a business trip Bathrooms renovated but showerheads were not. Water temp was never hot Came in very late at night and made 3 stops at different entrances until someone directed me that parking/check in was on Flower Street underground. Not a good location if you want to explore LA nightlife by foot. Take a cab to LA Live or other locations. Recommendations: Not great value if you are paying the regular rate but if you can get a discount on some of the online hotel booking sites, then it is okay. Personally, I prefer the Marriot and Biltmore in downtown L.A as I had better service, nicer rooms and breakfast included when I stayed at those hotels. However, my son stayed on another occassion at the Westin and said he was upgraded to a very contemporary, large suite and since he did not have the added parking expense or internet service felt that it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Four towers in downtown”
Reviews.Author: paperita
Reviews.Content: Wonderful in all respects. We are a family of 4 and at check-in they excused for giving us a suite on the 31st floor, but unfortunately with only a bed-room with two double-bed: the living room was like a small flat, more or less 50 square meters with sofas, table for 6 seats, kicthen and an additional marble bathroom, obviously wi-fi and double tv. It's naive but I loved the elevator of our towers: it's the one of 'True lies' with horse and Schwarzenegger! Also restaurant on the top of red tower ihas a fantastic view over skyline of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice property with a lot of restaurants inhouse”
Reviews.Author: aliciamlo
Reviews.Content: We really loved the view from our room. All the tall buildings and lights at night. So beautiful. This place had a lot of restaurants like food courts in the hotel. It was a little difficult to get to at times because of all the way streets but it's also easy to get onto the freeway from here. The parking was a bit expensive but it may be standard for all the hotels in downtown. The pool area was lovely . I felt like it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Staples Centre”
Reviews.Author: oldbeast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we went to LA to watch the Canucks vs. Kings. Close to the arena, within walking distance, and close to the Metro, which we used to get to Hollywood etc. Our room was a king bed and we found it to be quite small. Not bad since we were not in the room alot. It is right downtown, and parking is a premium at the hotel. We had rented a car, valet is $38 US per night. Convenient but expensive. Bars and main restaurants expensive but nice. They do have a "food Court" type floor but did not go there with so many other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: made1024
Reviews.Content: The location was near our work venue so it worked fine, however I'm not sure I'd like to stay here on a pleasure trip. In LA you always have to rent a car so that's a plus if staying here. Business center and lobby restuarant outrageously expensive, although the buffet breakfast was great and had a huge variety the price was still high. Across the street is johnny rockets and starbucks and on the premises (4th floor) they have a few places to eat. I think this hotel has so much potential but the restaurant floor looks as if it's all going out of business and with such a large property you'd think these places would actually earn money but they are "fast foodish" not nice restaurants. The area does not offer many places to eat and the 4th floor has a subway, pizza place, healthy food joint but nothing for a nice dinner. They do have an amazing restaurant on the 51st floor - outrageously expensive. The suite I was in (the green tower) was the best. HUGE! it had a guest area (sofa, fridge and half bathroom) then it's divided by sliding wooden doors to the main room which is quite big and the bathroom with a nice size closet. It was perfect for my week stay. Great views too especially from the elevators which work on the outside of the structure. Personnel was very nice and helpful at all times. Valet parking is available $38/night. If you stay here you must visit Plaza Olvera, a beautiful mexican street with vendors,music and great INEXPENSIVE food - it's about 8 minutes away and no, it's not walking distance :)

Reviews.Title: “Large and comfortable; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while visiting family. This is a very large hotel that seems to cater to the business traveler. Our basic room was large with a comfortable bed. My only complaint was that it had an adjoining room door. The occupant of that room came in at about 4:00 AM, and the loud banging of his door woke us. We were then kept awake by a loud phone conversation he was having. The next morning when we told our checkout receptionist about the problem, she apologized and suggested we request a non-adjoining room next visit...so keep that in mind when booking this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First LA visit”
Reviews.Author: socrog
Reviews.Content: Was in LA for the first time for Major League Soccer finals. Everything good about hotel. Staff was friendly, location was good (downtown), parking across street OK. Wireless internet conenction was TERRIBLE, but they did give us our money back on it. How can the budget hotels/motels have great wireless service and not charge, but the high-end hotels charge and always have problems????? And no free shuttle to airport?? Beds were very good, best thing about the place. Overall, a good place but definately not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and accomadations!”
Reviews.Author: DianaChicago
Reviews.Content: Mgr.,Marco Romero and his whole hotel staff made sure that our business travel experiece exceeded our expectations. Stayed in renovated room on 26th floor--beds were fantastic as well as amenities in the room (starbucks coffee, free water bottles were nice touches). Bell staff/ doormen were excellent and very helpful. Would stay here again!!! Only disapppoinment were the hotel shops....dated merchandise and strange hours.. Have breakfast a few blocks away at the French cafe, Bottega Louis....went twice!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbiestravels
Reviews.Content: The new renovation has brought life back to the Westin! I have returned (I travel weekly to LA) and love it. ONe thing - plumbing is a bit noisy between floors but I still enjoy staying there. Good gym, good bar..HEAVENLY BEDS. Eat at the Border Grill restaurant across the street - Excellent. Ceviche...best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: JimB58
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Bonaventure while spending time in Downtown LA. Location is good for downtown businesses, but a few blocks away from Staples Center and LA Live. Room was very clean and spacious, recently renovated. Bed was comfy, and staff was very attentive. For the money, it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MlovesB
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure's inside reminded me of a cross between an airport and low-end mall. The rooms were nice and clean. I especially liked how big our bathroom was and the abundance of towels provided. If you like big beds you'll like it here. We were told the rooms were recently renovated. The husband and I stayed here for one night and it was what we needed. If you are looking for a nice, clean room and safe place close to the good local downtown L.A. spots this is still a good place (with no frills). The service at registration was courteous. I hear the Suede lounge is pretty hip which is on the first floor. This used to be the spot in the 90's but the shine is a little tarnished. 3 1/2 rating (better than average)

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal, but very good”
Reviews.Author: wxzzy
Reviews.Content: At 1,700 rooms, this is the biggest hotel in Los Angeles. The front desk answers calls on the second ring, and requests are met in minutes. However, with up to a thousand check-ins a day, and staff that can accommodate a dozen languages, donâ€™t expect the personal touches. Not a B&B. Think about it as dealing with AMEX as opposed to the local plumber. Good customer service, but scripted. The rooms are small and pis shaped, but itâ€™s a 70's hotel and they have to cram kings where queens once lived. The views make up for it and the elevators are the best (Schwarzenegger rides a horse into one in True Lies). The interior public spaces are huge, unimaginably so, and laid out with four floors of shops, bridges and tunnels. You could spend a day just walking inside. Outside is worth a walk too: Chinatown, the Bradbury Building, Grand Central Market, the theater district, Little Italy and Little Tokyo. A lot of people write off downtown LA because it can look like a demilitarized zone. It is worth a look and there are people everywhere. The revolving bar attracts people who think a revolving bar is cool: yahoos in baseball caps and woo girls. The valet take 10 minutes so call ahead from the room. Also, its $ 38.00. High in the normal world, but cheep in LA. Itâ€™s a great hotel to get lost in, just know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Looking Hotel With a Few Negatives”
Reviews.Author: LincolnAdams
Reviews.Content: Happy to say my stay was bed bug free despite finding several complaints of bed bugs in the bed bug registry. I think they are exercising due diligence to keep the rooms spotless considering even a single and unconfirmed report of bed bugs can be a death knell for its business. The hotel has been the setting for several blockbuster movies too, including one of my favorites, In The Line of Fire. It was a real treat to be standing in the same elevator John Malkovich and Clint Eastwood were in for the elevator scene. Westin consists of 4 towers that are color coded. Once you know the color code of the tower your room is in, it should be fairly easy to navigate around. If you want to exit onto Figueroa Street, you will need to take the escalator up from the lobby, but other than that it was easy for me to get around. The rooms were clean and the maid service very prompt and thorough. Valet parking experience was acceptable, sometimes the attendees will be a bit harried and confused, but they're hard working and bring your car out quickly even when you don't call ahead. There are a few dining options on the 4th floor, but to access it you need to ride to either the 3rd or 5th floor I believe and then take the stairs, so it's a bit of an inconvenience, plus their opening hours don't usually extend to the evenings, so you'll either need to head out or order room service. Room service was for me was predictably expensive but actually pretty satisfying. The hot chocolate itself might have been the best deal: while it's $5, it comes in a huge pitcher and could easily serve 4-5 people. Delicious too. My major complaints had to do with Wi-Fi and the holds they put on my PayPal card. I was there for BlogWorld so it was expected that everyone in creation would be using their Wi-Fi, but I especially needed it because of having to get my iPhone replaced after the antenna stopped working. I was trying to do an iCloud restore which only works through wi-fi and despite being at the hotel for 4 nights, the wi-fi STILL wasn't good enough for me to fully complete my restore. There were times when the wi-fi disappeared altogether, leaving me to use my cell phone or a wired connection just to get online. To be fair though, the wired connection did work really well. Still, it was the wi-fi I desperately needed, and the hotel failed miserably there. Secondly, I understand that hotels will sometimes put a hold on your debit card if you opt to use that instead of a credit card. What I don't understand or accept is putting a $824 hold on my card. Seriously? Because I opt for the convenience of using a PayPal card (which I reserve for all my travel expenses) it was necessary to hijack almost $1000 of my money? This, despite the fact that the room had ALREADY BEEN PAID FOR. While I understand a hold for valet parking and room service, holding the cost of the room when it was previously paid for and debited already was ridiculous. Normally I might have given the hotel 4 stars, but this issue grated on my nerves so much I deducted another star. :-P

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent ; nice property with unique design”
Reviews.Author: NWbySE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the LA Convention Center. It's a very nice hotel and the staff was wonderful. The rooms are nicely designed. I was traveling solo, and took a room with one king-size bed. I did see the rooms with two doubles, and that felt a bit cramped. I liked the design, although it did take a bit of getting used to. I enjoyed sitting in the bar downstairs with friends (although their beer selection leaves much to be desired). The bar at the top, which revolves, is worth a visit for the view. I was grateful that the Westin gives you bottled water (rather than charging some ridiculous amount) and the refrigerator is not an electronically-monitored overpriced minibar. These are my pet peeves with other higher-end hotels. It shows consideration for guests. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite with an amazing view, terrible wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded for being an SPG member to probably the best and largest suite I've ever stayed in, I wish I hadn't been there for work travel as it would have been an awesome suite to have partied with a bunch of friends! My entire stay was great with the exception of one huge problem, the wi-fi in my room! It never worked successfully despite many calls to the help desk, which really wasn't helpful! It sounds like a common problem for those using an ipad2 at least what the help desk told me, but basically the hotel is ALL cement and therefor the negatively effects the wi-fi they told me, very annoying however after my complaints I did get some free points for my troubles! I would recommend if wi-fi isn't important to you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design, cool rotating bar”
Reviews.Author: Jcxny
Reviews.Content: Westin hotel has an really cool design with 4 column elevators that lead you to your room. Staff is friendly and service is good. Got a free upgrade being a SPG member. The 35th floor bar is cool because it rotates around the LA skyline. The only complain I have is that if you got a car in the valet be prepared to wait. The staff in the garage is not all to friendly and the one I encountered actually had a nasty attitude. Getting your car is a 10-15 minute wait at least. I guess I am just not use to this type of service

Reviews.Title: “Solid DTLA Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TheHonestWord
Reviews.Content: While not quite up to the standards of other Westin properties, the Bonaventure continues to be a solid choice for accommodations in DTLA. Definitely worth a visit; clean and comfortable. One thing about this place; it confuses most people. Almost everyone I come across has troubles navigating around the property and gets lost at some point. Handicapped individuals might want to consider another property. Overall, it's fun and a good place to stay for a night if in town for business. The rates are usually pretty reasonable and the rooms themselves are comfortable, decently appointed and offer great views of the city. This hotel has been here a long time and will continue to be a good value if you need a night or two in DTLA.

Reviews.Title: “Always fun, but starting to show its age”
Reviews.Author: RussontheRoad
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure is always a fun place to stay and has a great Hollywood history - as you walk in from the parking garage. However, the property is starting to show its age - dark interiors and a layout that is not always easy to maneuver. Worst problem is valet parking - a very high price and slow response. Checking out yesterday it took 30 minutes for them to retrieve our car. And most times it is at least 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: JShooman
Reviews.Content: This Westin was clean with newly remodeled rooms. The parking valet is $38/night which is a little pricey, especially since it took a while to get the car because of the size of the hotel. But, the hotel is in a convenient area in downtown LA. The hotel is a little big and feels like a convention hotel. But for the right price (which I paid) it is a nice stay. Our view was nice (looking onto the Hollywood sign). Overall, impersonal, but clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sdsmilecrafter
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at the Westin Bonaventure. While the hotel stay was very pleasant, the parking situation was a nightmare! First, they charge $38 to park per night! This was for valet with in and out priviledges, you can't self park. They gave us our ticket and told us to call 10-15 minutes in advance to have the car waiting for us. The first time we needed our car, we called down in advance just like they told us in order to have it ready. It was not. We had to wait as if we had just requested it. That was nothing compared to the next day. First we tried to call down in advance to have the car ready. No one answered. Repeatedly. Next we called the front desk who told us that parking was not taking advance calls, we'll have to go down and request the car. When we came downstairs, the line to get your car was so long, they had someone distributing water bottles. People had been waiting 45 minutes to an hour for their car. Luckily, we didn't need our car immediately. I felt bad for anyone who needed to get their car to get to the airport to catch a plane. In the Westin's favor I have to say they did refund our $38 parking fee. But what a mess this was. I would recommend parking across the street in the parking structure instead.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wise decision”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Westin. This hotel is top notch. The rooms are well equipped with a small refrigerator, security box, working desk area, flat screen HD TV and the bed was nice and comfortable. I stayed on the 21st floor nice view of downtown. This hotel is huge. Probably this why I got a good deal through priceline $90 per night. Parking is offered through a valet service which charges 38 dollars per 24 hours; however right next to the Westin there the World Trade CTR Parking which charges 8 dollars after 4:30 p.m. including Saturdays and Sundays. There prices go up on weekdays. There an elevator from the parking that will take to the main lobby of the World Trade Ctr. Parking and from there take the electric escalators that will take directly to a bridge connecting you to the Westin Hotel. I must mention using the valet service for 38 dollars per night you have in and out Privileges where as the 8 dollar special you do not have in and out privelige. You will have to pay 8 dollars everytime drive your car out in of the lot. I had a incident with the employee who is charge of greeting you once you pull up with the car to drop off your pasengers and luggage. I only had one suitcase and a backpack with I carry my laptop and electronics. As I opened the trunk the employee reach out for luggage with me asking for help and scratch paint/finish on my car. I did not a choice but to report the incident at check-in. Management are supposed to call me and forward the claim to their insurance company. All of the employees were very attentive and professional. I was offered free breakfast and free internet for the two nights I stayed at the Westin. Independently whether I had this mishap with my car all of the employees from housekeeping to the waiters at the restaurant, at check-in and security were courteous and always willing to go out their way to answer my questions or request. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again it was a wise decision.

Reviews.Title: “5 levels beyond exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. The rooms are first class and the employees are attentive and responsive. I do have to tell you about a small problem though and how it was solved. On my last day there (4 nights) I sent some clothes to the laundry. By 6:30 they had not been returned. Several calls to the Guest Hotline and an frantic search by hotel employees finally found the clothes a few minutes before I was checking out for the Red Eye flight back home. It seems that do to some screw up my clothes had not been laundered but it really wasn't a big deal because I was heading home and could get them cleaned there. The hotel staff fell all over themselves apologizing for the problem. Although I had been charged for the laundry they immediately removed the charges from my bill without me even having to think about it. The manager came over to personally apologize after the customer service person had already apologized and given me 5,000 points on my SPG account. I told them that this was really no big deal and that mistakes happen and I was just glad they found the clothes. They insisted on taking my luggage to the curb and get me a taxi. While going through security at LAX the manager left me a message again apologizing and raising the point credit to 10,000 points. Now THAT is A+++ customer service. Anyone can excel when things go well but the test of a truly great service business is how they handle things when there is a problem. You can't beat this hotel for that. I had just come up to LA from 5 miserable nights in the Hilton Gaslamp in San Diego and have written a not-so-nice review of that place. I think Hilton Hotels can kiss my 30 or 40 nights per year goodbye. I am moving my lodging to Starwood properties. Much, much better. You should do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown- visit the lounge on 35th floor!”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: The most confusing part of finding this hotel was the hidden underground valet. Although I will excuse it since they have a waiting area complete with printers so you can check in for your flight while you wait for your car! Nice touch. We checked in and were given a room in the yellow tower on the 20th floor. Nice views, the service at the lobby bar was quick and wen I sent back a drink because it didn't taste right they brought me a replacement to my satisfaction. We went to a game at Staples center and this was very closeby- about a $6 taxi ride or about 8-10 blocks. Do NOT miss Bonavista revolving lounge and the souvenir drink glasses, we had such a great time. Our air conditioning decided to heat up to 90 degrees at 1:30am and staff was in our room within 5 minutes of our call to fix it! I was impressed with the friendly and attentive service at every restaurant down to the valets and maintenance staff. While the room leaves a bit to be desired- rather small for $200 the views and the staff make this hotel a charm when visiting Los Angeles. I would definitely consider staying here again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay for Staples Center Concert”
Reviews.Author: unchindeliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we saw a concert at the Staples Center. The elevators are very fun, and I asked for a good view and was pleased with the 24th floor. Rooms are not huge, but have great floor to ceiling views, and are very clean. Our floor was incredibly quiet, I did not hear a peep from anyone during our stay. Easy walk by plenty of restaurants to the concert. The only downside was the overnight parking was $38/night. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “It's A Bit Odd, But In A Good Way...My Fave Hotel In LA”
Reviews.Author: dv8r
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often, in the dozens of times, and really have few complaints. I've been in love with this place since it was used as a futuristic backdrop set for NBC's Buck Rogers in the 25th Century shortly after opening in the early 1980's and have been coming back ever since. It's recently had a slight makeover to update the fixtures & look, but it's still a glass-tastrophe & crazy concrete cavern of a lobby. Phil Spector and his murder trial legal team loved it so much awhile back they rented a whole floor, ran up a huge bill in the 100s of thousands and then didn't pay...isn't that just so LA?
