I read other reviews and the things some people complain about, I find endearing or have just become used to. I consider this place my favorite 4 star budget hotel...and what I mean is that I usually get the rate reduced as much as half via a bidding site, and never park in the hotel's own garage which adds $40 to your bill a day (parking $8 a night one bldg over at World Trade Center garage)... I also rarely order anything from room service or the hotel's restaurant or bars...I'll buy beer at a little shop on the third floor for $2 and walk around drinking those looking at all the plaques from all the movies that have been shot here. It's a big busy place & after check in, no one is probably going to hold your hand, so just start adventuring and you'll figure it all out. It's in the heart of LA's downtown biz district, which can be a little boring or bleak if you don't know where to go for fun, but even if you don't leave the building their are worthwhile ways to kill time. Check out the actual beer brewing pub on the outdoor plaza, or go the top of the hotel for the rotating spinning bar with a view. I once got so buzzed at the center lobby bar before closing time, that I then got lost in this hotel and it took me over an hour to get back to the right tower and figure out on which floor was my room. The drawbacks are there is no free internet, that's pretty standard policy in most big-city big name properties, so bite the bullet and get used to it. The bedding, as in most Westin properties is always superior to whatever I sleep on at home.I like the baffling maze like winding stairwells that still disorientate me on my way to buy sundries, and cheaper quick serve food from the independent vendors that inhabit the third floor, which is absolutely inaccessible via any elevator I know of. If you find the weird little food court, you'll run into counters offering pizza, pasta, middle-eastern fare, salads and Asian dishes...and of course the food group known as Fried. If you are on a budget, this may be far preferable to ordering room service or dining in some stodgy steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for people working in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Highland_Saint
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, albeit a bit corporate, but that's exactly the market they are aiming for with the location being in central downtown LA. The building is iconic and easy to recognise. We had a standard double room in the Blue Tower. The room was well equipped and the bed was really comfy. Within the building there are a number of shops and a great micro-brewery in house. The problem with this place is not the quality of the hotel, but more to do with the fact there isn't much to do downtown as its in the financial services district and this part of the city pretty much empties after 6pm when the workers go home. We didnt have a car, but that was mainly because the parking here is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay after clubbing all night”
Reviews.Author: kaisuva
Reviews.Content: We did not do much but sleep...aaaah, the heavenly beds are indeed heavenly after a night of partying and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, sketchy food court and parking was rather pricey”
Reviews.Author: Dave-in-SA
Reviews.Content: After a month of travelling California we ended up here, we got woken up both nights, the first night neighbours on one side were having an all night partyand the next night it sounded like the other neighbours were acting out scenes from "debbie does dallas". Parking was a ripper at $40 a night which is what hotel guests can expect to pay, but it is also the norm for downtown LA. If you are staying here make sure to time your exits and entries right because traffic can be stand still. In addition if you don't plan to eat at the restaurants in the hotel, then don't bother with a trip to their food court, its siff and dirty and the food joints don't lookappealing at all. Our next few nights we stayed down near manhattan beach at a quarter of the price and it was 100 times more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Experience in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: maxbialy
Reviews.Content: As luck would have it, Priceline got me a great rate ($90.00 a night) over a holiday weekend in downtown Los Angeles. The front desk was very supportive, from small tasks like cleaning my window to generous favors. The clerk gave me complimentary Wi-Fi and put me on a high floor so I could photograph the panoramic view of the city. The breakfast buffet was fresh and reasonable, the night time revolving restaurant was very impressive, the view and the service. Valet parking was swift and always courteous. The surrounding neighborhood has many attractions and the freeway access close by gets you anywhere you need to go. They were filming an action film just outside the hotel in the middle of the night, so "Hollywood" was even closer than normal!!! I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a girlfriend for a fun weekend. Overall it was just ok. Price of the room was reasonable, price of the valet parking is not, but to be expected in LA. Our room was typical Westin except for the bed. The heavenly bed that is usually heavenly in Westins was not. We had a room with 2 doubles and both beds seemed to have strange lumpy soft areas at the bottom. Bathroom was nice and had the typical decor of a Westin. Could have used 2 bathrobes vs 1 (couldn't have been bothered to call down to request another), otherwise satisfied. The hotel itself is huge - getting to the right tower and down to the parking took some time. Also, trying to find restaurants on the upper floors (with the escalators shut down) on Saturday night proved to be a little challenging. Maybe this wouldn't have seemed like such an issue if we hadn't spent the day in the LA traffic (which is absolutely insane). As for the location of the hotel -- filming of the new Batman movie was going on, so getting in and out of the hotel with road closures proved extremely tricky (on the Saturday night we had the police move a barrier to let us over into the hotel parking). I'd make my reservation over the phone and ask about any upcoming shoots as they seem to happen pretty regularly at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel197299
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for five nights in September. Staff was friendly and hospitable. I was greeted by concierge, Jorge Arriaga as soon as I stepped into the hotel. He was passing by and wanted to know if I needed help with anything. He gave me directions to Walgreens and Rite Aid (about five blocks away). He also gave me a map, which was easy to read. I had no problem walking near the hotel to find restaurants. I had the buffet breakfast most mornings in the hotel. Cost, tax and tip were about $25.00. I discovered that IHOP was four blocks away. There is a food court in the hotel, which I did not use. There is also an underground food court in the next block. It was easy to navigate around this large hotel once you understood the lay out. I think there were three or four towers. They were color coordinated. The outside elevators was a little intimidating at first. After the second day, I looked forward to riding them while taking in the beautiful view. The room was clean and well furnished. It may have been recently remodeled, I do not know. When the bellman brought me my bags; he wanted to know if I would like some bottles of water. It appears that water is left only in certain rooms. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in the business district. I enjoyed walking aound exploring the area. The hotel also offers many sightseeing tours. I was in town for a National Event. Transportation was provided to the various functions. I could have walked one mile to the convention center if we did not have transportation and felt safe. My only problem with the hotel was the FedEx manager. He quoted me a price to ship some things. After he packed, sealed and labeled my box, the cost doubled. The next day I shared the incident with the concierge, Mr. Arriaga. He apologized for what had happened. He also offered me a meal for two to rectify the matter. I felt that it was an acceptable offer. If I am ever in downtown Los Angeles again. I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...other than it's location”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for 3 days and I liked it enough...once I finally got there. Getting to this hotel is not easy especially if you are coming from LAX. The hotel is located in downtown Los Angeles which without traffic can take roughly 20 minutes which is completely unrealistic during the day. I would say give yourself an hour during rush hour to get there. Also, parking there is not cheap. I happened to know about the traffic so I decided to use a local limo company because I don't care much for regular taxis and I didn't feel like driving myself and dealing with parking. I used this company, 1800fly800.com and it was a great, comfortable ride. I recommend using a private transportation service like them if you are planning to stay at the hotel instead of driving yourself or a taking a taxi from the airport. One more item about the location, there isn't really much to do downtown. You have to head to West LA (Santa Monica area) to find more night life and shopping. Anyway, enough ranting about the location. As other reviewers have mentioned on here, the hotel is huge. I felt like I was staying at a hotel on the strip in Vegas...minus the casino. The rooms are pretty spacious, though not quite as big as I had envisioned. The bed makes up for that flaw though, they are really comfortable. The bathroom is decent. The one thing that I like about this hotel's location is the view at night time. All in all, I gave this star 4 stars instead of 5 was mainly the location. Next time, I will try a hotel in Santa Monica. I do like how big the hotel is, the staff is really friendly if you treat them right, and the beds are really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location...”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Westin Bonaventure and the more I think about it the more Iâ€™d like to go back. The staffs were helpful as with most hotels, and there were no issues during my five-day stay. The rooms were a good size and bathroom was clean. I used the gym and pool during my stay and enjoyed both facilities. There are shops within this hotel, although I donâ€™t know too many people to go shopping at hotels. At first I did not enjoy the extra fees for valet parking and felt it was excessive for force people to pay for the service. After calling down for my car several times I am now a fan of valet parking, just call 20 minutes before you head down. Location has nothing close and downtown LA can be a bit shady so going out at night is interesting. This hotel has a running circle on the 4th floor for people to jog around. Lots of mothers use this area to walk with a stroller, and itâ€™s a first for hotels that Iâ€™ve seen. By far the best part though is that a food court exists on the 3rd floor providing food for cheap; great for people like me tired of being ripped off buying food in hotels. In-room wireless internet cost money as usual, unless you know the special code: [--] Enjoy!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Tauranga, Bay Of Plenty, New Zealand
Reviews.Title: “Massive hotel but perhaps a little tired?”
Reviews.Author: Biglobb
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, good variety of bars and restuarants. The rooms are pretty spacious and have very comfortable beds and power shower. The hotel seems a little dated however, but I would not hold that against them.. still a great hotel and worth staying at. I stayed here on business and is a good central location. Buffet breakfast was pretty good if not a little on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “wish I could give it 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: bman6262
Reviews.Content: This Westin in the heart of downtown LA was probably very cool when it first opened and while it is an overall nice hotel it is now a little bit dated. Beds were comfortable and the staff was great but everything could have used a bit of of an overhaul. I was on the 30th floor and my room was nice but a little small. Breakfast buffet was pretty typical but very good. Downtown LA is not the most exciting place but if you had to stay down there the Westin would be a good place to stay. There are several cool places to eat around the area and I never felt unsafe walking late at night.

Reviews.Title: “A great revitalizing stay. The only downside is the parking”
Reviews.Author: LeCreuset
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. I get great service, a great location convenient to the freeway, and a wonderful, updated room. If I feel dusty and tired tooling around LA, this hotel is great for refreshing me and giving me an oasis to recharge and go out some more! bathroom great, bed AMAZING (almost as good as my super invested bed at home). great service--including generous pet policy for those who care. nice ice machines, 24 hour room service, convenient gym, nice pool... really--a worthwhile place to stay. and i've stayed at the higher rated Omni nearby. While the Omni is good, I'd say my stay at Westin B is a much better value easily. And I'll keep patronizing the Westin B as long as they continue to treat me great. The main downside, which is common in DTLA hotels is the parking. It costs 30+. If you're a preferred member (Starwood) you might be able to work some wonderful freebies. 1. upgrade to suite on starwood floors (typically green towers?) 2. 50% off parking (not free, but still great. in the past i've gotten 100% off, but i've heard the parking garage was bought by a company) 3. free drinks during happy hour with a letter 4. free wifi if you can get these, then staying here is an absolute huge value. i hesitate to say all this, but i do tip $20 to the front desk person and I don't ask for anything in return. i just ask them to do their best to look for complimentary upgrades (a la $20 trick in las vegas). on the weekends, and if the hotel is not busy, this can help. but i don't impose it on the front desk people and demand things. And I do often get my room via priceline/betterbidding research--so the extra tip is simply part of my expected cost in my opinion. the internet alone i get free pays for the tip. the service people there are smart and respectable--so if you treat them nicely, they will be nice in return.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MajDollison
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. First off you can't begin talking about this hotel without discussing the view in the rooms. I was lucky enough to be on the 25th floor. It was amazing. Had a beautiful view of Fifth and Flower, below, scene of the famous shoot-out in Heat (1995). Definitely the highlight of the trip. I was there for a meeting and found the catered food to be great. Valet was convenient, but pricey, however the conference paid for it. Very convenient. Close to LAX, and very close to Hollywood and the LA Freeways. A subway station was a few blocks away. It had a an arcade of shops, which didn't seem to be doing that well, but they had nice things and they were on sale. I got an extended checkout. Elegant bathroom. Pool looked beautiful down below but I didn't get to use it. This is a resort hotel in the middle of downtown Los Angeles. Just spectacular. An older property, but the rooms had been redone and were incredibly modern.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel so big you don't have to leave, but you should”
Reviews.Author: tiger02trip
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a huge hotel with 5 large towers, numerous restaurants and shops, a spa, pool, gym, it is effectively a city. You don't have the leave the hotel, but it's not nice enough to rank alongside resorts. This is a big Westin, more akin to a Las Vegas hotel or a convention center hotel. Don't expect personalized service and if you like square boxes; note that the Westin's rooms sit within cylindrical towers. I stayed in a standard King room. It was pretty standard, a little on the small side and equipped with thinner walls than I expected. I couldn't hear the neighborâ€™s full conversation, but this isn't a place where you can play the music loudly. The room had a small lounge chair, king bed, flat screen and desk. The bathroom, also small had a shower/tub. While fine for 1 person, I wouldn't recommend if your traveling party is greater than 2. The location is downtown LA, not near any tourist destinations. The downtown area is getting more residential so there are some nice nearby restaurants as well as plenty of Starbucks locations if you want to skip the hotel restaurant. I arrived very late my first night and went to the restaurant. For $25, I got a beer and a bland burger, though the view from the hotels penthouse revolving restaurant was nice. Parking in LA is notoriously expensive and the Westin fulfills that reputation at $35 per day. If you're looking for nightlife, hotels in Hollywood, Westwood, and West Hollywood, may be more to your liking, but the Westin delivers a consistent (albeit bland and mass produced) product or good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: claremac1
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here on 2 separate occasions. Both times our room was clean and a decent size. The views from the rooms are good of the business district. Just down the road is a food court and also some shopping, macys is a five minute walk. It is also not too far from the airport, $50 cab ride. This is why we stayed there the second time. On the first occasion we did not have a good experience. We went to the hotel bar the night before so didn't get to bed till late. At 830am we were awoken by hammering from the room above. I can only presume they were having some sort of renovation. I rang the front desk to complain and was told that they would sort it out and call back. About 35 mins later it was still going on. We rang the front desk again and they apologised and said they would speak to a manager. The hammering did then seem to move to another room but we could still hear it faintly and never received a callback from reception. The second time we booked again in this hotel for two nights. Although we had a negative experience we felt this hotel was still good value (booked on hotwire) and in a good location for what we wanted. We were arriving from Cabos mexico and missed our flight (not our fault). We booked into the westin in cabos for the night and contacted LA to let them know we would not be arriving that day. When we did I spoke with the front desk about a refund for our first night and they explained that hotwire would be responsible. After speaking to hotwire I was getting nowhere so the gentleman on the front desk took over and spoke to the manager who in turn contacted hotwire for us and arranged for a refund. This was a big relief as we had spent so much extra on having to buy another plane ticket and booking the hotel in mexico. I really appreciate that they went out of their way to help us and thought this was excellent customer service. On this basis I can only imagine that our first experience was an unfortunate one off. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in the area the rooms are good and I can now say that the staff are extremely helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RSH01
Reviews.Content: Our initial room was nice and clean but we had neighbors who were there to "party" in LA. The hotel tried to diminish the noise in a very professional manner but at same time moved us to a small suite which was amazing(great view, comfortable king bed, separate siting area with sleeper sofa for my kids). The views from the hotel are excellent and location idea for us since we were visiting our son at USC. The concierge went out of his way to help us with restaurants. I really like the hotel and for LA, I thought prices were quite good. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing. Seemed tired and old”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night enroute from Las Vegas to Vancouver. We chose the hotel because we had stayed in other Westin Hotels in Australia and found them to be first class. First impressions were disappointing. The reception was rather bleak and looked as if it could do with a makeover. The staff were pleasant and helpful though. Our room, when we eventually got to it, had wet carpet. Obviously it had been shampooed quite recently. There was also a leak in the bathroom, adjacent to the toilet. On mentioning this to reception, they quickly moved us to another room, which was a lot more inviting. We stayed in and had room service. Our meal arrived promptly and was delicious. And we found the bed to be very comfortable. Next morning our account was processed quickly and the doorman checked for us that our coach to the airport was on time. We did enjoy reading the plaques near the elevators that told which movies had been made at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but the property feels a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: gcjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business this week for two nights. Great location if you have business in downtown LA. It is not cheap, but then nothing in LA is. The property seems a bit dated. The rooms have been upgraded recently, but I particularly disliked that they don't use fitted bottom sheets on the beds. There are fewer restaurants on the promenades than in years past, but I did have nice meals at the main bar and at the Bonaventure Brewing Company. All in all an okay stay, but I don't think I'd stay here again unless it was on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality and location”
Reviews.Author: hernargentino
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get an amazing rate through Priceline and received a 4 star treatment, Great Location, Fine rooms, awesome swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Average, but comfortable stay in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: solotrvllr
Reviews.Content: For my first time in downtown LA, I decided to chance it with the Westin despite the mixed reviews. Overall, I had a comfortable stay, but the housekeeping could have done a much better job. I might stay here again, but for the price, I think the Hilton Checkers two blocks away is probably better. Check-in and check-out was quick; although there seemed to only two or three people at the front-desk at any given point despite there being at least 6 or 7 check-in counters. No one at the Starwood preferred guest check-in all the times that I checked. I got a room on the 27th floor, which was reasonably clean and large enough. The nicest thing about the room was the floor to ceiling view. The king bed was large and comfortable. The flat screen TV had a good selection of channels and movies. The bathroom was very clean, but the tub had a few stains - an indicator of the age of the place, more so than anything else. Plenty of plush towels and a complementary robe. The amount of hot water and shower pressure was also pretty good. The trash bins in the room were not empty on check-in which leads me to think that the room was hastily cleaned. I immediately checked the bed to see if the cleaning was superficial, but it appeared to be clean enough. Two of the pillows had a couple of small spots of blood, so I was worried about bedbugs. It took a couple of tries calling the front desk to get housekeeping to come and clean the room again. There was no complementary water in the room on check-in, but the housekeeping included this on the second day of the stay. The hotel complex is a labyrinth, and the concrete structure is reminiscent of a shopping mall, but I actually liked the architecture. There were some reviews about waiting ages for the elevators but this was not my experience. In fact, I felt that average time I needed to wait for was 30 seconds or less. I was given complementary internet access which was unexpected and pleasant - connecting to it was quick and it was fast. Parking and internet costs in general are somewhat astronomical in the area anyway. Overall, I would give this place 3.5 stars. If they paid attention to some small details (like ensuring housekeeping is immaculate), I would give it 4 - 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smartmart4475832
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to LA and we stayed at the Bonaventure both times. The rooms are spaceous and have fabulous views, the glass lifts (elevators) on the outside of the building are amazing as are the views from the cocktail bar. The staff were all very polite and helpful and gave us a walking tour map taking in all of the intersting sights without having to worship celebrity status LA has a wealth of culture to enjoy and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bring Your Car”
Reviews.Author: cmlvngstn
Reviews.Content: I loved our stay, the hotel is lovely, the staff is kind and accomodating, however the charge to park your car is outrageous. We spent $55/day to park our car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Interesting”
Reviews.Author: angelfish6428
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfy, the hotel was beautiful (lobby was having some renovations, but could tell it will be gorgeous when done), the rooms were interesting. Our room had lovely floor to ceiling windows and was circle shaped! Each of 4 elevators had a theme and I'm guessing the rooms were the different shapes - circle, triangle, rectangle, and for the life of me I can't remember the 4th! Convenient downtown LA location, beautiful view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: germatt2
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, yet a little small. All of the staff were extremely nice. The location is great and easy entrance access to the 110 freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Awkward Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sirk98
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here to be closer to some friends on a trip to LA. While the hotel looks like the future (I suppose, if you were here in 1970), it is very awkward in layout. It became a PAIN trying to just get to the elevator from the garage. Staff was exceptionally friendly, but I was very annoyed that they wouldnt give us a room with a king sized bed because we booked through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort - get a room opposite the freeway”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: I'm coming up on my third trip to the Westin in 2 months. Book through Hotiwire and get a $125 or so per night rate. Rooms are well done; so far noise from other occupants has not been noticable. Last trip though, I had a room facing the 110 - at 9:00 PM seemed like the window was open. Very noisy. If you check-in around 5-6, when the traffic is slow, you don't notice so much. But, when the freeway opens up later in the night, and speeds approach 60 or higher, you hear every truck and motorcycle that goes by. And this is LA - they go by all night. Do stay here, just get on the opposite side of the freeway if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTrinaWilliams
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure Hotel was a beautiful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. Though the rooms were kind of small, the view was beautiful and the room was beautiful. There are several restaurants in the hotel (full food court on the 4th floor), although because it was a holiday weekend, most of the restaurants were closed. The hotel is within walking distance of the metro station. Bus service is right outside. Macys and the Staples Center is also within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, charges for everything possible”
Reviews.Author: Vivian L
Reviews.Content: On top of the charges for parking ($35) and internet ($12), local call starts at $1.50. Unlucky for me, I forgot to bring a copy of one of my reversions, I was directed to the business center, which took me 10 minutes to find, because it is inside the FEDEX office, and the hotel staff I talked to didn't bother to tell me!! And, of course, I had to pay for that one piece of paper, $1.05. It is a big deal when you're staying 4 nights and are paying such high room charges already, then find everything other than the bed you sleep in costs ADDITIONAL!!! I was traveling in the mid-west the week before, a 2-star hotel I stayed at offered free wi-fi and free access to their business center. I will never come back!

Reviews.Title: “A cool building but watch out for fees”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was for us a spur of the moment Priceline find, and after learning where we'd be staying, we were pessimistic based on reviews here. We were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel more awesome than we had thought. Nice robes, a good bed, and a freshly reno-ed room with an amazing view from the 23rd floor! The rooftop pool is clean, the perfect temperature, and quietly hidden above the bustle of the city. The architecture of the building is really interesting and the exterior elevators are fun to ride in. As other posters have mentioned, the $35 mandatory valet parking fee is kind of lame, and we opted out of the $13 daily internet to keep our costs down, but since we got such a good deal on Priceline, this hotel ended up costing about the same as our airport hotel the night before, and it was much of higher caliber. Also a note on the neighbourhood - we (small town Canadians) had been scared into not looking elsewhere for cheaper parking fearing mugging or break-ins, but we walked to Pitfire Pizza (about 6-8 blocks away) and back that evening, and although the neighbourhood does have some interesting residents, its quite busy and we felt safe the entire time. I think if your times worked out OK, you could find a deal on parking in one of the neighbouring office towers. There are some flow issues due to ongoing renovations, but when they are complete, the Westin Bonaventure will be a solid choice in downtown LA hotels. At which point we probably won't be able to afford it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Rude Service...Will Never Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: pickelchick
Reviews.Content: We are currently at this hotel and have spent one of the three nights we reserved. We used Priceline to book this hotel and will probably forfeit what we paid to go to a different hotel tonight. Service has been lacking to say the least. They put us in a "corner room" which they admitted has issues with their wi-fi (which is not free by the way). As I am typing this, we had room service delivered and I saw the person who delivered it roll his eyes when my husband checked to make sure that our order was correct. I know that we are Priceline customers, but long story short, we are leaving this hotel today to go to an establishment that knows how to treat its customers regardless of how they paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: tuesdayjones
Reviews.Content: I booked in last minute when our flight was delayed in LA overnight. I just wanted a nice hotel, with good room service, in-house movies and quality toiletries. I thought I would be safe to go to a Westin hotel. Maybe Westin as a brand in the US is third tier, because it isn't in other countries I have stayed in. I am usually delighted by my Westin experiences. This was dreadful. It is a concrete monstrosity, ugly, dark poky rooms, no in-house movies, just tv channels. Room service was a major rip off, over cooked steaks for $40+ and an inhouse wifi so complicated to join I gave up. In addition toiletries was soap and some cheap shower get.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MA_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in August. We were in LA for a concert and wanted to stay Downtown to be close to the Staples Ctr. Our room (on the 18th floor of the blue tower) was small but clean. According to the front desk staff it was recently remodeled. The staff were great - very nice and responsive. We didn't have a car so parking wasn't a factor for us. My 10 year old daughter loved the elevators and the pool. One evening we went to the revolving lounge on the 34th floor and enjoyed watching the sun set over the city. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. We flew into LAX and took the Union Station FlyAway bus then the metro red line to 7th St/Metro Ctr then walked a few blocks up Flower Street to the hotel (don't take Figueroa as that entrance to the hotel was closed). It was a very easy commute.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are incredible - rest of the hotel not so impressive”
Reviews.Author: schmelke1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night on business -- in a gorgeous suite -- absolutely beautiful, huge, and with great amenities. If I judged this hotel based on the initial reception and the lobby, this would have been negative. We were not allowed to unload at the hotel entrance, but in the garage. If anyone would have told us how far we were from the reception, we would have asked for assistance. VERY poor welcome. Reception was busy and while there was a separate line for SPG members, it was unattended. Service was mixed -- some was fabulous, some seemed disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: reedprincess
Reviews.Content: I pretty much always stay at the Bonaventure when staying in Downtown LA - I love the building and architecture, love the movie history, and have always had great service. This time was no exception - except the service was even better! I had last stayed in Feb. 2011 and the place was still undergoing some rennovations. This time, they looked to be all done and the place looks great - much fresher decor, and the new spaces look great! This trip though, the service really set the visit apart. From the valets the moment we arrived to Sarah at the Front Desk, John the concierge and Javier in the Lounge upstairs - this place really took care of us. The staff was very friendly, really made us feel welcomed - and the hotel was full and very busy with several conventions being held there at the time. Somehow, the staff always had a smile and was willing to help out with anything and never seemd rushed or stressed out. the concierge was a big help with some directions to Dodger Stadium that had us there in 10 minutes and no traffic at all - gave us the way that skipped all the stadium traffic - it was great! I have to mention our waitor, Javier, once again in the Boa Vista Lounge upstairs, he was truly outstanding. Friendly, timely and simply great. He really took care of us - and all the other full tables he had without every seeming rushed or like any request from a guest was too much. We had a wonderful time up there - and probably too many lemon drop martinis, but that's a different story! All in all, we had an excellent stay and i am looking forward to when we can go back! the only issue I have with them seems to be a Westin-wide problem and that is the check-out - neither here nor the West Gaslamp in San Diego had video bill review on the TV and neither place gave bills under the door the last night - so we had to go wait in line to check out and yes - there was a bit of confusion witht he bill that was straightened out immediately - but would have been nice to be able to review it in the room and handle it when it actually happened as opposed to 2 days later at check-out. Small issue and in no way would stop me from staying here - or at any Westin - again! We loved our stay, it was a great weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Some good..some not so good”
Reviews.Author: SDDots
Reviews.Content: The hotel layout is confusing with four towers and elevators that do not stop at every floor. I was attending a conference and was constantly trying to figure out which stairs/escalator was where. Parking was $35 a day!!! Nice pool and exercise room. Hotel rooms were good size, water pressure in shower was perfect and the double shower curtain actually worked. The only thig missing was a shower cap, yes, they will bring you one, but do you really want to stand there naked and shivering while someone brings it to you? Personnel was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The expensive (and mandatory) valet aside, the Westin Bonaventure is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: With many places to eat and drink in the hotel itself -- something that comes in handy when night rolls around and downtown LA closes until the following morning -- the Westin Bonaventure is a great place to stay. I found the staff members to be gracious and eager to serve. I would recommend the Westin Bonaventure should your business travels take you to downtown Los Angeles, even if getting nickled and dimed for things like parking and wi-fi/Internet access is thoroughly annoying and transparently cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPrincess
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant, elevators fast, weekday breakfast buffet seemed a little over-priced for lack of breadth of selections.

Reviews.Title: “Central and very nice in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ash J
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here back in Feb 2011. There was a lot of construction/renovation going on in the hotel so it was very loud in the lobby area, but in the rooms you don't hear anything and it's very quiet. The bed was very comfortable and it was very clean inside. It was a pretty fancy room with a nice decor. I had 2 minor complaints and 1 major complaint about the hotel. The minors being parking was expensive (Then again it is Downtown LA) and the valet does take a while for them to grab your car so call in advance. The major compaint was I felt there was no security in the hotel. Anybody could just get into the elevators and go to any floor with a key which I found to be very bizarre, unless they've changed since Feb 2011. The hotel has a food court which has a very good selections of different eats. I checked out the pool although I didn't swim since it was still winter. It's an outside pool and it looked real nice.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: ricemuncher
Reviews.Content: first off, the housekeeping is terrific. probably the best housekeeping we have ever had. secondly, the concierge is fantastic. we had a tough time with the front desk but we got it at 1am so i may have just been cranky. we booked through priceline at an amazing rate, so it was worth it. i would not pay full price for this joint. as the other reviews have said, the place is a bit dated and confusing but so is all of downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Just fab”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTeddy
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, excellent helpful staff and immaculately clean, Rooms are a very good size bathrooms excellent, and huge TV's ....if you get chance to watch. Revolving returant on top floor with a bar you can use if you don't want a big meal, views excellent.Hop on Hop off bus stops outside, possibly not best company but does get you around if only here for short time and is very convenient, has 3 loops, you'll need to go early if doing all in 24hrs,but 48hr ticket is available too. I would highly recommend this hotel, the lifts(glass) are an experience on their own, if a little scary for those of us with mortal fear of heights!! A little out of the way but all is accessible if need be.Car Valet service excellent and worth the cost for hassel free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a sneer”
Reviews.Author: jarthurw
Reviews.Content: My partner and I flew in from Australia and got to the Westin Bonaventure by about 11 am. We thought we were clever, since we had rung a few days before and were assured that there should be no problems with an early check-in, and the request was in the system. So we went to the reception desk and were met with a VERY icy reception. The desk clerk told us that check-in was 3 pm and that the hotel was full. I asked to speak to the supervisor, and Sonya came out. She told me that there was a "request" for an early check-in, but that really didn't mean anything. I asked if there were any rooms where the guests had already checked-out and where we could get in early. Sonya was uninterested in checking for such a room and told us that check-in was at 3 pm and our "request" was really unimportant. We finally did get into a room at about 1.30 after annoying the desk staff every half hour to check on room progress. We ate at the lobby restaurant and again service was terrible. We had to request service, although there were many staff. The food was adequate but nothing special. Internet service at the Westin Bonaventure costs about $12.00 per day and starts at 3 pm -- not $12.00 for 24 hours! Fortunately the internet service went down on the morning of our second day, so we were not charged for 2 days (even though we only were in the room for 23 hours!) Although the rooms were adequate and the views good, we got the idea that the staff were doing us a favour by allowing us to stay at the Westin Bonaventure. In over 30 years of international travel, I have never received such snotty service. If we ever need to stay in Los Angeles again, we will try to choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: westin_oaks
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel located directly in the heart of downtown LA. The rooms were rather small and valet was very pricy (considering that was the only option available). I had breakfast in the lobby my last morning there and i was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel whose time has passed”
Reviews.Author: mtx4
Reviews.Content: this hotel may have been great in the 80s but it does not have a 'westin' feel about it- the presentation is okay but there's nothing to write home about. room service took one and a half hours. we had to order room service because we were misinformed about the lobby restaurant- apparently their receptionists don't know when the restaurant closes! we were also given incorrect information about the airport taxi during check out. there is one other really expensive restaurant and some shabby eateries on one level that are more liek 1- star than 4-star. the location is not bad, there are restaurants within walking distance and there's a metro within walking distance as well. the tour bus comes right outside the front doors which is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Mumnelsk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel which takes your breath away inside as it is amazing to look at. Lifts are not for the faint hearted as they are glass and outdoors, and I found them very scary as i am scared of heights, but I overcame this by looking at the lift door instead! Hop off and hop on buses stop outside the hotel, convenient, but perhaps not the best operators as you tend to wait a long time for busses, but it was an excellent way to see all of LA in a short time.. If you don't mind the wait.try the revolving bar at the top of the hotel, really worth a look, but the staff weren't great there. On then whole, an excellent hotel but not very central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, terrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: On Tuesday morning I waited 17 minutes for an elevator. That is not a typo. 17 minutes. I would have been late for a business meeting had I not known that the elevators were terrible and given myself some extra time. The rooms are decent, there are plenty of food options and the location is in the middle of downtown. Just be prepared that there are certain things - horrible elevators, shoddy wifi, bland furnishings - that make this a hotel I would not want to return to.

Reviews.Title: “No Major Complaints; Best when you Book with Best Priceline Rate”
Reviews.Author: wlschwartz
Reviews.Content: Is there better... Certainly. Is there much they don't have to offer... Not really. So... If you can land an hot Priceline rate like we did, jump on it. This is a quality hotel with everything any upscale, large chain, downtown hotel would have. There are so many rooms here, it would be unlikely rooms are not available. Great downtown location to get you on your way to anywhere in L.A. quickly. We traveled with kids and requested a high floor, with 2 double beds. On Priceline, you are not guaranteed the double beds, so be sure to call the hotel directly as soon after you land your Priceline bid. You are most likely to get your request (we got the 14th floor, so not the highest, but more than adequate). If you drive a car, do not feel forced to pay $38/night. Park your own car, but use the right parking location. Just a mere 1-1/2 blocks away is the World Trade Center parking garage. Use the right WTC garage. Enter from Figueroa and 3rd. There is an automated lot with a max overnight of $16. If you enter after 4:30 pm, overnight is $7 (but get out of the lot early if overnight is Sunday turning to Monday, the per min starts at 6 or 10 or something). I paid $23 entering after 4:30 on Sunday and leaving at check-out at 11:30 am Monday. All other (Fri, Sat), I paid $7 with no hassle, no safety issue, and no valet tip or waiting for the valet. Added hassle - a little, but much worth it to avoid the crazy rates any downtown hotel asks for. The good: Very nicely done, with all major services available (concierge, bellman, front desk, - the works). Not many requests denied. I even needed to print some tickets for Universal from an online portal site, and the concierge (Roxanna) was so nice to help me. She allowed me to log into my Gmail, access the link, go to the tix website, and print 5 pages for no charge and no hassle. AWESOME! The bad: Not much. Worst thing is no free lobby WiFi and $13 for 24-hrs in-room WiFi or Wired Internet. Business center available, but remember - this is a 4* hotel, so all services cost you something (crazy per minute fees). But, I was told the Fedex office (or something) offers cheap per min. So, the best tip I have... Visit the area in and around the Suede lounge on the Lobby floor. This place has an open WiFi (but once I list this here, they'll probably lock it down). So, grab your iPhone or laptop and sit down there for free WiFi. Expect an occasional security dude to ask you if you are a hotel guest, so be ready to show your room card and just say thank you. Anyway, the hotel is huge and has all sorts of stuff (shops, restaurants, etc.) - almost a mall atmosphere - in and around the hotel. Just, one tip, don't be looking for a meal after 9:00 PM. Place shuts down all over (one of the biggest negatives). We did not eat at any Westin restaurants or bars expecting them to be all expensive. We did not use the gym (which is supposed to be terrific), and we also did not use the pool (on the 3rd or 6th floor - can't remember. So, end result - get a rate (around $100) on Priceline, and you are golden. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “stay here every time i visit los angeles.”
Reviews.Author: kriste614
Reviews.Content: this hotel has great service and being a starwoods member makes it even better. my room is always clean and the beds are so comfy. it's within walking distance to a mall but the garment district is only about a mile away. great shopping there. i always seem to get a good rest here. the restaurant on the top floor is amazing. good food, but the view is awesome and the rotating room is an added plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gris909
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying in this hotel. Got a great deal on Hotwire. Some of the good things about staying here: location comfy bed re done bathroom/great lighted mirror for make up application awesome view from almost all floors nice pool area flat screen tv Now the bad; $35 per night for parking??!! WTF clover design kinda irritating small rooms still renovating very pricey restaurant All in all not bad. I know a lot of people are hating on this place, but hello??? It is like over 25 year old place. Anyway I would recommend this hotel. Tip: walk to the metro (subway station) on 7th and metro and take red line. Goes to Hollywood and Highland, lots of "touristy" museums and places. All day pass only $6.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pacman1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure this week since my corporate office is up the road and also because I am a Starwoord Platinum member. Compared to other Starwood properties that Ive stayed at, this was a pretty disappointing experience. It started at the check-in counter on the Tuesday. The room with the king bed I reserved was not available so I was a given a room with two queen beds. No big deal until I got into the room and it looked as if the previous guest was still occupying the room (beds not made, towels on the floor, etc). Back down to the registration desk. I was given another 'wonderful' room next to one of the elevators on a lower floor. I had to adjust the AC fan to high in order to drown out the external elevator and guest noise. It did not help me the next day for my business presentation. The registration desk told me they would call me the next day with a new room assignment and never did. This is an older hotel and navigating around the 'cloverleaf' silos and outside crosswalks is a pain. The rooms are renovated but the wireless did not work for me, nor did the ethernet cable in the room. I was lucky I had an aircard with me. Also, the desks do not have powerplugs and are positioned too far away from a wall plug, so I had to relocate the furniture in order to even work on my laptop. Phone, ipad and bluetooth I had to charge in the bathroom. Staff are friendly (when you can reach them). I spent more than 5 min on the phone waiting for someone to pick up from the operator and the phone was never picked up when I was transferred to the registration desk. I had to call the operator back and have someone call me. I know folks are busy, but this was a little frustrating. I just switched to the airport westin instead, even though it means dealing with the LA traffic to get downtown. To add on the experience, as I was just wrapping up this review the room service staff entered my room even though I have a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. This place has been an experience. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: rhlc
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted rate on our room, so we were pleased with what we got for our money. However, this is not a particularly luxurious or special place. Our basic room was small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. We were given a view of the elevator, but I can imagine if you were up high you might have a fantastic view. The lobby is cavernous, loud, and confusing. No deal breaker, though. If you need/want to be downtown, this seems to be a safe bet, but certainly look for a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: rveras
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very upscale for the price we paid (I used hotwire to book it and only paid $104). The check in was seamless. The room was beautiful with updated furniture and LCD TV. The bathroom was very clean and very big. I couldn't believe how great of a hotel this was for the price I paid. It was a great value! We were able to walk to the LA Live area where there are a lot of restaurants. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend when we went to see Les Mis in LA. The hotel is very large with a big city feel. The rooms were comfortable, but we had to wait for our rooms to be available (after the 4pm check-in time). The hotel is in a good location and the breakfast was very nice. The rooms are very typical big city hotel rooms, very efficeint, but not much room. I think this is a better hotel for business, but if I needed to stay in downtown LA in the future, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Wonkavator”
Reviews.Author: KaliKross
Reviews.Content: This hotel RULES! Maybe it doesn't possess the glitz of the W, nor does it have the trendy hipness of The Standard nearby, but it has far too many great points to be lightly tossed aside. It is a city unto itself, only missing a grocery/drugstore/Rx to complete it to perfection. I haven't had the experience of booking on an auction site & getting a chintzy room. As an SPG member, who books directly via Starwood's site, I got reasonable rates & free upgrades to suites that rival any downtown apt.. By analogy, some ppl buy on eBay then expect to have the right to a manufacturer's warranty or perks at the store. It's ridiculous logic, regardless of one's SPG status. The hotel itself, as well as the Westin with all its plush amenities, is a DREAM. Service, however, is mixed. Some ppl are nicer than others. Three were downright nasty (Sophia at the front desk... I think her name was... Sonia? Unbelievably accusatory & rude, even after I proved her fault. She refused to apologize!) One point taken for service only & that restaurant offerings are limited at certain times. Can't do the Bona Vista before 4pm, but can't get Chinese food at Mandarin West after 5pm or on weekends. Grrr. I love the views, waking up to my beloved 'Hollywood' sign. To make the Westin even more of a delight, it's in the middle of everything in DTLA. Walk a few blocks to LA Live. Stroll to Lil' Tokyo. Take the train to Hollywood or... This is my fave SPG in California so far, and I've stayed at nine of them... and counting. My lil' one and I lovingly refer to this Westin as the "Westin Wonkavator" for its zippy elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Novicetravler_4now
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were very nice and spacious. Staff very very friendly. Concierge was very helpful. Nice stay all together. It was a couple of blocks down the street from LA Live! One added bonus, there was a super market a block down. This truly helped on costs, since restaurants tend to be a bit pricey over there. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience for a business visit”
Reviews.Author: TusharSrivastava
Reviews.Content: Among the architecturally better Westins within US, it has a great modern feel to its interior with multiple shops and restaurants at various levels. Interconnected footbridges with tennis courts and YMCA provide incentives for sporty people. The standard King size room is slightly small compared to others but is definitely worth the price quoted. If I were to point out the one standout factor it would be the external elegance of the building with its unique look and design. Its definitely worth a visit if you are staying on business in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if staying in Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: I find the Bonaventure complex itself a bit complicated if are going to different areas of the hotel -- the food court, gym, the penthouse bar/lounge as you walk through the 3 interconnected buildings. As a Starwood Platinum member, was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with 1 1/2 baths; large space, fridge (no mini bar) and received a coupon for a free drink at the Penthouse. Old clock radio - wish they had an iPod station dock. Surprised how quiet the hotel from the traffic. Great location if you need to be in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Comodo”
Reviews.Author: Lukins82
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to spend 1 or 2 nights. Everyone is very friendly and helpfull. Nice breakfast, good connections. Parking costs 40$/night and it's an hidden cost. If your neighbour is not quite, you may hear some noise. Room Are not perfectly isolated. Anyway I will suggest it for a short period

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant but not good if you have heights issues”
Reviews.Author: cc9365
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. Only issues 1- Pay for parking 2- Room very small 3- I am not a height person so I was very sick the entrire stay. I got this via priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Time and Money”
Reviews.Author: MJRez
Reviews.Content: It all started with the major back up in the valet, your only parking option. Moving down hill fast the front desk staff were poorly trained and slow. Their favorite answer is an emotionless â€œCompany Policyâ€�. They choose to charge our credit card with a $100 incident fee that would be refunded after we checked out. Then followed we the â€œCompany Policyâ€� answer. The recently remolded room was still poorly maintained. It was clean but the air conditioning was not working correctly in the bedroom. We eat in the lounge on the 34th floor, the view was amazing, the food was great and the staff hardly bothered us. They were very nice and helpful when they did stop by the table. No express checkout!! The very slow line at the checkout was not as horrific as the valet line. The one person collecting valet tickets was on a ten minute phone call, make the paying customer wait to just check in the parking tickets. When I got in line I was 6 from the counter and by the time he took my ticket the line was 30 deep. The entire experience was disappointing, I would not recommend this Hotel, Westin Hotels or Starwood Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: MaryKayPinkLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect start to our US trip. The staff were polite and friendly!!! Incredibly helpful. The room was immaculately clean and beautiful decor and setup. For us it was a perfect location. Loved the store Ralph's for food!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: jfreeman7
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms very nice, and all staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. We didn't realize there was an Enterprise rental desk in the hotel, and the lady there quickly helped us switch our reservation from a nearby Enterprise office that we thought we would have to take a taxi to. There's a weird, dated mall on the fourth floor, which was helpful when I needed to buy a fingernail clipper and a bottle of wine. Breakfast to go from the lobby bar was good - try the ham and cheese croissant! Rooms were spacious, tastefully renovated, and I was able to walk to the metro station and some nearby shops. There's a Starbucks across the street from the hotel - on both sides. I'd recommend this for a few nights in L.A. for business - my husband was there for a conference and I met him there before we headed south for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but good hotel in dead part of downtown”
Reviews.Author: menad38
Reviews.Content: Great place if you're having a conference there or nearby but not if you want easy access to tourist spots. Pros - great public transport access to different buses & metro - good room size - quite helpful concierges - take any of the 4 areas of elevators to access your room - the yellow ones were used in the 'true lies' movies Con - takes forever to get to anywhere - dated decor We scored a deal with priceline for this stay. Took supershuttle from airport. You can also access free wifi by picking up a nearby signal at the flower St entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Westin Bonaventure, and both times we really enjoyed the rooms and the location! The hotel is very central, and we were able to walk to restaurants and places where our friends live. Recommended! Thank you Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel really made my trip to Los Angeles amazing”
Reviews.Author: Heyxxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 nights and have not got one bad word to say. From day one the staff at reception were extremely helpfull, one person even let me use their mobile when my phone wasn't working. Rooms were lovely and house keeping was emaculate. Beds were comfy , had a nice tv in room aswell . The hotel had many restaurants so I always had a nice breakfast and dinner . Nice pizza place in there as well which was cheap. Hotel was really close to everything aswell was only a 5 minute walk to the metro and was only 15 minutes from Hollywood. Eveything you needed was on your doorstep here. I thought the hotel looked amazing , the design was really great. was really nice to walk into a nice friendly clean and really cool looking hotel after a long 10 hour flight! I would most definatley stay here again when I come back to LA )

Reviews.Title: “Prison Barracks, with lower ceilings”
Reviews.Author: ihatesigningup
Reviews.Content: Confusing entrance, plastic cups, reception takes forever to answer, tiny room. Great bed, quiet air con. Ripoff valet pricing ($35!). Super low ceilings in the room makes it feel small, prison like. All the concrete everywhere is sort of stark, in a modern post apocalyptic way, or a 70's future vision. Cold, unfriendly. No showers for the pool. For a "high end" 4+ star Westin, this place was functionally equivalent to a motel 6 with a pool, except the Motel 6 has glass cups inside, easy entrance, bigger room, and showers by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and easy.”
Reviews.Author: maggie620
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 3 nights while in town on vacation. We chose this location because we were seeing a concert downtown and didn't want a late night commute back to the room afterwards. All in all, I think it was a great choice. The check in was painless, with friendly people working all around. The trickiest part was figuring out which tower you were in (there are 4 and they are color coded). The lobby is dated, but still clean and interesting. The elevators are big fun because 1/2 of the trip is inside the building, the other 1/2 is outside, which kind of surprises you when you pop up through the roof. Once we reached our room, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was adequately sized with a big fluffy bed, nice desk area and a wall of window, providing awesome views of Los Angeles. The bathroom was also lovely, with wonderful toiletries...a guilty pleasure of mine on vacation. I always check out what shampoos, etc. they provide. Needless to say, after a day of flying, losing 3 hours due to the time change and then sightseeing, we slept like rocks. I thought that being a little farther away from Hollywood/etc. would be frustrating, but it was not bad at all. We were able to get to all of the touristy areas, and some other fun spots within 20 minutes, which is completely reasonable seeing that we had such a nice room for such a reasonable price. The valet is EXPENSIVE and the only way to park there...but they are wonderful. It does take some time to get your car, which you should take into consideration if you have reservations, etc., but the valets are super nice. That was a good experience. One negative...they don't have many decent food options in the hotel. We tried to grab a quick sandwich or coffee and we ended up giving up and driving around to find something. There are a few restaurants that aren't expensive in there, but they were atrocious. They say that they have a Starbucks...but really its just the bar that serves really basic coffee, and thats about it. Definitely bring drinks/snacks with you for the room. A bottle of soda is like $3. We really enjoyed our stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED MY STAY AND LOCATION, WILL BE BACK.”
Reviews.Author: sanjukiran
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very close to F1 Race circuit, best for formula race freeks. What I missed was free internet. Restaurant was good. Room bar is quiet decent. Have friendly staff and lobby is very spacious. I liked the local telephone option to hotel rooms. No complimentry fruit basket in room. Value to money hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at average price”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute place to stay for a business trip to LA. For the price and central location, this hotel works. However, next time I would stay at the Standard. For a little more money, it is much trendier and more of what I'd expect from LA. The Westin is somewhat outdated, but the rooms are clean. Breakfast was good and the gym was sufficient. If you are on a budget, this place works but I cannot see why you would stay here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “2 Night Stay-Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cpapat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights for my son's graduation. It is a very nice hotel. I got it for approx. half price on Hotwire. Check-in went quickly, room was very clean. Close to public transportation. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_C95
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is under construction, but it looks like they will soon be done. They were putting the finishing touches on the lobby bar. We were not inconvenienced by the construction. The staff at the check-in desk were friendly and efficient. The elevators are fast and there was never a wait. Due to their four round tower design, none of the rooms are very far from the elevators. The bell desk delivered our luggage quickly after we were checked in. The room was small, but not unreasonable for a downtown hotel in a large city. The bathroom was clean and in good repair. The beds (2 double) were very soft and comfortable. There was no problems with noise, but we were on a high floor. The pool area was clean and the pool was very warm and had a nice deep end. The only downsides was that there was a charge for wireless internet ($12.95) It really should be free. The parking was kind of high too, $35/night.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs major improvement”
Reviews.Author: BA_Peter
Reviews.Content: Room has been remodeled. Kind of small. But housekeeping department is not up to standard. No room cleaning for one day until I was back in the evening. Took an hour to clean the room. Did not replenish towels. Luck that I was travel solo. Left same day newspaper on the desk and they threw it away. Never experience such service. Can hear all my neighbor water flushing. I mean really loud noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Average Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jriger
Reviews.Content: Overrated. The best thing about this place was the location and the elevators (so Fast!) it's in the heart of downtown so you can walk to fantastic bars, clubs, restaurants, cafes and venues. But for the price, I think most people can do better. If you stay here then remember to check-in early, I didn't and got stuck with a double bed. The rooms are small clean, have nice beds and generally offer nice views of downtown depending on your floor level (35 total). They charge $35 for overnight parking and there's no free-wi-fi. Overall it's nice, but not that nice for the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service; nice room”
Reviews.Author: DAEsmae
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Huge hotel. Clearly still re-modeling, fountains in lobby not operational. I arrived very early (10am) and the hotel called my cell as soon as they had a room for me, which was 11:30 - nice! The room itself was very nice with a great view, lovely linens, etc. My only complaint is no outlet near the bed for phone charging. I asked for a late checkout (2pm) and they accommodated me immediately. All staff interactions were positive, from front desk to stowing luggage. They do have a place to print boarding passes, but no business center. There is a place on the second floor that says it is a "Business Center" but it is not affiliated with the hotel and charges for use. There are several restaurants in or near the hotel, and some shops, though some are gone, no doubt due to the recession. Good facility for conferences.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Adventure at the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: HotWire gave me a great rate of $94.00 a night for three nights last weekend. The room was small but well furnished with an amazing bed and view. They honored all my requests: renovated, quiet room with a view away from the elevators. Yes, you can hear your neighbors if you put your ear close to the wall. However, it wasn't a problem for me. The room was very fresh and clean, A/C worked great, flat screen was nice and the bathroom was immaculate. I love architecture and thought the concrete lobby and stairs spiraling around each tower in the lobby were cool. If you liked the movies Metropolis or Logan's Run, you'll appreciate the futerama lobby style. They also have a nice gym with all new equipment and a pool with a view! The hotel is walking distance to the Music Center and Metro stations. I'd stay again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Priceline Deal”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: Central location, walking distance to subway, refurbished room with comfortable bed and accessories but there were some wacky design features such as bathroom sink that faced into a mirrored corner and a difficult to view TV screen. Pool was also distant from the main building. Staff was cordial but not overly friendly. Lots of restaurants in the complex were closed. Renovations gave the place a bit of a concrete monster feel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalgirl72
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate on this hotel this weekend for $89/night on Hotwire. Reviews were all over the board and it seemed unanimous that hotel was in serious need of renovations so I was not sure what to think. We arrived, and noticed this hotel is absolutely enormous and had a huge lobby. Most of it was already remodeled and very little construction going on. Check in was awesome and gentleman was very nice and gave me a newly remodeled room with 2 double beds. We took the lightening fast elevator up to the 19th floor (32 floors in all) and unpacked our stuff. Room was a little on the small side but it was just me and my sister so it was ok. Nice, newly done bathroom, plasma screen TV, coffee maker that makes 1 cup of coffee complete with condiments. Fridge, dresser, desk, iron board, closet, robe. TV had some very cool channels-Nat Geo, HBO, TLC, CNN, Fox news,WE, AP, etc.. This is the largest hotel by far I have stayed at. 20 restaurants in all and a huge food court/shopping area on 4th floor. In lobby there was a large circular bar, there is also a very busy bar/nightclub called Suede. Reasonable drink prices too. This is downtown so this is not the most convenient area if you go to Hollywood. Traffic is terrible an it is 30 minutes at least, to get to Hollywood area. There is a small Macy's plaza near by as well as many high rise buildings. Hotel was very quiet Fri night. However, Sat night hotel had a very large number of high schoolers there for prom. Every floor was like animal house and I had to call security twice before they came up and finally took care of the many teenagers who thought they were at a pep rally. Apparantly a large fight broke out on 23rd floor. My floor the 19th one was VERY loud. Noise appeared to be a big problem that night and hotel should have had extra security to keep the teens under control. The second time I called security the man was nice but said they were very busy with noise complaints and that they could not be everywhere at once. Luckily I eventually fell asleep. Be advised no free wi fi anywhere in hotel. I just used my sisters wi fi hot spot through her phone but I rarely stay at hotels with no free wi fi I only stayed here because of the great rate. Parking fee is absurd! so we did not have a car and just had our friend drive us around. This is typical of L.A. anyways. Service excellent and this is a really great hotel if you do not mind the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “No problems grand but expensive for what u get”
Reviews.Author: ramsesniblick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was probably the place to be in the 1970's and 1980's but it has become very outdated. The rooms are good as is the service and the staff, they charge for wifi which is a no no in the 21st century. It is well located for access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Now Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mrnngg
Reviews.Content: When I arrived they were just finishing the lobby and to be honest it looks like a major uplift. had no problems with the room whatsoever but it's unfortunate that there's no free WIFI anywhere. The location is nice but somewhat remote to other things such as a wallgreens and such. However, for what I paid well worth the money courtesy of priceline. Room was very cozy and could tell that it had been severely uplifted. Loved the dt view and had a great time there. I am very very happy I stayed here. Loves it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites, staff, but lobby is goofy”
Reviews.Author: teaaek
Reviews.Content: Very funny, dated lobby area.. Bostonians will feel like you're in the New England Aquarium, others reminded of a 70's cement parking garage. I think if the fountains were operating, it would've helped the appeal but they were dry and being working on, I guess. There isn't much renovators can do with the cement interior..it is what it is and in a few years it will be appeallingly "vintage". Everything else was great! Staff was very friendly, efficient, and accomodating. The revolving Buenavista cocktail lounge is very nice and not totally crazy priced for cocktails and stuff to eat. We thought it was a great way to end a day of sightseeing! Our suite was lovely and nicely decorated. You can tell from the exterior elevators that some rooms are not private! You can see right in so be sure to ask for one that doesn't have an elevator view..serious design flaw! For Starwood Guests, if you're reading this trying to pick between this Westin and the Sheraton Downtown, pick this one. We stopped by the Sheraton just a couple blocks away..very dull looking from the lobby In a way, the Westin's goofy lobby makes it's sort of fun. You can picture Arnold Schwarzenegger riding a horse in the elevator as in "True Lies" which was filmed here.

Reviews.Title: “On its way back”
Reviews.Author: Surfingisfun
Reviews.Content: I have a unique persepctive on this hotel because I stayed here 20 years ago with a buddy on a post college vacation, and returned with my family and two teenage sons. The hotel is going through significant renovations in the lobby, which as usual they dont tell you when booking so that always sucks. But the hotel itself hasnt changed much since I last was here so the renovation is welcome. The value is there as I got a great rate and was able to book two rooms for what a normal hotel would have charged for one room. The pool on the 4th floor roof was clean and very warm which was ice because it was chilly out. My room had been recently renovated so it was clean, new and nicely decorated..although it was small and didnt have a dresser so you sort of have to live out of your suitcase. It all depends what you want from a hotel. For me its a place to be when im not out doing whatever...it is downtown which is not the most exciting area but if you are visiting CA and planning on going to a lot of different areas, it is pretty central and within walking distance to LA Live area. I have to agree that valet was not the fastest. For me everyone was very nice at the hotel...no issues there. I think it all depends what you ant fro

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and service. The rest of the hotel is tired, but is being renovated at last.”
Reviews.Author: John877
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with the bad and end with the good. As other reviews have said, this hotel is showing its age. The room I stayed in had been fully renovated, as had the floor it was located on. However, I visited some other floors, and the hallways had not yet been renovated. I didn't get to look inside the rooms on those floors. I don't know if they were putting guests in those rooms/floors or not. However, even the renovated floors did not get their doors replaced. This may seem odd, and it is certainly nit-picky, but the doors into the rooms are very narrow, and seem to have just been painted over, rather than being replaced. Once inside my room, the doors were the only visible (and rather ugly) clue that the rest of the hotel was not as nice and modern as my renovated room was. The main age-related problem is the lobby and the 5 floors above it, which they call the "Bonaventure Galleria and Food Court." During my visit, the lobby was visibly improved from recent renovations, and even more extensive improvements were still under construction. The Galleria was not getting any such special treatment at this time. As such, it just looked tired, and I found myself avoiding those floors as best I could. They were downright depressing! Anyway, my room was very nice. I had a normal room with a king-sized bed. It was large enough for me, and 2 would probably have been comfortable. However, unless the rooms with 2 double beds have more square footage, then I would imagine they would feel small. The recent renovations to the rooms produced an outstanding result, especially the bathrooms. My room felt comfortable, modern, and inviting. The views out the window were also great. Breakfast is, of course, not included, room service is outrageously expensive, and WiFi costs $13 a day. This pretty much seems to be expected of hotels in downtown LA. I will note that the in-room coffee maker includes complementary Starbucks coffee and Tazo teas. The housekeeping also provides 2 complementary bottles of water each day, though I found the tap water quite drinkable when those were empty. The service at this hotel was excellent. I never made any kind of hard-to-fulfill request, but everything I did ask about or request was answered well. The concierge and staff helped me find my way around LA, and housekeeping provided impeccable service. I used the laundry service as well. Ordinarily I wouldn't pay such high prices ($12.50 to wash and press 1 pair of men's jeans!) but I happened to really need the service, so it was nice to have. I simply hit the "Service Express" button on my phone, said I had laundry, and within minutes the staff were at my door to take the laundry bag. (A nice touch of Service Express is that they always address you by name every time you call.) The jeans were hanging in my closet when I returned to my room the next day. Though it does not excuse the exorbitant price, I was impressed by the impeccable service. The galleria area has several fast and fast-casual restaurants. Avoid them all as much as possible. (The Subway is OK if you must. I did not try the restaurants on the roof, which I'm sure are much nicer and way more expensive.) Across the street, there is an entrance to the underground "505 Flower" shopping center. There are TONS of good choices down there for inexpensive food, and you hardly have to leave the hotel to get to them. Try the cupcakes at the "Lemonade" restaurant! Overall, this is a very good hotel. The rooms look great, and I could tell that the nearly-complete lobby renovations were going to be superb as well. Though an online special, I paid $113/night (tax included in that price) for my room. I don't think you could find a similar hotel with a better price than that, so I consider it to be a very fair price for what I received. Do be warned if you are a light sleeper or easily disturbed- I could hear my neighbors talking (and they weren't even yelling) through the wall, and even on the 26th floor traffic was very audible.
