It did not affect my sleep or comfort one iota, but I know I sleep quite heavily. I would recommend this hotel, but because of the depressing style of the galleria area (which isn't avoidable) the Bonaventure isn't at the same level as Westin's other high-end properties.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafkam
Reviews.Content: Be aware that the hotel is going through renovations. The lobby bar is totally shut down and the parking garage was closed due to construction. Had to valet park and took at least 20 minutes to get car back when needed. Room on the small side and walls are thin. Heard couples entire conversation at 1:00a.m. Also, even though room was on 27th floor could hear sirens and traffic throughout the night. Location is great and so are the employees. If you can get a good deal stay here but I wouldn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Average all around”
Reviews.Author: jrggilbert
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for one night at the Westin Bonaventure. I got a great rate for a Westin so was excited about this, but then upon checking in saw that all of the lobby was under renovation and the entire property seems pretty outdated. The room itself was clean and relatively updated (more so than the rest of the property), but there was a nail/staple sticking up from the where the carpet ended going into the bathroom that gave my foot a nice little cut. They do allow small pets, which is nice because they don't seem like they should be a pet-friendly hotel, and my girlfriend brought her pug for the night with us which was helpful for our one night stay. The lobby was loud due to the renovation, but the room was surprisingly quiet and we both got a great night's sleep. I can't imagine the work they are doing in the lobby is going to make a huge difference because the structure itself is just so old, but if you need to be located downtown then the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “It is just an okay stay!”
Reviews.Author: Enthusia78
Reviews.Content: The location is in downtown Los Angeles. There are plenty of good resturants around and the hotel has tiny shops all over the place. The upstairs resturant and bar is very nice. Makes the bar in the lobby seem kinda sterile. The elevators reminded me of the first Willie Wonka Movie. They have lovely windows and you feel like your flying. Loved the elevators. The rooms were small. It was rated 4 stairs but it felt very 3 starish. The business center is closed on Sunday. The computer in the lobby is $7.95 per 15 mintues. Don't wander to far-you will be in the ghetto. It was okay but next time-I won't stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for the LA Marathon.”
Reviews.Author: merepatt
Reviews.Content: Loved Susie and Sara. They helped me get a late check out for the LA Marathon - bless them!!!! I needed to take a shower after completion and thanks to them I was able to. I needed it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, but Lobby Under Construction, Subpar Employees”
Reviews.Author: jsnyder02
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are excellent -- because of the tower set up, it seems like most rooms have good views of something -- I had a view of the Hollywood sign from my room. Good furnishings, clean. Another positive of the hotel -- great amenities onsite, including some independently owned restaurants (recommend the Bonaventure Brewing Co especially), the typically good Westin gym, etc. Now the negatives: as others have mentioned, the lobby is under construction, which makes it a bit of an eyesore, and when I was staying there, the elevator to my tower wasn't available at the lobby level creating lengthy detours. Another huge negative: I got woken up one night in the hotel, by an employee, who was convinced that I'd ordered room service even though I certainly hadn't. It took him a while to agree that I hadn't, and then when I expressed my displeasure that he had made a careless mistake like this late at night, he didn't seem to care. At all! I would expect better out of a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadameBoden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there because he was a vendor at the L.A. Times Travel Show. This hotel was the official hotel of the show and they had a shuttle going back and forth for it. Loved the room. It was small and we could have used another chair. There was only one comfortable chair plus the desk chair. I like the Heavenly comforter that Westin always provides. But the bed was a little hard and the fact they don't use a fitted sheet for the bottom makes it weird because the flat sheet crumples up under you, and I had to keep flattening it out to be comfortable. Lots of pillows provided. Mini fridge. Safe. Nice clean modern bathroom with more than enough towels. Complimentary mineral water bottles. Floor to ceiling windows which can look a little scary when you are on the 29th floor. However, great view of Downtown L.A. We could even see the Hollywood sign. Expensive valet parking: $35/night, but very helpful valets. Outstanding service in this hotel: the registration agent, was very welcoming and even provided us complimentary wireless service in our room even thought we were not gold Starwood Prefered. I looked so disappointed when she told us that our regular Starwood Preferred status did not give us free wireless, that she gave it to us. The bell service goes beyond the call of duty. My husband was waiting for boxes and they got them all, found them, took care of transporting them to the car, did everything right. Kudos to Calvin, the bellman. Duvon Collins, the concierge, gave us a great recommendation for dinner, two blocks from the hotel. In turn, we can recommend Maria's Italian Kitchen at 615 S. Flower St. It was copious, delicious and reasonable. We also ate at L.A. Prime, the top-notch steakhouse of the hotel on the 35th floor, and received excellent service from Robert the host and Mark our server. On our last night, the rain was torrential, we had forgotten our umbrella and Chaya, the restaurant we were going to have dinner at, was only a block away. However, it was raining so hard, we knew we would be drenched in water by the time we got there. We told the doorman we wanted to get a taxi, but he seems reluctant to get us a taxi for just a block. It just happened that a friend of his, one of the Japanese guides from the hotel was going home: he took us in his tour van one block down, dropped us off in front of the restaurant and even gave us both one of those little Japanese umbrellas that is practically disposable. Incredible service from the Westin Bonaventure all the way around. We will always remember it. They also gave us late checkout at 2pm. We also had purchased the breakfast buffet plan, and did not regret it. The buffet is very good and copious. You also can get made to order omelettes. A buffet offers lots of choices. Recommended. The hotel itself is very cold in looks: it's all concrete towers and quite impersonal. The service makes up in warmth and hospitality what the physical structure lacks. For business in downtown L.A. I would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Hugh, old but in a great booming area”
Reviews.Author: algeiger
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure is pretty old. Especially the lobby looks and smells terrible (tons of concrete and chlorid from the artificial pools). But the rooms in the higher levels offer a great view and the hotel is located in the booming Downtown Los Angeles area. Plenty of new restaurants and bars are now open. Would definitively recommend, if you have platinum status with starwoodhotels, since you get a nice upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: donGdeF
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is the location of many movies of the 80's and early 90's. It is totally run down now. As with many Westins it is attached to a mall only the mall that the Bonaveture to is so bad it would fail as a strip mall on the side of a highway. The gym is seriously sub par, there's no club level bar, there are not enough front desk staff so check in is rather long and tedious even if your an SPG preferred guest. I would recommend you stay else where than at this hotel. The LA Standard is just round the block.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Novicetraveler20005
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. The staff is very very friendly and attentive. The amenities were great. I think the only think we notices was dishes left in the hallway which was an eye sore. But nice stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business trip location”
Reviews.Author: JCitytraveler701
Reviews.Content: My stay here was in conjunction with a week-long conference, so stayed a total of 6 nights. Staff were courteous and very helpful in locating various breakout room locations. Hotel layout is somewhat confusing with 4 elevator layout, but the hotel itself is sleek and contemporary, featured on a lot of postcards and arial views of the city of Los Angeles. Thing I liked best - the metro station is a short 2-block walk away, and purchased a $20 7-day all-acess pass - great metro value. Hotel parking costs are ridulously high, if you are driving in; but I flew there and took the metro in. NO free internet (charge about $10/day), even in the lobby areas. Breakfast buffet was also around $15. A plus is that the hotel has a limited variety of other food options on floors 3-6, similiar to a food court of sorts. Be sure to check out the Brewery, which at the time of my visit had 1/2 price appetizers during certain times of the mid-evening (around 5-7 pm) . There is also easy access within a block in all directions to lots of other economical food options. Macy's is also 2 blocks away. Ordered room service late one evening and the service was probably the best I have ever encountered anywhere - on his own initiative, about 10 minutes later the waiter knocked on the door to bring back an additional fresh order of pipping hot french fries because he thought the delivered fries looked too bad. I was very impressed, because we had not said anything.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: weister
Reviews.Content: The interior of the Westin Bonaventure isn't great but hey the staff at the front counter and the concierge were really friendly. In addition, i was allocated a room on the 29th floor and so i had a birds eye view of city. The room was fairly huge with all the basic amenities available however i would have preferred if they offered internet services for free. There are a number of shops and restaurants available in the hotel itself. Not to mention there is also a reasonable size pool located within the hotel premise. This hotel is relatively near to the subway but just be alert when when you re walking back to the hotel at night. Its a 20 mins walk from the staples centre.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay but I would probably try another downtown LA hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: buzzy-10
Reviews.Content: The Westin Lobby was under construction, very noisy and inconvenient. Huge hotel with three elevators, outside pool is not easily accessible and there isn't a hot tub. Parking is 35.00 a night. You can walk to nearby sites but you better bring your sneakers.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: black_tau
Reviews.Content: Checked out of The Westin on 2/17 and was dissapointed to find no hot water at 4:00am before my check out to head to the airport. More dissapointing was management response at check-out - "oh well, this happens" , not even an apology, also keep in mind that I am SPG gold status and was staying on SPG floor. Also keep on mind the hotel is going through major removations, so it is quite a mess there at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Blame it on the bellboy...”
Reviews.Author: JHBg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bonaventure in December 2010 for six nights in a twin room with two small children (4 and nearly 2 at the time). The first thing I want to say is that we worried about the size of the room after reading reviews on Trip Advisor; we wanted to set up a cot for the baby and werenâ€™t sure if there would be room to do that. To all of those in the same situation, donâ€™t worry. The room is not huge by any means but there is plenty of room between the bed and the window for a wide portable cot â€“ and to have your suitcases laid out on the floor etc. The hotel was clean and well organised, and the shops and fast food restaurants located within the hotel affordable and very useful when travelling with small kids. Also, staying in downtown LA meant that while there wasnâ€™t that many facilities open after the end of business hours every day, it was handy for travelling to other places in LA when we didnâ€™t want to rent a car. There is a â€œrapidâ€� bus which goes from just up the street around the corner of the hotel through to Beverley Hills and Santa Monica (OK, so itâ€™s not fast but it does come very often); and the metro to Hollywood is within easy distance. Anything more off the beaten track would have needed a car; but being in a central hub for 6 days was perfect for us. The only complaint I would have is that one of the bell staff completely cracked our new hard shell suitcase on our arrival. Bummer. A security manager, Larry Corley, came to investigate. He was very polite, gave us a complimentary breakfast for the family to make up for the inconvenience (by the way, the selection and food was very nice) and even organised some gaffer tape so we could fix up the problem. No complaints about Mr Corley, but the damage to the case was referred by the hotel to the insurance agency â€“ which hadnâ€™t called, even though we were still in the States for 3 weeks after the incident and we kept advising our contact details; and on our return home, has barely made contact (and that only after about six calls and three emails from me). Now more than a month and a half later, we still have a broken suitcase and no compensation. Maybe this is a way of trying to shake off all but the most determined of clientsâ€¦ anyway, I would have thought that a hotel of the Westinâ€™s reputation and standing would have done something to compensate us directly. Unfortunately, this incident and the handling of it has really damaged our impression of our stay at the Westin Bonaventure. I would stay again, but carry our luggage ourselves next time.

Reviews.Title: “Inquire about reconstruction progress”
Reviews.Author: 2jbsdad
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel...with several qualifications: First, the lobby is under reconstruction. It's depressing, ugly and loud. Everything is concrete...as it was designed and built decades ago. Second, it's expensive, even for LA. Overnight parking is $35 plus valet tips. Third, the rooms are small -- even the double beds seem to be large twin beds. And fourth, this hotel has NO charm...it's hard, cold, institutional and gray....literally. Staff is pleasant. But they cannot compensate for a sterile and uninviting environment. If you can get a deal via one of the discount sites, it might be worth it...just bear in mind that ALL the costs won't be shown on "your price." Otherwise, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Get a good deal, since ground floor is currently a construction zone”
Reviews.Author: GigiMontclair_NJ
Reviews.Content: Even the registration area has been moved into a hallway, while the hotel does major renovation to the lobby areas. Personally, I like this hotel and its location--but get a good rate while the major construction is going on! I did Priceline bidding. Rooms are small, but have a nice Westin elegance. Rooms are fine, in my opinion. I will be interested in seeing the lobby renovation later this year. I recommend the Bonaventure Brewery pub and restaurant (privately owned) on 4th floor. Ahi/shrimp apetizer was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...be sure to specify a high floor to avoid noise, and watch for icky housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: I hope other travelers won't have the yuck experience I did at this Westin. Housekeeping was WAY sketchy in the first room where I was put - totally off the mark for any Westin and down in bad two-star territory. Moreover, the noise level from the renovations penetrated an 11th-floor room and I had to be moved, at about midnight, to a much higher floor in a different tower - after the desk asked if I could "really hear it, or could the noise be somehting else?" No, jackhammers against concrete are pretty distinctive, thanks. The second room was quieter and had actually been cleaned but it was still a less-than-Westin experience. If you're compelled to stay at this Westin, make absolutely sure that you ask the front desk for a HIGH FLOOR ROOM that is as far away from the renovation as possible.

Reviews.Title: “when the renovations to the lobby are finished, this should be an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Zinnia
Reviews.Content: Room was large, clean with WiFi,desk and small empty refrigerator. Hotel is ecological minded, recycling pails in room, occupants decide daily which bedding and towels should be changed by maid. Northern view of HOLLYWOOD sign and the mountains was lovely to behold. Outside elevators afforded nice view too. 360' revolving bar/restaurant on 35th floor was a nice convenient extra- view of downtown LA and Hollywood hills. Outdoor swimming pool was not large, but heated. Exercise room is not large but has many machines - treadmills, step, universal type. Walking distance to Cultural Fine Arts Center and MOCA museum. Bus and metro train nearby. Concierge, Lupe, was wonderful to deal with; she did not send me to tourist traps or push tours or restaurants. Bad points- Lobby is being renovated- not pretty, yet. Walls were thin, I heard my neighbors wake up calls. Parking is expensive for hotel guests too.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: webster117
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Perfect hotel stay for our Laker's game. The hotel's downtown location puts you in the middle of everything. Great prices for the value. The spa was pricey and not the best I have had, more like average. The ambiance was probably better than the actual massage. Lovely grounds with lots of dining options. Kind of a sleepy hotel considering it's in Los Angeles, but there is one night club. BAD: We booked the COMPLICATED breakfast package. I had to jump through all types of hoops to get my breakfast incuded. I was told that it was because booking and room service are two different departments. Personally, I'd rather the staff figure it out and just make it happen. Revolving Restaurant: Lovely views make up for the average but pricey food. Besides that confusion... the beds are very comfy, rooms are spacious and clean. The views of the city are nice. I think I had the most fun riding the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdhokenson
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 5 days for a business trip and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is very large and located within a complex that has several restaurants and stores within it, which made it very convenient to shop and eat during my stay. The rooms were nice and had been renovated recently. The hotel is in the downtown business district and is near many bars and restaurants. All in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ervaan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, there's some renovation going on, much needed because some areas of the lobby, store area and gym area look rather outdated. The prices are OK considering that good hotels in LA are very expensive. It took us a long time to decide where to stay in LA because it is such a gigantic city with so many nice areas to stay. but some of them are so expensive, we couldn't afford them like Santa Monica, Beverly Hills or Century City. Hotels in there cost +250$ a night, I mean, nice hotels of 4* or something. Staying at the Bonaventure in downtown LA was a great idea because downtown LA is very much in the center of the city and it took a quick drive (avoiding rush hours of course) to go to the beaches, to Century City, to Berverly Hills or even the airport. More about the hotel, we had problems with the TV set, they had to come and reprogramme it so they gave us free access to the breakfast buffet the next day, without asking, so that was very nice. The next day we got to the room at 8 pm but it hadn't been cleaned yet! Amazing. The cleaning manager was not helpful at all, as a matter of fact he showed us a lot of attitude. So I went down to reception and complained and they gave us free drinks while we waited for the room to be cleaned. This was nice too. I really dont hold a grudge for this, because the fixed the problem inmediately. The room was in the upper floor, like 23 or something, it had nice views and the room is very modern and clean. A bit small for US standards. Alll in all we had a great experience and would get back to this hotel if needed. Parking issues, don't fight them. The best solution is the valet parking, it is 35$, yes 35$ but it is still cheaper than the nearby parkings downtown. So accept it or don't drive, which is kind of impossible in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the reviews are unfair”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: I recently had cause to stay in downtown LA for work. The company picked this hotel, probably because the rate is depressed due to all the construction work. The staff was professional, helpful and quick even though they are suffering through the mess of construction with everyone else. I am not particularly familiar with the downtown area and they were quick with directions and suggestions for good food, sights to see and good times to be had. The location is good for business but bad for just about anything else. Downtown LA is pretty dead after 7pm. The 110 is profoundly easy access right off the hotel grounds and you can get to the valley or west LA in 15 minutes or less if its good traffic. The room was small, but the hotel is older and most rooms were smaller back then. It was very clean and the bathroom was fairly modern. Dollar for dollar, I didn't have a bad stay and will probably be back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Staff deserves lots of credit”
Reviews.Author: rolfandann
Reviews.Content: Thought the construction would be finished and it would be decorated for Christmas. Wrong. Yellow tape, check in underground , and even the reflecting pools were bone dry. But every staff member went above and beyond in service and politeness to overcome the construction set-up. There are top of the line restaurants outside the hotel within walking distance. But if you stay inside the hotel you will be taken care just fine. We lucked out with a suite in the green tower, renovated, 26th floor with a living room and 1.5 bathrooms . View of the Hollywood sign and the mountains. 30 plus feet of floor to ceiling windows and the bedding was marvelous. Yes , you pay for parking and internet service but this a major city where all the downtown better hotels nail you for that. Easy access to freeways, zoom off to Santa Monica, Pasadena or drive down the street to Wilshire Blvd. and go to Beverly Hills. We came from North Carolina for the Rose Bowl and stayed until Jan 4th. The Westin served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: azvoco
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is under renovation. We happened to be there during an unusual cold spell and lobby was freezing, the hallways and room were very cold. There were taped-off areas of the lobby including a restaurant. It wasn't all that easy to find the temporary registration desk either. But we could hang with all that as we got a good rate.........what we couldn't accept was a room that clearly had been given the minimum once over before our arrival. The bed was made up, comfortable and clean, but the floor showed signs of not having been vacuumed including a tack we found on the floor, fortunately not by stepping on it. There was no soap in the bathroom, no lotion, no gel, only a shampoo and conditioner which had been placed in the soap dish in the bath/shower. The bathroom also showed signs on the counter and in the bath minimal housekeeping. After calling down to request toiletries, a person came up a half hour later, said " you needed toiletries?", handed me one small soap, one small lotion, and one small gel." I said "just one soap". He said "yeah" and walked away. Not exactly what I would call cordial or professional service. This is not the "Lucky 8" motel after all. The nicest experience here was the parking valets who were friendly, cordial, and professional. But then we paid $ 35 for that overnight parking experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay with nice treatment”
Reviews.Author: scottjens
Reviews.Content: When I learned that our travel coordinator was booking our group at the Westin Bonaventure in downtown LA, I read the significant number of negative reports by previous visitors and became nervous that we were in for a really bad extended weekend. But the truth is that we had a decent stay and were treated very well. I had emailed the director of sales & marketing that posted a response on the TripAdvisor website, asking for his insight on the accommodations but did not receive a reply. However, upon arriving in our room, we were greeted by a nice basket of snacks and a handwritten note explaining that he hoped our stay would be enjoyable. He explained that the property is undergoing a $40 million renovation and that should help for future visitors. Our rooms were on the 19th floor, they were clean, nicely appointed, with comfortable beds and clean linens and towels. The elevators were reasonably fast. We enjoyed the stay in the rooms overall. The building is iconic, but it shows its age inside. It's tough to get around at first with four elevators to the four buildings, but not impossible. The rooms are quirky due to the round building style, and the doors and walls aren't exceptional at noise control, but even on New Year's Eve we weren't kept awake. Parking is expensive in the city, and WiFi isn't free everywhere, so you have to just deal with that. It's downtown LA ao there's not much around that is open on a weekend. We found a Johnny Rockets and Starbucks next door, a Denny's down the street a few blocks, and a Domino's pizza within two blocks. Just enough for a family with teens to keep them happy. I don't disagree that this isn't a deluxe property, but it is certainly a reasonable place to spend a few nights when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Stay On New Years Eve ! Thank You Marco & Sarah!!”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property may times and Marco Romero is a superstar front desk manager (in fact "Manager of The Year" at Starwood)!! His assistant Sarah was absolutely amazing as well. Not only did they find us a very lovely room for the night notwithstanding the fact the hotel was totally sold out due to the Rose Bowl being played the next night and a "ton" of Wisconsin fans selecting this hotel to stay at, but the hotel operated "like a charm" despite a entirely sold out property that evening. Check in took 5 minutes at around 4:00 p.m. that day (I was shocked how organized the front desk was)! The hotel really cares about its platinum guests as well ... always extending a courtesy drink invitation in the revolving lounge on the 34th floor. It was great up there with a DJ and a dance floor ... you couldn't ask for more. And, the lounge manager, Sonny, was wonderful. Without a reservation on New Years' Eve around 10:30 p.m. he found us a wonderful table ... thank you very much again Sonny!! The breakfast buffet is always wonderful and there is a great waiter there named Rehan we always enjoy waiting on our table. We also met Jennifer Nagao, the Director of Restaurants in the hotel and she was a pleasure to deal with. She is very hard-working and is really making great improvements to the various restaurants at the hotel (which are wonderful to begin with). A young "star" in the works for Starwood is Jennifer to be sure. Parking is at a discounted rate for overnight guests ($35/night) (and that is not so bad for downtown LA), but I have also found the hotel has a "package" rate at times which includes parking as part of the rate. There are many independent restaurants on the 5th floor of the hotel for mostly inexpensive snacks and meals and I have tried several and they were good. The hotel also has a very exclusive club on the first floor but generally not for us "married guys" (I will let someone else review that club). The hotel is also nicely located if you are going to the Music Center for a musical or a play, etc. We always walk right over (about a 15 minute walk). While we generally walk back to the hotel after the show as well, at that time of night, it is a short cab ride back if you prefer. The room was very clean and I had no problem with the internet at all. In house dining service was wonderful and even when I needed some champagne glasses brought to the room, they were there in a flash. Two thumbs up to Marco and his great staff for making our New Years' Eve evening a wonderful experience at this hotel! We can't wait to get away for another evening at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre 70s hotel”
Reviews.Author: twick012
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't have stayed here if I hadn't been attending an event here but I was perfectly satisfied with my stay apart from the room rate (I had to share with a colleague in what are quite small rooms) and the layout. The hotel is organised around four towers with its facilities and meeting rooms scattered across the five common levels with minimal signage. (One panel I planned to attend was cancelled because nobody could find the room!) Be comfortable with your body if you plan to use the gym because it has see through walls and extra exercise equipment located outside on the bridgeways... we could watch the gym users exercising as we walked between meeting rooms on the third floor! Services seem much higher priced than average - many of my colleagues were complaining about printing costs and the paid wi fi connections are one per computer not one per room (the other person in my room had to buy a separate subscription). Compared to some other US hotels that host conventions the good point is lots of cheap or casual snack/lunch options rather than just having an overpriced hotel restaurant (though it has one too) - that said 6-10 outlets seem to have recently closed, although the microbrewery is still going strong. Beds in the rooms were extremely comfortable with the usual US overabundance of pillows; bathroom was pleasant and very clean although one couldn't actually sit down in the shower bathtub. If you're scared of heights you'll want to avoid this hotel as all rooms are accessed by lifts that run up the outside of the building (and plunge into a feature pool on their way down to the lobby). As the last word on the hotel layout I was told by someone else at this event that the Bonaventure has been used as an example in a famous book on postmodernism in the arts... Or if you know London, picture four AA batteries standing on top of the Barbican Centre and there you have it.

Reviews.Title: “Step back into the 70's”
Reviews.Author: traser2001
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, with a confusing layout with rooms carved out of circular towers that are shape like a slice of pie. This hotel may have been cool in 30 years back, but seems odd and old. Even the sofas in the lobby look decades old and need to be badly replaced. It badly needs to be updated. The hotel is clean, but just wierd to be in.

Reviews.Title: “ok Hotel, but fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: dancingvix
Reviews.Content: Ok so I see everyones complaints...no its not the most modern hotel in the world, yes it does need a make over. BUT, at the end of the day, what matters is a clean room, with a great bed and great shower...check and check. And let me say the customer service is GREAT! I stayed for 2 weeks and little things came up and were taking care of instantly. For example my shower started to make a weird noise after a few days of being there...i called and within 15 minutes they came and replaced the shower head! Done! The front desk was always helpful for any need I had (including accommodating me with a late check out with out a problem or extra cost) and the day i left I had dropped one of my diamond earrings in my room and I was already at the airport when I noticed it was missing! its a very small stud, but the sentimental value was higher then the actual value. I was convinced that it was gone. I called up and I believed I spoke with derek in security and he helped me in the most professional way and had the room searched and FOUND IT!!! Then Brenda took care of the matter and only 3 days later (today) i have my earring in my possession!! Amazing!!! I want to thank them for their great attention and professionalism! thank you Derek and Brenda for being amazing!! So at the end of the day, is it the most exquisite hotel in Downtown LA, no....but the customer service is top notch and you can feel safe that you will be taken care of!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy atmosphere in monster hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karabiber
Reviews.Content: The decor of the hotel is seriously dated. The rooms are fine, but for US standards on the small side. Lot's of little things don't work well in rooms, leaking faucets, empty mini-bar etc. More depressing is the building. The floor with shops and small restaurants is mostly abandoned and what is left has a very gloomy feel (except the quiet decent brewery). It is a hotel at a non-human scale, well past its prime and with little effort by the hotel to provide for a pleasant environment. Unless you are there for a convention, there is really no reason to be there.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: comfytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a convention for three nights. This ugly remnant of the 1970s techno style occupies a full block and is a poorly functioning urban jungle. Wer've met people who stayed in the hotel for a full week and still couldn't find their way around. The room had poorly functioning AC, and a distinct leak in the ceiling. The ceiling itself was in the shape of a distorted coffin. The greed of the hotel has no limits: no free Internet anywhere, WiFi for $12.50 a day, to print one page will cost you $6, parking $35 a day. The insane design of the building makes a trip to some levels a two-leg travel: first elevator, then, after a lo-o-o-ong walk, an escalator.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: nejcusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very big and as far as I heard it is slowly being renovated, but I was unfortunate to stay in a room in one of the top floors which was not renovated, had a wierd smell. To make the stay even worse - I was in a corner room which had doors between my room and the room next door, and the doors were letting through all the noise... so when the neighbour moved in, I could here him talk on the phone all the time, going to the toilette and basically felt like I shared a room with him. No privacy at all! The hotel is anyhow overpriced! WIFI reception in my room was BAD and dropping all the time!

Reviews.Title: “OK place, but no free WiFi, not even in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Nolababe
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel for a business conference and this place is OK. The location is alright and you can walk to "LA Live" (which is the new hip and happening part of downtown LA next to the Staples Center). Near the hotel there are a few Starbucks and restaurants and other things too. The hotel has a huge lobby and it's big and happening and I really like that that feeling of being ain a happening and hip hotel when I walk into the lobby. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but the hotel is rooms and halls are dated and in need of a renovation. The elevators are totally confusing, but really fast and efficient and you never really have to wait around for one. There is no free WiFi even in the lobby (this is a joke in my opinion). I can understand having no internet in the rooms, but in the lobby? No complimentary computers either. So, they want to force you to pay the ridiculous $12.95 for internet (again, I can undersatnd no WiFI inthe rooms, but in the lobby?, really, Westin?) The parking was $35 bucks......this is LA not NYC. This is especially offensive since other places offer parking for $10 in the area. I forgot my cell phone charger and I called them and they told me they would mail it to me if I gave me a credit card to charge the postage fee to, what, really? I spend thousands and I mean thousands of dollars on Westin hotel rooms yearly and you won't spend a buck to send me a cell phone charger as a courtesy? I rather just buy a new charger (who knows how much they wil charge for the postage anway). I am an SPG member and I have stayed at Westins all over the world and I mean all over and I will say that this Westin is not up to par with the other Westins around the country and around the world. The best part about my stay was getting a drink at the rotating rooftop. It is great up there and the ambiance is great and I recommend it highly. The staff is so-so. They are sort of not really interested in delivering great service (they should visit the Westin hotel in Auckland, New Zealand or the Westin Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri) both places I have just very recently stayed at and been very impressed with.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: girl4343
Reviews.Content: the holel was decent, clean linens. My biggest complaint was the room service food. It was very expensive for the quality of food we ate. I would have rather gotten fast food. The thirty-something dollars to park was kinda crazy but I guess it's average for that city.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly in the Heart of L.A.”
Reviews.Author: sueRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this Westin before when visiting my son at USC but this is the first time we've done so with the newest member of our family: a 7 month old Labradoodle. I was a bit nervous at the prospect of staying at a hotel with a pet, esp. after being assigned a room on the 28th floor but the check in staff assured me if it created too much of a difficulty due to dog walking, they'd be happy to change the room to a lower floor. The advantage, of course, was less traffic in the corridors which definitely in our favor; less noise, less risk of barking (gratefully, our dog is not a barker by nature anyhow). Fortunately, the elevator rides did not present a problem - we never had to wait long and puppy was well-behaved with his first experiences riding in one. What is not as pet -- or human -- friendly, as one reviewer previously pointed out, is the elaborate and confusing elevator systems, which beyond the color coding is the fact that they don't run to some of the floors most frequently used -- for instance, the 4th floor which has access to the pool and grassy dog-walking area. We found we'd either have to go to the 5th floor and walk puppy down a circular flight of stairs, or go to the lobby and use the handicapped elevator by the bell hop counter to make the fastest trip for a walk....which is really not so fast at all. In addition to the grassy area on the pool deck, there's also a park that's accessible from a pedestrian bridge which we never figured out exactly how to access. The run area by the pool deck was sufficient for all intents and purposes, although it would certainly be more pet friendly - and probably guest/cleanliness friendly - to have a discreet pet sanitation stand that offers plastic baggies and a trash container near the back - for guests who may not remember, or have enough, supplies of their own for disposal purposes. I had brought plenty of bags but felt awkward about depositing the soiled and tied up ones in the trash container I spotted not far from the outdoor cafe. I signed a general waiver upon check in for any pet-related problems that may occur, but overall I found the staff to be extremely solicitous, friendly and helpful when they saw the puppy. As a guest, I'd like to see more of that same friendliness offered to me from the staff who works the gift shop (the most I can say about the women I've encountered there during my stays is "they do their job" but if you're looking for a warm and/or pleasant greeting, that's not been my experience) or the sole early morning coffee shop open on Sundays that I've gone to. No smiles, good mornings offered - just a cup handed to me when I requested a coffee and a point in the general direction of the muffins when I asked if they had any. A little effort on the part of such staff to make a guest feel welcome rather than feeling as if one is intruding upon their day could make a big difference in customer satisfaction. However, the main point of this trip was to enjoy seeing my son who enjoyed seeing his dog who enjoyed staying at his first hotel. Overall, a good experience for all of us: parents, child and puppy alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Me. Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed Here Overnite this Past Weekend for Business. Great Place, Excellent Service, Excellent Attention To Detail. Room Very Pleasant, Cozy, Well Appointed. Excellent View of Downtown, it was Amazing. Valet Parking Excellent, Very Convenient, Prompt and Courteous Service. Ate at the Grill Restaurant on the 4th Floor, it Was Excellent. Would Highly Recommend, Happy to Stay at the Westin Bonaventure again. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place”
Reviews.Author: beckyras
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while friend was on business trip. I have comments similar to others. Hotel is somewhat dated, could use new carpet in the room, noisy from traffic (suggest higher room) thermostat off, (it was a little warm despite setting at 62 degrees) of course parking charge outragerous! (parking staff friendly and fast) I always complain about charge for internet. Concierge was helpful. The layout a little confusing, but once figured out we were fine. Would I stay here again? yes it wasn't horrible, but would try other hotels around the area first before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: JTravel111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for 5 nights during October 2010 and this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The primary reason not to stay at this hotel - bed bugs. I suffered around 25 bed bug bites while staying at this hotel. I reported this to the hotel and they maintain that the room was inspected for bed bugs and that no bugs were found. I asked when the room had been inspected and I was told between the hours of noon and 5pm. Well, of course they didn't find any bugs. Bed bugs hide during the day and only come out at night. I question the inspection methods of Steritech - the pest control company that they use. If they didn't find bed bugs, then why did I get 25 bites on me while staying at this hotel? I asked if there have been other infestations of bed bugs in this hotel, and the answer was "I am not authorized to answer that question." In other words, Westin is hiding a lot with their bed bug problem. Just read the reports from other travelers about bed bugs through TripAdvisor. Additionally, to make sure I do not bring bed bugs in to my home, I am now having to wash all my clothing on hot water and hot dryer cycles. Needless to say, this has ruined a few articles of clothing, which I am sure I will not be reimbursed by Westin. The second reason not to stay at this hotel - it's filthy dirty, and not up to Westin standards. Our room had dark stains on the carpet and the bedding - disgusting! The chairs in the bar on the lobby level are very badly stained and falling apart. Our room was not cleaned very well either. I noticed that our room was never vacuumed during our 5 night stay and the bathrooms were hardly cleaned. Upon entering the room, there was hair from the previous tenant in the bathroom and fingernail clippings were never wiped away. Absolutely, disgusting. This hotel claims to be close to the convention center, but it's really too far to walk. I would recommend staying at a different hotel altogether. This hotel shouldn't have the Westin name on it.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying”
Reviews.Author: Mahdi_110
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with this hotel. The only downfall is the parking. You can find parking on Figueroa St. between 8th and 9th street for $10 a full day. This is only good when you don't want to enter and exit the parking too many times in a day, otherwise go with the $35 valet parking of the hotel, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: World-Explorer81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel Los Angeles at the beginning of October. The hotel is located pretty much downtown and offer fast access to several of LAâ€™s attractions. We came by car, which we parked in the hotels garage for 30 USD a night. Considering the price you pay the for the room, I think this fee is way to high despite its location in downtown LA. They gave me a room on the 22nd floor with a nice view on LA (see picture). The bed was extremely comfortable. The room included all necessary amenities. Also worth mentioning is the fitness center, which includes a small indoor running track around the towers. To use the SPA the hotel charges a fee so we did not end up using it. The same unfortunately applies for the internet. Given the price I had higher expectations.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.....just ok”
Reviews.Author: Boomstar
Reviews.Content: Made a bid on priceline for $90 and ended up here, just for one night. Overall it was nothing amazing but it wasn't bad neither. Check in was quick and easy....ended up in a nice clean room with a decent view. To me the place seemed nice and up to date. Yes some of its age did show but nothing ridiculous, The goods: - Location was easy to find, right in the middle of downtown. - Service was good and staff was nice all around - Clean room and overall clean property The bads: - My friend complained of bed bugs, wasnt an issue for me - One of the 2 key cards didn't work - Lots of different food stores to choose from but they all close too early - $35 for parking!! Valet was always prompt but still $35 dollars?!?! - Wifi was kinda slow, this is a problem seeing that you have to pay for it! Overall if I bidded and ended up at this hotel again, I wouldn't complain too much but otherwise I'd probably stay at another place first before returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed... Not Up To Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: Harvestmeister
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by what we viewed as positives. Super fast elevator service... with 12 elevators serving almost all floors, you rarely had to wait for an elevator. Don't be fooled by the color coding of the elevators either, they all go to some portion of your floor. The hallways are all very reasonable in length once you get used to the 4 pod surrounding a central pod configuration. The rooms were definitely on the small size for a Westin, but the bed was still Heavenly. Flat screen HD television but old timey alarm clock radio. Although I noticed plenty of other rooms got one, I never received a newspaper during my entire 5 day stay. I guess I'm not Starwood Preferred enough. Negatives include poor selection of food choices. You're left to choose between airport style fast food on the 4th floor or $60 steaks at LA Prime, A New York Steakhouse (we all thought that was a really weird name). The service was better at The Brewery and Angry Chef restaurants, but the food was very plain. The food was better at LA Prime, but the service was painfully slow and the price tag painfully high... save your money and go for Ruth's Chris or even Morton's, of which one is right down the street. The lobby restaurant, which seemed to only be open for breakfast, served a decent breakfast buffet, albeit for $20+ dollars. The lobby bar couldn't get a food order right and service was slim. Oh, and they give you a free "day" of internet if you come with a group, but watch out after that, $13 a day to get online. How come Days Inn can give you free internet, but places like the Westin can't? Also, service for our Board Meeting was virtually non-existent. We had to call meeting manager 3 times just for a pot of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable room with a Beautiful View of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: negola
Reviews.Content: What a perfect place to stay for my first trip to LA, CA! It was convenient to everything! I easily accessed all the public transit to visit the tourist attractions such as Santa Monica Pier, and Universal Studios. The Westin had a wonderful food court that we would visit every morning for breakfast, and indoor pool, and wonderful accommodations. Our room had a spectacular view of the city with its large wall of windows!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WESTIN QUALITY - Not even Sheraton Quality - What's up Starwood?”
Reviews.Author: TomNewYorkNewYork
Reviews.Content: On so many levels, this iconic property is mis-managed. Missing are the standard Westin amenities - no Heavenly Showerheads, no porcelain or glass in the guest rooms (paper and styrofoam only). Umplugged TV. An iconic architectural gem shouldn't necessarily have actual signage and furniture from the 70s. This is the hotel the cheap Asian tour groups frequent because it is so hopelessly unaligned with the rest of the Westin brand in the US. The lobby shops seem subterranean and remind me of a Blade Runner like underworld. Exorbitant prices, very poor quality. Same with room service. The standard Westin menu is used. "Berries with Sabayon sauce" means berries with yogurt, or berries with whipped cream. No one in the hotel's staff knew what Sabayon sauce was. Funny, because 10+ recipes abound when you search "Sabayon" on the internet, and it's a simple recipe. Obviously no one on staff thought to attempt this "getting it right" when implementing Westin's menu at this hotel. It saddens me to think the potential of this hotel is so great, but the reality is so awful. Starwood, please get your branding police on the job. This property doesn't cut it, and certainly wouldn't even make the Sheraton brand proud. In the right hands, this could be one cool W hotel, but is probably too big to have that intimate feel. Maybe go retro and be true to the hotel's grand era - like you did with The Palace in SF. I gave this hotel so many second chances by communicating with the staff, but sadly, it's going to take more than a few dissatisfied customers to get this place fixed up. Starwood, get with it, please! I think I'm checking out tomorrow. Better service would be worth the price. I can admire this hotel's architecture better from across the street anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A once in a lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: JHP_Zuidervliet
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing experience... in a negative way. First of all we arrived rather late around 10 in the evening as we were driving ourself parking our car below in the garage. So far so good we gave of our luggage and checked in. We got our room and went up to find out it simply smelled so we went down unhappy. The clerk quickly fixed us up with a new room for their members which I must say was a bit better and pretty alright renovated. Now the trouble happened after 1 hour our luggage still didn't arrive so I called when they told me within 15 minutes it would be there, after 15 minutes of course it wasn't yet nobody was busy with it either it seemed so I kept calling till I got fed up with it. I went downstairs and expected my luggage to be there, which it wasn't. Actually nobody knew where it was after another 30 minutes it seemed that the clerk who booked us in didn't make it clear we changed our rooms and the luggage was left unatended in an unlocked room. The manager gave us as compensation a breakfast card for in the morning. The trouble was because it was that late because of this mess we weren't able to get any food except calling in some food in the room which we did which wasn't that great. In the morning after cleaning our tooth we found out that the bathroom was rather unclean. It has a lot of shiny materials which require clean water in the cleaning process which obviously didn't happen here. After going downstairs we had our breakfast which was another disappointment. The deli at the corner serves better food then here which made me happy I didn't book the room including breakfast. The last great feature of the room is that it has no soundproofing so if your neighbour picks up a girl, you can also enjoy it. Now it is a lot of negative things, but then if you look at the price actually it figures. It's rather cheap so yes... service is poor (or atleast we had a bad experience), the food is bad and the style itself is rather dated but its cheap. So if you have to be in the financial district and don't want to spend money it's a great hotel. Another thing is, though the hotel is dated it has its architectural features. I'm sure 35 years ago it was amazing, nowadays it's dated. Another important thing though make sure you have a car when you book this hotel as it's located downtown in the financial district. You can't get anywhere without it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust doorman”
Reviews.Author: goodfood-goodfun
Reviews.Content: I and my spouse take a cab to Hollywood. The doorman asks us where we are going. He calls a cab over, and sticks his head in the front passenger window and says something to the cab driver. As we get in the cab, the driver passes the doorman a couple of bucks. Hmm. I wonder why? Our cab driver takes us on a route that costs $39.85, before tip. Our trip back cost us $ 28.85 before tip. Wonder why the first cab driver cost $ 10 more? There was no delay in traffic along the way. I figure the doorman tipped the driver off that we were tourists and to take us for a ride, literally. Nice, the doorman at the Westin is actively working against the guests interest. Do not trust the staff at the Westin in Los Angeles. And by the way, we were in a suite; do not stay in a room anywhere near the elevators - it will be like living above the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrHao
Reviews.Content: Purchased on Hotwire for just under $100, so judging by value against that price... As others have noted, this hotel's probably seen its heyday. It feels a bit dated and worn around the edges, from the exterior, to the lobby, to the staff, to the rooms. That said, its still a fine hotel. Nothing to write home about, but for the price I paid, a decent value in this part of town with a nice sized room that was clean, nicely appointed, and well maintained. Parking's expensive, and I couldn't find alternatives in the area cheaper. 15 minute walk to Staples Center.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars, not for the room”
Reviews.Author: Karen552010
Reviews.Content: Purchased through Hotwire, paid $234 for a two night stay 19th-21st after returning from Mexican Riviera cruise on RC's Mariner of the Seas (look for that review at some point today). The outer appearance, the number of restaurants, the many stores inside (overpriced of course), gym, all 4 stars. Check in was quick and simple. Once we got on the elevator, it didn't have a pleasant smell and could have used some airwick/plugins. It was really unpleasant/annoying, I started breathing through my mouth after a while whenever we got on the elevator. Found out the hotel is pet friendly after the fact (had nothing to do with elevator/room smell, at least I don't think it did), and I LOVE dogs, (I have one and my dog smells much better than that elevator/room), but heard one on our floor 28th that obviously wasn't use to being by itself, whining for over an hr (at night) & we had to call the front desk twice. When we got off the elevator, hallway lighting dark, room carpeting dark, uninviting. Room was small/needs brighter carpeting. Room needs air freshener as well. Bathroom wasn't bad. The Bonaventure Brewing Co. inside hotel had great service and very good food. Glad I had $25 restaurant.com coupon, paid $33 for meal for me & hubby. When I was doing an expense voucher for my boss (attorney) he stayed at the Sofitel for $200 for 2 nights in LA, wish I had gotten that hotel. It would be interesting to see the list of hotels that are contracted with Hotwire. Normal cost would have been over $500 for 2 night stay and I would have been very unhappy had I payed that price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Facility - Wish I could have seen hotel in its heyday”
Reviews.Author: Allieooooops
Reviews.Content: We were here for business, so didn't leave the hotel a lot. This might have been good because the hotel is in a business district that effectively shuts down in the evening, and while the area around the hotel is nice, a couple of blocks over it's a bit sketchy at night. The public areas of the hotel are very well maintained and spacious. The rooms were nice enough, appeared clean with the fluffy white Westin bed linens that were nice. The pool was beautiful, a basic type of pool up on a deck but a good size for laps. Our only issue is that hotel directories list a lot of businesses that are no longer open. This hotel was obviously a hot spot for restaurants, shopping and lounges, as there are (oops, "were") so many of them, but not sure where all the people came from to support all the businesses. Some are shops are closed and others seem to be waiting out their leases with irregular open hours. The deli-type establishments and the Subway had good service and reasonable/regular prices - not resort. Keep in mind this is a downtown LA location, so the airport is $46 by cab. If you're in town to go to Hollywood or Beverly Hills or Santa Monica or Disney, you probably want to stay closer to those areas if cost permits.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: vrjenia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin while in town to attend a USC football game. We got a great rate from priceline (100/night w/ tax). Check-in (at 1am) was flawless. Were given a king bed on 29th floor with a great view. Yes, room was small on American standards. But we felt we got exactly what we paid for. Clean. Comfortable. A couple (hopefully) helpful observations: *Valet parking was excellent. Very fast. Very nice people working it. $35/night. * There's no street parking within several blocks. *Subway sandwiches on the 6th floor (great way to save $$ on lunch). *Walgreens about 3 blocks away. *Taxi to USC football game $20.

Reviews.Title: “If the rooms were as nice as the lobby you'd be in business . . .”
Reviews.Author: travlrfromco
Reviews.Content: Dirty, very dated, and bad service to top it off. Don't bother asking for foam pillows-the largest hotel in LA couldn't find non-down pillows, hum . . . Maybe they keep the foam pillows with the cleaning supplies, both are lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay -”
Reviews.Author: FRR94114
Reviews.Content: I grew up in LA and since the Bonaventure opened, I always wanted to stay here. Decided to spend a day or two in LA on my way back to SF from San Diego. Now that the 70's vibe is back in vogue, the place is more fabulous than when it was first built. We were able to check-in a few hours early and were given a renovated room on the 31st floor with a sweeping view of Hollywood and the famous Hollywood sign in the distance. The room, though a little small was well-appointed, comfortable, and quiet. Spent the afternoon at the pool, which was a perfect place to relax and nap in the glow of the LA sun before it went behind one of the nearby buildings. I highly recommend this property. While the signage is not very clear for those driving up and wish to park their car, I'd still stay here again. The rooftop rotating bar is FAB straight out of 1978 - but with 2010 prices. $31 for to two cosmos. OUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!! The Best of the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: EsmyLuvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: Has the Best Customer Service, Top Notch!!! Friendly and caring staff, delicious food!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Non Smoking Building”
Reviews.Author: rodztravel
Reviews.Content: Arrived early. Room was ready and clean. No extra charge. The room was quiet but the glass walls takes your privacy away. The building is non smoking and this is great.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: MrsPicky40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the yellow tower on the diamond level which is the 28th floor. The room was overlooking the highway but thanks to insulated windows, it was not noisy at all. Absolutely comfy bed with high quality linen. The bathroom was big and nicely equipped. It even came with a cozy bathrobe. A few more towels would have been nice. There is Starbucks coffee in the room, so you can prepare a nice cup of coffee at your convenience. Pool available. Lots of restaurants in the hotel complex. Valet parking only for an additional 35 $.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImproptuTraveler
Reviews.Content: Thought it would be better. If you are looking for a four-star hotel experience, go somewhere else. Staff was polite but very impersonal. In fact, everything about the Bonaventure is impersonal. After finding out we were going to pay $35 for parking overnight, we finally got to our room. First impression was not great. Carpet is old, which gives the room a dated impression. Beds were super-small, definitely not queen-size. Despite these issues, the room was quite, which was great. Also, bed and pillows were comfortable. At 7 am though the alarm went off (without us being even aware we had an alarm in the room). So, make sure you turn the thing off before going to bed. Morning shower got the entire bathroom fogged up ... Anyway, if you need to stay in downtown and ride in cool elevators, you may consider, otherwise find another place.

Reviews.Title: “We liked for our USC visit trip!”
Reviews.Author: GigiMontclair_NJ
Reviews.Content: My freshman USC daughter and I enjoyed our stay. Other reviews way too harsh! If your kid is going to USC architecture school, stay here and talk about it. The lobby and atrium are a lesson in architecture! Our room was clean, comfortable, with a nice view of the pool and view of the city. . We recommend eating outside at the Bonaventure Brew Pub--great happy hour prices for the food! before 7:30 M-F. This is a convention hotel, but we got a great rate when there was no convention. They should give free Internet--that was one downfall. Cross the street to the Starbuck's. We like downtown LA!

Reviews.Title: “ok if you get a great rate”
Reviews.Author: engphile
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the public areas need renovating and the layout is confusing. If you are a budget vacation traveler and get a great rate, fine. However, if you are a business traveler and spend much time in hotels, you will be disappointed. My room, while clean, had a poorly made bed. The bottom sheet never stayed tucked in. Some days I would receive bottled water but not others. It is important here because the tap water is nearly undrinkable. Some of my colleagues had dresser drawers with trash in them. If you have a room that adjoins to another one, you will definitely be able to hear any conversations in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- stay if you get a great room price. expect other costs.”
Reviews.Author: Canshy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking it on Priceline. We paid $100 a night for the room and we stayed two nights. The room was very clean and modern. Had a comfortable bed but a small bath tub. We were miffed to discover it was going to cost us $12.95 a night for wifi. Our safe didn't work so we stashed stuff at the front desk when we were out sight seeing but they eventually offered to have someone come and fix the safe. The hotel lobby was very attractive looking but the layout of the hotel was a pain. They have limited signage guiding you to the restaurants etc. Staff seemed friendly enough. We ordered room service- the food was decent and the service was speedy and friendly. They mistakenly gave us a wrong side dish (cole slaw) instead of fruit so when we called to let them know the error we had an enormous fruit tray delivered to our room right away (free of charge). Having come from Vegas where parking was free I was irritated that we still had to pay $35 a night for parking despite being hotel guests but I've heard that is typical in the city. I would have recommended this hotel until I saw a sign that's a little disturbing hanging in their valet parking area that reads: "CHEMICALS KNOWN TO THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA TO CAUSE CANCER OR BIRTH DEFECTS OR OTHER REPRODUCTIVE HARM MAY BE PRESENT IN FOODS OR BEVERAGES SOLD OR SERVED HERE". I mean seriously?????

Reviews.Title: “Did not like the Service!”
Reviews.Author: checkoutmywebsite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for an acting convention. It is very big. Tons of restaurants, Outdoor pool. Our room was ok. There were stains on the floor. The bathroom was nice with marble counters and floors. I had lunch at the lobby bar with friends, and the people that worked there did not seem like they cared about us and they just wanted us to go so they could serve the agents and directors that were there for the convention. Other then that service was good. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “old tired Hyatt disguised as a Westin”
Reviews.Content: This is not a Westin. This is an old tired Hyatt. Don't be fooled. If business brings you to downtown LA, stay elsewhere. I could list off all the un-Westin features but, it could take a while. Hey Westin Bonaventure, the 70's called and they want all their ugly interior concrete back. Q: How do I get to the 6th floor? A: Take the elevator to the 5th floor and take the stairs. "Hello room service. Could you send up some more that tasty white iceberg lettuce. It tastes so good." This hotel is so kid friendly their elevators have color coded shapes as names. I took the Blue Triangle elevator to get to my room. There was also a Square, Circle and Diamond elevator. Kinda corny. My room had a desk but not chair. I wanted to check out my hotel dining options but there was no hotel directory in my room. Heavenly Bed? Not exactly. It seemed like I got the down scale version. Next time I am staying at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Renovate Me Please!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArchitect
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure is a distinct one-of-a-kind property and has been featured in numerous movies. It has an amazing (but uber tired) lobby, and zippy indoor outdoor elevators. The pie shaped rooms are small and according to the desk clerk who checked me in, mine had recently been 'refurbished". All I can say is if my room had been recently refurbished I'd hate to think what it looked like before! It was tired, carpet dirty, lamps all crooked and the Internet was virtually useless. This hotel is an original John Portman design and almost 40 years old and man it shows. It is in serious need of a complete refurbishment. Not a room by room paint and carpet effort, but a complete, close it for a year and restore it to its original splendor, renovation. It deserves it. Until then, go somewhere else. Beware if you drive here, the overnight parking is $35!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is a wasteland on weekends”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the Rose Bowl becuaseit was close to the LA Metro which went out near Pasadena. The hotel was very full for New Year's. Our room was on a low floor, but still had a view of LA from floor to ceiling windows. It was tiny, and as the hotel is a circular tower, it all was at an odd angle. The bathroom was very large in comarision to the size of the bedroom, however. Even though it was New Year's, we slept very well. We knew downtown LA was very boring but you are really stuck out there. The hotel bar serves food but it is very expensive. There are a few little restaurants hidden in the hotel that none of the literature talks about---a pizza place, a salad place, a couple of Asian restaurants--they are back near the pool. They seem to cater to the workweek crowd, but were open on a Sunday when we finally found them. It is hard to get around the hotel because you have to take the right elevator to the right floor... The pool is tiny, but there is a nice grass area around it, and it gets sun refelcting from the local buildings. The finess room is a series of machines located throughout this area where there are also eateries--very bizarre. I'd stay here for business, but it isn't romantic or in a good location at all. It was very clean, but the lobby and public areas were really warm. A lot of the shop rental spaces were closed, so it just gave a weird feeling.

Reviews.Title: “BADDDDD experience.”
Reviews.Author: ladyandgent
Reviews.Content: BADDDDD experience. We arrived at the hotel at 10 p.m. after a very long day of driving and didnâ€™t get into a CLEAN room until after midnight. Room after room we went into was either partially clean, (missing linens, toiletries and towels) or fully not cleaned (slept in sheets/ place as left by prior guests). To make matters worse, it took repeat trips to the lobby which, in the tallest hotel in downtown L.A. isnâ€™t a short trip, before a staff member actual got out from behind the counter to find us a clean room. Once he began helping us go in and out of rooms with his master key we eventually found a made up room which was older than our original dirty room but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negativity about this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: pdazzler
Reviews.Content: First of all, I took a big risk booking on hotwire.com (I've never used it before). They rated this hotel as 4 star, and it was $96 nightly, so I figured I'd get a good deal with that. When I got confirmed, I found out the name, Westin Bonaventure and googled it. Needless to say, the reviews scared the bejesus out of me!!!! They were so random and mixed. I was afraid to say the least. Parking IS bad. Keep in mind though, THIS IS DOWNTOWN LA. Parking is bad EVERYWHERE. You pay for parking EVERYWHERE in California. We parked about 3 blocks away and paid 5 dollars to leave the car there, 5 the next day to get the car, etc etc. It was about 20-30 bux total (way better than the rip off $35 daily rate at the hotel). KEEP IN MIND- my friend and I are two 25 year old girls and we walked that area in the middle of the night and felt completely safe. The area is great. Access to major freeways close by, took 15 minutes to get to the beach, 15 minutes to get to hollywood. It's in the financial area of LA, so on the weekend, I did not see many people wandering about, it was a very clean area. The lobby yes..it was weird. Like 80's futurey..but cute! Check in was great. They honored my requests that I called ahead about (btw ask for a renovated room if you're okay with a King bed). We were on the 23rd floor..the room was immaculate and clean and we had a wonderful view. Flat screen TV's, very nice modern furniture and the bed was AMAZING. My friend and I shared it and it was so spacious and comfy..perfect for 2 (or even more) people to sleep in. It was an oddly shaped room but hello..the buildings are cylinders. I don't get the reviews talking about the cheesey furniture. It was very contemporary. We bought a falafal wrap in the food court when we arrived, it was delicious! And cheap! There are other options, like subway, pizza, sandwiches, a pub, etc.. Service was exceptional. I asked if they had a blackberry charger (my phone was DEAD), and they delivered it promptly, saving my night. We asked if they sold toothpaste somewhere in the building the 2nd night, and the friendly operator told me they'd send some up. There's a club downstairs that looked fun but we had other plans..maybe next time! Check out was a breeze. Just dropped off the keys. I work at a resort myself, and I know from experience, treat the staff nice, be friendly and request things with a "please" and they'll be happy to accommodate you. Be a jerk, and they will make your trip miserable. Maybe all the bad reviews were from people that expect the world, are rude to the front desk, operators, concierge, and will never be happy no matter what you give them anyways! All in all a great trip with a beautiful hotel room and super accommodating staff. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “A GEM OF A HOTEL IN DOWNTOWN LA!”
Reviews.Author: MLD31
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was courteous and friendly. Go out of their way to assist you. Had drinks at the top and it was amazing! Great location. Great staff. I would stay again. This is my FAVORITE Westin now.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Footloose39
Reviews.Content: Wow! Starting to really love priceline. Scored big on this very nice downtown hotel with all the amenities you'd hope to find, for $87.nt, when everywhere else was asking for at least twice that. My room was on the small side, but nicely done and the bed was awesome. The hotel itself is an atrium style downtown highrise, complete with glass elevators and indoor fountains. Check in was pleasant and efficient. I needed a one night stay somewhere nice, specifically in a downtown LA location, and feel that I got what I asked for and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great If You Want to Drive Constantly Or Never Leave Your Room”
Reviews.Author: sfexile
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to participate in academic conferences and for pleasure. I have stayed at big hotels all over the U.S. and Canada and never had as awful an experience as I did here. In fact, I usually have a good time, and am not a whiner, or "whinner" as one reviewer says those who don't love this hotel are. Generally I like to go for a walk every day to relax and explore the city I'm in, trying new restaurants, shopping, sight seeing, and checking out little neighborhoods. That was impossible here because the hotel has been designed so that it is almost impossible to go anywhere outside if you are not in a car. The proximity to freeways where the traffic never stops makes the air quality disgustingly bad outside, and you can't walk more than a couple of blocks without coming to an uncrossable freeway or road. The hotel staff seemed to have no idea how to get to anything in any way other than driving and had no maps to give out to tourists. There were also no maps or city guides in the room. On Saturday I found that even the small cafes near the hotel -- all grotesquely overpriced -- were closed for the weekend and there was nowhere to go for breakfast except the hotel restaurant where the simplest meal on the menu cost $22. The staff are nice and do the best they can in a bad situation, but the hotel is claustrophobic and there's no escape except to rent a car and drive away. Due to a physical disability I can;t do that. But they did give us free Wifi, so at least I got a lot of work done. Like all Westins, the rooms are clean and comfortable with a great bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: athens45701
Reviews.Content: My room - 2473 - smelled like urine. There is no free wifi in the rooms (in this day and age! Internet access should be like having a phone in your room, or water) Even more unbelievably, there is no wifi service you can PAY for in the room. The only option is a hard-wired ethernet connection, which costs $13/day. Guess what? Mine DIDN'T WORK. An engineer was supposed to come take a look, and in three days, he never showed up. This was paralytic for my work. I was furious, and helpless. Another joy - the first morning, after an exhausting late night flight, looking forward to sleeping in, the room alarm clock went off at 6am. I never got back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Was really concerned based on prior reviews... but what a relief! It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Missy025
Reviews.Content: Thanks to prior reviews we asked for - and cheerfully received - a renovated room. It was just fine - typical of any other Westin I've stayed at. Notables: This place is HUGE - a town (Westin) within a city (LA). Multiple restaurants, towers of rooms, etc. Service was quick and friendly - from the valets to front desk - easy and no complaints. Very comfortable bed - very. Slept like a baby The downside... ELEVATORS. ELEVATORS. ELEVATORS! Took FOREVER!!! And my husband once got stuck on the 19th floor (we were on the 27th). Seriously - waited 10+ minutes for an elevator. Very strange. PS We paid $85 on priceline.... that was a bargain! Parking $35.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, central LA downtown, Parking up to $47 per day!”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Single night here after some years. Nothing has been refurbished. The bed was good. We had a meeting that was well attended, service was not outstanding, facilities OK. Several attendees asked to pay $47 to park for the day. I stayed overnight so it only cost $35 .... Discount rooms from $99 on line, do the mathematics.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: msaligumba
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline and no matter how cheap we may have gotten this hotel room I would NOT STAY HERE AGAIN! The room looks old and the hotel itself is so dull looking. Parking is $35 a day! My bf called for towels and he forgot to ask for toothpaste and he calls them back right away and said oh im sorry is it possible to also get toothpaste? and the person on the other end of the line was like "u already called for towels.. what else do you need?!?" SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!!!! ALSO I left my moms IPHONE on the table and when we came back in it was GONE!!! we had to call security (he was very nice) and he told us they were gonna have to investigate it.. we left the room at 11:30 and when we called at&t they said someone tried to access the internet at 2 p.m that same day! and i kept calling the phone it was off.. CMON! u know when your phone is off someone stole it and turned it off! we filed for a police report cause this phone is very important!! We tried to talk to management but we just kept getting connected through security and said their insurance will have to investigate! We are a family that LOVES TO STAY at hotels sometimes we stay at hotels during the weekend and we have left things like laptops and cameras in the rooms and HAVE NEVER EVER HAD ANYTHING STOLEN! we were pretty chocked. PLS STAY FAR AWAY from this hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “worth staying at the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: blueskies145
Reviews.Content: Lobby is pretty, check in desk person was nice. Views were super! We wanted a high floor, got the 20th because we requested a renovated and 2 bed room. From what I understood, to get a higher floor you should only require a king. The room was not large, and these beds, "full" size as they are called, is small if you are sharing a bed. The comfort of the beds is great, the bedding is nice, but I just want say that if you think you will be sharing a 'full' size bed, it is not such a great idea. Our daughters would have preferred a larger bed, and actually my husband and I quite filled ours as well. He is 6'5" and I am small, but pregnant! The windows do not open, of course, so to get your air fresher, the air conditioner is perfectly adequate. Not a bad sound in my opinion, just a white noise.
