Reviews.Content: We got a pretty good rate on Priceline, but sadly, not good enough. This hotel needs major renovating. We will not stay here again. The Omni is by far superior. Also, I read about the parking fee and knew ahead of time, unfortunately all the lots around the hotel were already full so we had no choice but to park at the hotel. $40 to park is ridiculous, especially when the room was only $85!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: purplevicki
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am amazed at some of the negative views on this hotel. I suppose it depends on what your expectations are. I think for the $85 a night I paid for the hotel through priceline, as many people have done, it far exceeds expectations. if you have a car like we did, just park it elsewhere. I didn't know about the trade centre, but we parked at the Mariott for $18 per night which is not bad for the middle of a city. The room was very clean. Yes it is a little dated, but very clean. We had 2 beds which were very comfy and a great view from downtown from the 15th floor and we were not by the elevators. We like the fact that there was an italian restaurant and a pub as part of the hotel for reasonable prices which we could go to easily as single young females. The pool is great as was the gym. In fact, it is one of the best hotel gyms I have been to for a long time. Downtown LA is probably not the best tourist destination but it is very easy to get from there to other parts of the city. Overall, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Letter To Hotel Management...Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: mrspiggy549
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from California. Thankfully, once I checked out of the Westin Bonaventure Hotel, my vacation took an upward turn and became very enjoyable. The Bonaventure hotel caused me nothing but grief! At check in I was told that there was no room available. Then a king-sized bed became available. After much insistence, my reserved 2-bedded room miraculously appeared. A few hours later, I found out that my roommate had been placed in a separate room. Please note, that upon my arrival, I was told she had not yet checked in! Now, I was told to move my belongings to her room on a lower floor; no assistance was offered. Later, I discovered that my camera was missing. I called the front desk and was told to come down and get a new key to my old room, so I could search for my camera. Upon entering the room, I noticed that the toilet paper had been "re-pointed", soap replaced, and that the bathroom trash (my tissues and soap wrapper) removed but the room had remained unoccupied. Only the housekeeper had entered the room and my camera was nowhere to be found. Lost camera, I sadly returned to my room and notified security. Just as my roommate and I were about to fall asleep (2 AM), the phone rang. Scared to death, fearing bad news from home, I quickly answered the call. Thankfully, it was only hotel security, informing me that my camera had NOT been found...Could this not wait until sunrise? Next morning, securing my belongings, I called for the housekeeper. We had been told to phone, when we were leaving the room, or the room might not get made-up, as on the previous day. Around 6 o'clock the following evening (7/15/08), the fire alarm went off in our room. We called the front desk and were told that security would come up to check our alarm. Ten minutes later, when security did not arrive, I heard noises in the hallway. Upon peeking out of my door, I smelled strong smoke and saw many security men. One said to me, "Ma'am, you'll have to evacuate the building." Strangely, nobody had bothered to knock on our door nor did the front desk advise us of the emergency. My roommate and I, plus a few others on our floor, were ushered by police into a hallway for evacuation. Unfortunately, the uninformed officer had placed us in a circular hallway without an escape route. Luckily, an officer was standing near the fire door and heard us banging. We were then escorted through the smokey building to an actual stairwell. We walked down the 14 flights and attended our formal banquet in our street clothes. Next morning, the alarms sounded once again. Again, we phoned the front desk for information/assistance...The phone rang and rang, never to be answered. In a few minutes, an announcement came over an in-room loud-speaker (where was it the previous night?). We were told that the situation was being investigated, to remain calm, and that we would be updated, shortly. Since we did not smell smoke, we tried to remain calm. The message repeated itself, numerous times, as we dressed and went to our Hadassah Brunch. We never received an "all clear" but the lobby seemed calm and quiet. This was truly the vacation from hell...And I have not even mentioned the food service; yikes...4 bagels for every 10 guests! Although I did not pay for my room (front desk comped for my troubles), the lost camera, which cost over $300, more than made up the difference. I could go on with this horrific tale but my blood pressure is going up...I will, however, mention that a microwave, as was promised, was not available during my entire stay. The good news is...NutriSystem meals are not bad at all, when eaten cold! Upon returning home, I found my camera battery charger, in my suitcase. Please inquire if the housekeeper would like to have it or has she already "found" a replacement charger for MY camera?!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck yuck YUCK!!!”
Reviews.Author: liltoe7
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute trip out to LA and decided to book the hotel through Hotwire. Hotwire has never done us wrong and gave us four star hotels in Century City the last time we used it. So, I assumed hotwire would do the same thing, but I was wrong!! Like many, we were excited to stay at a Westin but staying at this hotel was like staying at a 2-3 star hotel. First off, parking is horrible!!! We were not going to pay $47 to park it overnight so we parked at the World Trade Center for $9.90. Second, once we got to the room, we noticed how outdated and dirty it was. The bathtub was peeling and hair, that was noticeably not ours, was lying all over the place. And to top off that, they did a monthly fire alarm testing for 30 minutes in the morning!!!! This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed at and the best part was finally leaving the hotel. My suggestion, spend the extra $47 dollar elsewhere.. especially if it has free parking. I would never again stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tjcoult
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Los Angeles to see a Dodgers game (even though we are not Dodgers fans, we are just into seeing old ballparks.) This hotel was the closest to the ballpark that had a favorable rating on Tripadvisor We were not disappointed. Sure the valet rates are out of sight, but we got a great rate on our room, the staff was superb, we ate at the LA Prime Saturday evening and the food was outstanding, we loved being able to walk over to the French Market in the Galleria for snacks and wine, the valet service was excellent, and the lobby bar was very nice with very friendly bartenders. When we checked out, a young couple with 4 kids were complaining to the management about stained carpet and said he had four more complaints. I did not stand around to here the other complaints, but I have to say I didn't view this as a "family hotel." If I would have had children with me, I would have opted for a Residence Inn or someplace with a suite. Oh, and the complaints about the different towers - the different elevators really cut down on the wait time for your elevator. Whoever thought up the concept for this hotel was thinking about the hotel client, and the layout makes A LOT of sense, contrary to others who complained about the layout.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel....pretty bad!”
Reviews.Author: your_ad_here
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the hotel is beautiful to look and and has glass elevators. But that's about it, any frequent Westin visitor will be disappointed with the dirty small outdated rooms, the thin walls (we could hear the person in the room beside us going to the bathroom) and the valet parking priced well above the nearby competition. They did knock off some of the parking charges because of failing to meet Westin expectations, and they do plan a reno in the fall, but until then, I won't consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “A City within a City”
Reviews.Author: Beachkidboy
Reviews.Content: Quite an interesting experience stay actually staying at this hotel. I've been here numerous times but never to stay until now. I was attending an event down the street at the Nokia Theatre and this was the closest hotel that wasn't sold-out. Besides all of the over-the-top excess this hotel offers, as just a hotel it was a very nice experience. I am a Starwood Preferred guest so the check-in line was short. This place gets a lot of tourists and groups so the basic check-in desk can get crowded For some reason their computer for coding your room cards was down so a bell boy escorted me to my room and said an active card would be delivered ASAP. I unloaded my 'stuff' went to the bar and pool and went to the concierge upon my return and got a new cardkey. Upon returning to my room another cardkey was under my door. For anyone who has never been here, the hotel consists of five circular glass towers. The first five floors are a shopping mall of boutiques, gift shops, and any type of food you can imagine, from fine sit-down, to quick take-away. This entire area is an open atrium of lakes, fountains, plants, trees, all done in an unfinished concrete style. Very nice and tranquil. Many seating areas, some open and some tucked away. There's a large open bar that wraps around a bit where you can people watch; and also another large bar/pub (Bonaventure Brewing Company) area a few levels up which opens up to an outdoor seating & patio area which also leads to the pool where you get a magnificient view of the hotel towers and a great deal of LA. All the way up to I believe the 35th floor of the central tower is a revolving bar coupled with a restaurant on the adjacent floor. Amazing views of miles of LA in all directions. As far as the hotel proper goes, all of the elevators are clear glass on the outside spines of each tower. If you have fear of heights just face inwards. They offer a fun experience and when you lower down to the fifth floor you 'go through' the roof into the glass covered atrium of the shopping arcade. It sounds like Disneyland, and almost is, but it's easy to find your way around. Just remember everything is circularly rounded, there are no straight corriders. The room I had was their standard room which I found very comparable to any other reputable major chain. There are some odd angles but nothing to write home about. They offer full room service well into the early morning, but with so many options available just a few floors below, save your money. Also a buffet breakfast is included but I slept in instead. This is a VERY fun place to stay, if not unfortunately pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Stained and dirty carpet and oddly shaped rooms”
Reviews.Author: nhumbc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to CA-110 and had no problems finding it. When we arrived late, I quickly checked in and did not use their $42 valet parking service. Instead I chose to park it myself across the street at the world trade center. The parking was only $9.90 with no in/out privileges if you arrive before 10 AM or after 4:30 PM and you could park for 24 hours until the regular rates kick in. This was fine with us since we only use the garage for over night parking. The hotel even has a walkway that connects the world trade center parking garage. Just take the elevator to the 1st floor and follow the sign to the Westin hotel, take the escalator to the 2nd floor and take the walkway to the hotel, which will get you to the sixth floor of the hotel. You will then need to go down a spiral staircase to the 5th floor to take the elevator to the room. It is inconvenient, but I am OK with a little inconvenience to save over $32 per night. The hotel has 4 sections (blue, orange, yellow, red) where the rooms are located. All the section are connected, it is designed like a rotary. So, if you go up the wrong color elevator, just follow the signs to the center and go around until you see the color you want. Each section of the hotel is shape like a cylinder, which is probably the reason the rooms are shaped like slice of pizza. The rooms are small and shaped funny that in order to open the refrigerator, I have to push the chair to the desk all the way in or remove it to be able to use the refrigerator. The room that we were first assigned had a stains on the carpet and seems dirty. We had a connecting room to a family that was so noisy that we had to request another room. The carpet in the second room was also stained and dirty, but at least it was quiet. The room has the air vent about a foot above the headboard, which I did not like. The bathroom sink was situated far in the corner, which makes it hard for our family to use the sink being only 5 feet and under. The edge of the sink was about 6 inches away from the edge. The shower had 2 shower heads side by side. We were on the 19th floor and had a nice view of the city. There were lots of shops and restaurants from fast food to high price restaurants. There were about 11 fast food places like subway, seafood, pizza, hamburger, Korean BBQ, Chinese, and Starbucks. Restaurants include Chinese, Italian, Japanese, and steak

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs in the Westin Bonaventure Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: RegBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Mon-Thurs business traveler to LA. I've been staying in the Westin Bonaventure Hotel in downtown LA since December 2007. It's a great business hotel and it has many conveniences. Unfortunately, I stayed two weeks ago in room 2958. (Yeah I have a good memory for numbers) It's one of the smaller suites on the top floor of the hotel (aside from the restaurant and rotating bar levels which are 30 and 31). Room 2958 had bed bugs. I didn't see the bugs but I noticed the bites immediately. Like I said, I am a very regular traveler and have heard about these things. They were definitely bed bug bites, the right pattern, the right appearance, the right insanely itchy sensation I have read about. I'd never actually gotten the bites before but I'm sure these were bed bug bites...also I noticed it the next morning after staying in the hotel and I did not have them the night before. There's nowhere else they could have come from. The manager at the front desk who is very friendly and helpful, he always helps me out since I basically live in the hotel, is named Patrick. When I told Patrick that my room had bed bugs and that I was sure they were bed bugs he explained to me that it's very difficult to prove anything but that he would have someone inspect the room. They didn't find anything..which isn't surprising since the bugs are really small and really hard to see and usually live in places that we can't see unless we rip out floorboard and mattress fluff. He said they would fumigate the room anyway. I asked him to call me and let me know when they had fumigated the room, and to keep me posted if they did find the bugs, etc, just for my own peace of mind. (I mean I really do live in this hotel) He still hasn't called me back and it's been about two weeks. Obviously that sucks and I'm a little pissed at Patrick. But I am more upset because right now I am in the Westin Bonaventure hotel in downtown LA writing this review at 11:21pm in a room on the 22nd floor and I can't sleep because my skin is crawling thinking that it may have bed bugs. I'm not sure why I came back to the hotel because I've gotten so used to living here I guess I didn't think I wanted to leave. I mean, Dec thru May were fine, no bed bugs to worry about. Needless to say, I've decided to switch hotels for next week - or maybe even starting tomorrow night. I can't sleep here anymore. If you've never had bed bug bites, trust me, you don't want them and you should not stay in this hotel for at least a little while and you should especially not stay in suite 2958. I feel bad for besmirching the hotel's name, but it's the truth and I thought I should warn other travelers. Best, A

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the valet”
Reviews.Author: venturasurg
Reviews.Content: Valet charges $42 a night!!! it's unheard of in LA. Someone at the valet stole a set of keys out of the center console(initially we thought they were misplaced), and wasn't returned until we made formal complaints with the hotel management. We also found that one of our house keys was missing!!! We had to have our house locks replaced, as well as having a security system installed. I will never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: denisenyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for business/pleasure from 5/26-6/1. It is a very odd hotel----the layout of the four towers makes it easy to get disoriented and you end up walking in circles around and around the towers. The room was nice once you got to it. Smallish, but very comfortable bed as advertised and great views of the city. As another reviewer mentioned, the staff is very nice---the bartenders in the lobby bar were great and the one night we went to the revolving bar, the lone waitress was very sweet and attentive. The hotel was built in the 1970's and is definitely dated---they used a lot of concrete and it almost feels institutional. As another reviewer mentioned, the 'mall' of shops and restaurants is deserted----the restaurants that are there are open at odd times---you'll walk all the way around a tower only to find that the restaurant is closed. The Bonaventure Brewing Company was closed for the first few days we were there due to a kitchen fire---not their fault, but just contributed to the feeling that while the seems to be lots going on in the hotel, there really isn't. We avoided the outrageous parking charge by not renting a car and using mass transit instead(we're NY'er's after all!). Took the bus to Santa Monica one day (really easy) and the Metro to a concert at the Hollywood Bowl (not so easy---took two hours to get home). I wouldn't stay in downtown LA again (was there for a convention)---it has the same deserted feeling that the hotel has----there are all these really tall buildings, but no one on the streets, no Duane Reade-type of convenience stores or interesting-looking bars/restaurants. It's obvious that most people don't live there, just go in for work and then leave so you end up feeling as if you're walking around a ghost town.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: This place was nice. I took the FlyAway bus from LAX, walked from Union Station to the Hotel. Better to go up 5th Street than 3rd or 4th because of the hill. (Angel's Flt is under repair). The lobby's really nice, I liked the roof top bar. Service was good. The bed was great. Okay, the bathroom was small, but it was still a very cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - not much else.”
Reviews.Author: shopgirlblonde
Reviews.Content: Everyone - and I mean everyone, from the car valet to the doormen to the bar attendants - is top notch in terms of friendly service. They excell at making you feel comfortable in what could be termed an un-friendly part of the city. However, the facility is in dire need of updating. My room had imprints in the headboard from melted candles; the bathroom ceiling is rusting; the walls are thin - expect to hear your neighbors and the parties going on near the pool (I am on the 30th floor!); and the chairs have springs pushing through the cusions. I am in an SPG room, so yikes. Heavenly bed, yes. Heavenly shower, yes. Non-smoking hotel, no - called to explain that the room next to me had a party of smokers, and they got a knock on the door and continued. Business center is closed on the weekends. "Mall" apparently has shops and restaurants but is deserted. The most concerning offense is one that is mentioned in other reviews: $42/day for parking. This is a total outrage and the other hotels in the area charge less than half this amount. I did not visit the LA Prime restaurant but did visit the Lounge one floor below - delightful revolving tourist attraction, ok wine, ok food, but seriously frayed, worn, guest areas - frayed chairs, dented wood, debris under my table. How sad. Bottom line: this hotel could be really great, but it seems that no one is paying any attention to it. Also: be nice to all the kind and wonderful people who work there - they deserve your kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the freeway!”
Reviews.Author: iliveforrelaxation
Reviews.Content: Before arriving to this hotel, I was already dreading it because of the $42/night valet parking fee. However, once arriving I figured that I still got a steal for getting the room for cheap thru priceline. Check-in/Check-out was fast and easy. Nice and helpful front desk. We requested a room with the Hollywood sign view but couldnt see it. (I'm assuming it was the fog that covered it.) Room was nice and clean but a bit small. The fridge was a nice touch to keep our drinks cool. The bathroom/showerhead was the best thing about the rooms here. Location was convenient as it was about 15 minutes to all of the places we wanted to visit. (with traffic it took a bit longer) Overall, I wouldnt mind staying here again, but only if I got a good deal thru Priceline again. P.S. We ran into Charles Barkley in the valet area one of the nights we were heading out to Hollywood, so I guess that was the highlight of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Piece of crap”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy93
Reviews.Content: I went through Priceline and thought I was being hooked up by getting upgraded to a 4 star hotel when I had bid on a 3 star. I was excited when I got there but things went downhill after that. There was no fans in the bathroom so my bathroom steamed up within 1 minute of having a shower, the people working at the front desk were pretty rude, the hotel was way too big for its own good. It took us like 15 minutes to find the pool area because of the size of the hotel and nobody would help us find it. Valet parking was an absolute JOKE!!! The point of valet is to bring the car out front but we were told to pick it up from downstairs where we originally parked it. When we complained at the Valet desk buddy got a little bit testy. $40.00 to park our car and pick it up ourselves, absolutely ridiculous. I will never stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, better bring your own food though”
Reviews.Author: jagdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a conference and an additional night for vacation. Check-in was cool, nothing especially good or bad... They put me on the 24th floor which is REALLY COOL with the elevators on the outside. The room wasn't very large at all, some comment it was kinda small, I'd say maybe slightly smaller than average for this price range. The room was still very nice, very clean, small fridge, the armoire was kinda falling apart, but who cares... Alcoholic beverages run $11.50 at just about all of the restaurants in the hotel, each domestic beer I think was $7. Room Service: 18% gratuity, $3.50 fee per delivery, and food was REALLY expensive (and not that great). Spent $70 on a steak, a long island iced tea, and some mashed potatoes. On a different night spend $70 on some chicken wings, fries, 2 beers, and a salad. Revolving restaurant: Seems a LOT cooler than it really is. Atmosphere is pretty cool, entree's are ridiculous, and the alcoholic beverages are expensive but strong. My wife ordered shrimp scampi and I a burger, she had a martini and I another Long Island, $101 bill. The shrimp scampi ruined both our appetites as when she cut into one the smell was gross (I could smell it across the table). Valet parking was EXPENSIVE and SLOW! I believe it was $40/day with no other parking (that I would consider parking at) any cheaper. Sometimes when I would call down to get my car it would take them 30 minutes and other times 5. And I tipped EVERY time when I dropped it off and picked it up. The hotel is not too far from the Staples Center and the Convention Center (about .8 miles walking). Not a whole lot to do in walking distance (not that I didn't feel too safe, just boring). There was a Brazilian restaurant across the street called Ciudad that was not very good in my opinion. The pool was really small for a hotel this big but in California who needs a pool at night or in the morning?

Reviews.Title: “Rode every elevator for fun. Add $42 parking. Hot, dirty room, peeling tub.”
Reviews.Author: Teddy365
Reviews.Content: I used to frequent the spinning "top of five" restaurant when the hotel was new (around 35 years ago) and loved the view. I finally stayed at the hotel after bidding $80 for 5 star Downtown LA area on Priceline, but it is showing its age. No fans came on in the bathroom. Old noisy, slow AC/Heat unit took over an hour to cool the room. Tilt Windows are screwed shut. Settings were high/low/medium fan with uncalibrated warmer/cooler slider. Tub repaint was peeling and fixtures were moldy at the bottom. The ice tongs were very dirty, as was the carpet. A Wet, used washcloth was found in the tub. Old Kleenex were found stuffed back in the box. Flimsy toilet seat cover bowed under my 165 Lbs. $42 overnight parking. Mini-fridge made enough start-up noise to wake me a few times. The bedding quality was very good, as was the Starbucks Coffee and the feel of twin shower heads. I recommend putting both the shower cutains inside the tub or the floor will get very wet. Nice consierge service in the lobby, but they rely on internet map/directions printouts that were not very good. Wi-Fi is $12.50 or you can tune in some other providers. Most restaurants and businesses are closed on the weekends, but the light traffic makes for a pleasant walk to CalArts/Disney theatre, MOCA, music center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Architecture, Lousy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ImperialBeachBum
Reviews.Content: Great Architecture and comfortable bed. We loved the views of LA from the 30th floor. Parking is outrageous so we parked at the world trade center next door for $10 instead of $36. The World Trade Center is connected to hotel by a pedestrian bridge and has a weekend parking deal for $10. Staff did not provide essential information about pool being under construction or that there was a pool voucher available at adjacent health club so my family (including 6 year old and baby) got dressed for swimming and were then told pool was unavailable by concierge. Next day we were informed we could have gone swimming with pool voucher - by which time we could not go because it was time to check out.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: carpinkly
Reviews.Content: obviously an older building with the Westin amenities jammed in -- like the three headed shower crammed into a very humble little bathtub. The views from the glass elevator were very nice as were the view from my room (I would suggest requesting a room with what they call a "panoramic view"). There was no mini bar or fridge in the room (bummer) and the menu on the TV didn't work when I tried to check out with my remote control. Westins really do seem all over the map in terms of quality -- some are amazing, some not so ... The ghostly and vast lobby certainly felt like a relic of a bygone age.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mudskipper27
Reviews.Content: My room at the Westin Bonaventure was so cool! I felt like I was in a space colony in Star Wars. I had a spectacular view, with windows from floor to ceiling on the entire outside wall. Gorgeous. The bedding was heavenly (I think it might actually be called Heavenly), and the whole set-up was very nice. Lovely, recently updated bathroom, plenty of closet space. Nice TV. The room service was delicious, but expensive (which is the case everywhere). I felt like a little kid riding in the elevator there, because it goes along the outside of the building, giving you a great view of the whole city. The workout facility is EXCELLENT. It feels like a high-end gym, with lots of machines. I would go back to this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: LVBecker
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to a Westin in Los Angeles, but I am not new to Westin hotels. I search them out whenever possible because they usually do not disappoint. This was yet another wonderful Westin experience. From the moment I walked up to the check in desk, I was greeted with a warm, friendly smile. On occasion, and for short stays, I will use Hotwire to book the hotel room. I have had issues in the past where some hotels have gotten a little snooty once they saw that I had used Hotwire. The Bonaventure never made me feel that way. From start to finish the service was excellent. The first evening my room service arrived quickly, and was top quality food. On the second day, room service was mind blowing!!! I had ordered a bottle of wine (not even an expensive bottle) and a fruit plate. The staff was very nice on the phone and told me a little bit about the wine. What arrived was the wine, the fruit plate, and a complimentary cheese that was huge. They had decided to send up a treat, I guess. I could understand doing this for guests who frequented the Bonaventure, but this was my first stay. I will definitely be visiting again. It's the small gestures and the thoughtfullness in service that make a hotel great to me, and this was a great experience. Once home, I called to see who the supervisors were during my stay and I owe Barbara and Jackie a huge thank you. For the guy who talked about wine on the phone, I don't remember your name, but a thank you goes out to you too as it was an excellent Pinot Noir! Not everyone knows about Frogs Leap.

Reviews.Title: “Good but has Bad Points - HERE'S A FEW TIPS”
Reviews.Author: MusicalTravel
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel through prieline. I paid $100/night the first time and $90/night this time. The major reason I didnt want to stay there was because the parking is $42.00/night, which is practically paying for another HOTEL ROOM at cheaper place. LOL TIP #1: PARKING - the Marriott hotel is right across the street and their nightly parking is only $16.50. Go there and tell them you want to use their valet but that you're stayin at the Westin. They will make you pay up front. Please keep up with all your receipts so that you can always validate that you paid. Its a short walk across the street. TIP #2: BECOME A STARWOODS MEMBER - If you become a Starwoods Member, you can get an upgrade to a suite (when available). TIP #3: DON'T EAT HERE - the hotel Breakfast buffet is EXPENSIVE without a cause. The food was SUBPAR! Save your money and go to McDonalds or Denny's which is several blocks up the street! TIP #4: INTERNET - The 24-hour internet Wi-Fi charge is $12.99. Either bring your own Wireless Broadband or go to Starbucks down the street. Don't try to use the phone in the room for dial-up. I almost got hit with a $60 phone charge because I didnt know they charged you PER minute PER call. The beds are some of the best around...they feel GREAT!!! The room was always clean and there is a mini-frig to keep your items cold. They have convenience stores in the building and its a nice hotel with easy access to major freeways. The service is pretty good - the only other bad thing was the ELEVATORS. One day I waited about 5 mins for an elevator to go down.

Reviews.Title: “Falling off brand”
Reviews.Author: SFBearTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular guest at the Westin Bonaventure in Los Angeles for about three years now. I will be the first to admit that John Portman architecture takes some getting used to, but I have grown accustomed to both the building and the location. That said, the Westin Bonaventure (a franchise hotel) is definitely not "On Brand". I find that the customer service is uneven and more focused on tourists than frequent business travelers. Maybe its a silly detail, but I was shocked to see that all glassware in the room was universally replaced with individually wrapped plastic cups (a la Motel 6). This is NOT the Westin, I thought. The smallish pie-shaped rooms are actually very nice and cozy if you get one of the recently renovated spaces. The furniture is more to scale and they offer a decent workspace and desk chair. Older rooms are impossible to work in. Unfortunately, they only renovated two floors and haven't made any new progress in 2 years or more. Even the renovated rooms have old style TVs rather than flat screens, which would open up even more space. Note to someone on the technical staff: PLEASE fix the wireless broadband service! It cuts in and out in every room every time. It is constant as the seasons and much more infuriating. Kudos to the gym. It is one of the finest free hotel workout facilities I have ever used and I make the most of it. The parking fees are OUTRAGEOUS! $42 for overnight parking in a city that turns into a Ghost Town after 5pm?? The Marriott across the street charges about $16.50 a night to park (and yes, they will let you park there even if you are a guest of the Westin). This is sheer extortion and its insulting. The Bonaventure isn't going away. It is a classic Portman "City within a City". Starwood, however, should really reconsider if it represents the Westin brand appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL BUT VERY CROWDED”
Reviews.Author: 1spartan1
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the WB. I had to attend a function at the Hotel and my opinion to date has not changed. It is conveniently located, but is so over crowded and it's very easy to get lost just trying to find your room. If you don't have a high patients level, steer clear of this Hotel, because you will easily loose your temper with everything from check in/out, valet parking and lack of neighboring amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very strange hotel, would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the strangest hotel I've ever stayed in. The layout of the hotel is quite confusing, and the hotel is very outdated. I do not feel that this hotel is up to Westin standards. Make sure that when you book a room that you do not book the lowest class of rooms. Some of the rooms (see picture of hotel floor plan (e.g., rooms 54 and 40)) are only a couple of feet from the glass elevators and people riding in the elevator can look directly into your room. The quality of my room was sub-par. The carpet was heavily stained throughout the room, the sink faucet was not attached to the countertop, the tub was broken in several places, and only one of my four bath towels were actually clean each day (i.e., you can tell they had all been washed, but many "washed-in" stains remained). Also, the colleague that I was traveling was interrupted by about 15 phone calls during the night with no one on the line. The front desk staff attributed this to "a broken phone system." While this hotel is extremely convenient to downtown LA, I opted to stay at the Hollywood Renaissance when I returned to LA on a subsequent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Embrace the 70s architecture!”
Reviews.Author: Elrainia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was designed some decades ago - and looks it, both from the inside and outside. However, as the years go by it is moving from being dated to retro and therefore somewhat trendy again. I've stayed here on a few business trips, and it takes a while to work out your way around the lobby (no straight lines) the four banks of elevators, the various shops and restaurants and so on. But it's a fun place and more interesting than your normal hotel block. The rooms are much like any other standard hotel business room, although they are wedge-shaped due to being set around the edge of a circular tower. Mine was a standard room with a large comfortable bed, a desk, TV and bathroom. The room has been refurbished, but some of the equipment in there (TV, ironing board) is pretty old. There is a fridge, but it's empty. The bathroom wasn't huge, but plenty big enough, and the room has the Westin double shower head, which is a great shower (although I did hear one guest complaining about wasting water as they were checking out). As a Starwood Gold member, I got free breakfast and free internet as part of the package. During the week, the internet voucher code I was given stopped working and I was told to buy a connection and they would take it off my bill. Needless to say, when the bill arrived the charge was still on there - a detail, but an irritating one. Also, due to various logistics my 7-night stay was booked in two reservations, one for three nights and the other for four. When I checked in, I was told that I could stay in the same room for all seven nights, but I had to call back into reception after the first stay was over to 're-check' in, give them my credit card details again, get my breakfast vouchers for the second stay etc. This seemed a bit odd as I was surprised that their check-in system couldn't cope with consecutive reservations. The breakfast staff aren't the most efficient ever, and people were frequently kept waiting for tables when I was down at breakfast. This seems to be a common theme in LA as while I was there, we encountered quite a few cases of inefficient waiters - much more so than other places in the US. Not sure if this is a trend or we were just unlucky. The breakfast buffet is good though as there's a wide choice of both hot and cold food. Even though many other people have mentioned it, the parking charges do seem high. I know it's a major city, but $42 per night? It has gone up considerably in recent years; about 4 years ago when I was there, it was $28 - and that seemed expensive then. I didn't actually have a car, so didn't feel ripped off by the parking charges, and the free breakfast and internet as a gold member meant that i got a pretty good deal overall. I think the breakfast buffet was $22, and internet $12.95 for 24 hours so you may need to factor these costs in. There's a well-equipped gym and two floors with various shops and restaurants in, plus other eating places within walking distance. It's a good location in downtown LA if you need to be in that area. There are other hotels around that offer a similar level of service, but go for the Westin if you want to marvel at the concrete design, lobby fountains, glass external elevators and other features of its 70s heritage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Rude Front Desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: Danarenaeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon. We got married in Vegas, then travelled to Los Angeles for two days before moving on to San Diego then to Mexico. We decided last minute to include LA in our trip and booked the Westin Bonaventure on Travelocity.com. We got lost on the trip from Las Vegas to the hotel in Los Angeles. When we finally arrived at midnight, the staff was entirely rude. We had lost one of our credit cards that we were to use as a deposit for incidentals at the hotel. We had five hundred dollars in cash to use as a deposit but they wouldn't budge. We pleaded with the front desk staff to use our cash as a deposit and they absolutely refused. We sat in the lobby for an hour until his mother from Las Vegas could call the hotel and set up a credit card for us to use. After a total of close to two hours begging and waiting with an incredibly uncompassionate and rude front desk worker, we did get upgraded to a Tower Suite by the manager. The bathroom was immaculate and the fluffy bed SO comfortable. We loved the ammenities, but pretended not to notice any of the staff, as most of them were incredibly rude. I recommend checking out the Pantry for breakfast. There is a long line but totally worth the wait. Huge portions. I recommend sharing with someone. Great local environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Class Hotel - Great Upgrade for Platinum Starwood”
Reviews.Author: brunob00
Reviews.Content: With a central location in downtown Los Angeles, this hotel is a perfect location if you need to be downtown or near the studios in Burbank. Positives: + Platinum members can consistently get upgraded to the suite. This room is huge with a separate living room and bedroom, two bathrooms, two TVs, huge floor-to-ceiling windows against the entire outside wall, and very nicely done bathrooms. + Decor is standard Westin. Even though this hotel is a bit dated in styling, the standard amenities and Westin feel is there. + This is a high rise hotel and you are dependent on elevators.... they are super fast and you will rarely wait. Plus, the elevators are external ... the view is great. + This hotel has an additional platinum members gift available instead of the standard points, movie or beer.... they have a basket that includes snacks that are pretty good + Views from this hotel can be amazing Negatives: - Parking is expensive - There is no self park so you need to ring the valet service before you leave your room to avoid a wait - TVs are small - maybe 26 inch. Cable reception varies widely between rooms. Some get great cable... others are full of static. If you love to sink into mindless TV after a hard day, you may be disappointed - The hotel is about 30 minutes from the airport without traffic. In traffic it can be much longer - Getting to this hotel can be tricky if you are driving since it is bound on both sides by one-way streets. Check mapquest first before attempting Overall, I like this hotel and the rooms. The reception area is nice and you get good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: JTSF
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed in my room at this hotel - definitely not up to Westin standards. My first room was really, really old and dingy, not to mention a little dirty. I asked for a rennovated room and they changed me (why hadn't they put me into a nicer room first if one was available?). It was better, but something was still off. There weren't any slippers - I had to ask to have some sent up. The bathroom lighting was very institutional. Also, there was no mini-bar. On a positive note, the staff was very friendly, and you get a free breakfast (very good buffet) if you are a Starwood PG member (I was not recognized as such upon check-in - I had to remind them...). Also nice to have the free toothpaste and toothbrush in the room.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality at Low Price!”
Reviews.Author: firemedic242
Reviews.Content: We had traveled to LA to visit family and had not intended on staying at a hotel. At the last minute we decided that a get away from the kids deserved a mini romantic stay. We booked through their website and we're surprised to see a $150/night rate on a Thurs. for the weekend! We immediately booked for 2 nights (Fri. and Sat.) Upon arriving at the Bonaventure, we were immediately greeted by the Valet. VERY friendly and helpful. They opened my wife's door and took out our luggage before I even got out of the car. Robert was great! We preceded to check in and were agog (is that a word) at the view inside. Really felt outclassed. (HA! HA!) We went up to our room and we met with a decent sized room with a spectacular view (see pics). The room might not have been the biggest but its not like we were gonna live there. The bathroom was small but elegant. We changed and then immediate went on the hunt for a Starbucks. The only bad advise we got was being sent to the wrong SB's. Go to the one on Figueroa, alot friendlier staff and not pretentious. After some coffee we preceded to the Bona Vista Lounge were we had great Martini's and a fantastic server. (Brandon I think?) The view was breathtaking especially at sunset. We also went the next day and after only one visit, Brandon already knew our drinks and got us a prime table along the window eventhough their was a wait. Though parking was expensive ($42) it was still worth it. We had a great time and were thouroughly spoiled by their staff. We highly recommend The Bonaventure and will be staying there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seelster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend for our honeymoon. We booked on Priceline and received a great rate! There isn't much going on in this area on the weekend but we were fine with that since everything is only 20 min. away. Mentioned that it was our honeymoon at check in and was upgraded to a king bed from a queen. The room was nice. Maybe a little older look to it but it was very clean with a great wall of windows. Of course the Westin's bed is amazing. Internet worked well but had to pay for it. The bath had a great shower with two shower heads! I knew the valet was going to be expensive but with the price we paid for the room it wasn't a big deal. Plus it was easy and quick to get our car. We ate in the revolving resturant the final night. Not very busy but it has great views of the city. Be sure to at least have a drink here! Being from Michigan, this hotel reminded us of a smaller version of the Renaissance Center in downtown Detroit!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: saved1
Reviews.Content: Excited to stay 3 nights until i arrived. The parking was 42.00 a day which was not disclosed and there is no where else to park with in and out options. The valet young lady stopped me mid sentence and shouted "wait a min"???what? I left my luggage and submitted my blue tag to the desk and 1 hour later called for my luggage, then it was delivered.???no sorry or anything? ok, perhaps I'm still excited to be here. Took a shower, wheres the robes that I saw online...??Called for an iron just to notice I did not have an ironing board, called for an ironing board and was delivered condiments and sugar?? I saw a heavenly crib on line and called for the crib for the baby that was with me and they delivered a metal crib with a mattress and no bedding or anything...did not look like the picture...which we could not keep because the room was so small there was NO floor space. The heater worked sometimes then not...oh, i was told it was fine...what?! Still waiting for the sewing kit i called for.... I shared all of this with the desk upon checkout and said let me know when you come back and i will see that you are taken care of....what????what about the 3 day experience i just had? Not done......went to get my car and encountered the same rude female parking attendant....oh my gosh, when will this nightmare be over..........and I paid a LOT of money to be here. I'm afraid I will not be returning nor recommending this hotel to anyone.....thanks

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Zoefilms
Reviews.Content: I thought the awful treatment we received was related to the fact that we booked through priceline, even though we paid 120 a night. The room was tiny, it was right beside the elevators which are neon exterior glass and zoom up and down like something out of blade runner. That in itself might be cool enough... for about five minutes. The bathroom was horrid, with thin, cheap towels and a mangy old shower curtain and was built in a triangle like some sort of closet afterthought. The bed was small and uncomfortable and when you opened the minibar there was NOTHING there -- not even water which is what we needed. I live in a loft in downtown LA and know all of the hotels because that's where I go when family visit. I can't use priceline anymore because I won't risk EVER getting put into the Westin Bonaventure again, which is a shame. Drop down two stars if you have to, it'll still be better than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The lobby”
Reviews.Author: xemyyxstarx
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The lobby was amazing! My father worked out in the gym everyday! There are many restaurants to have breakfast, lunch and dinner and many shops. Me personaly I love swimming and I swam in the pool a lot. The pool could have been a little bigger but it was very nice. While your tanning you have a great view of the city. The rooms were the best Ive ever stayed in. Comfy bed and very clean. Staff, very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms on the Way”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Westin Bonaventure as a kid ... in 1978. I thought it was cool then, I and I think it is cool now. I stay here frequently ... about once a month. This is not your typical Westin and you should approach it that way. It was built to be architecturally interesting and decades later, it still is. Just don't expect cookie cutter design. Clearly those that have had a problem with the 70's look to the architecture in the lobby areas (lots of concrete here) just want this Westin to be like all the others. The Bonaventure is a very interesting place if you look at it that way. Yes, this hotel was built in the 70's and was pretty bold in its design during that time. As noted in other reviews, the rooms are smaller by U.S. standards. They are pie wedge-shaped and the bathrooms are sufficient, but on the small side. Who wants to spend all their time in L.A. in the bathroom, anyhow? I had noticed that furnishings were getting a bit worn, but voila ... the last two times I've stayed here I've been put in one of their newly renovated rooms (see photos). The renovations and new furnishings are quite tasteful and make better use of the room's space. The desk is a great addition ... clearly a nod to the fact that hotel rooms are more like offices on the road for many more of us now, than when the hotel first opened. Colors are in the earth tones and the rooms are accented by some nice vintage photographs of L.A. There's new carpeting in the rooms with a modern design, set on the diagonal, which probably helps make the room look bigger. Every time I stay here, I eat dinner down in the lobby bar and, in general, I've been pretty pleased with my meals there. The halibut and chips is pretty decent. Plus, it is fun to people watch from that location. There are a couple of items that I feel compelled to nit-pick, even after the renovations: (1) My renovated rooms still had big, black, tube TVs. Surely they will replace them with flat-screen LCDs ... but then again, there's a new swivel stand beneath those black bulky dinosaurs, so that may not be in the works. Drat!; (2) The bedside tables are kind of built-in (or made to look like they are built-in) to the headboard surround and there are no electrical outlets bedside. You can move the bedside table and reach into the wall (or at least into the headboard surround ... see photo) and find an outlet there, but this is really poorly designed. People always complain about the mandatory and expensive valet parking. Hey, it's a big city and parking is expensive ... everywhere. I stay in a lot of hotels and while the Westin Bonaventure is not the most luxurious place I've stayed, it remains one of my favorites and with the renovations currently underway in the guestrooms, it should remain a favorite of mine for some time.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip-off.”
Reviews.Author: djdog
Reviews.Content: How did thee rip me off, let me count the ways: (1) $42/night valet parking fee, which they don't disclose till you bring your car into the basement parking area. again, that's $42 PER NIGHT. (2) hidden "delivery fee" and mandatory "service charge" applied to room service orders. tell me how exactly I am supposed to order my room service if there is no "delivery" involved? Now, room service is usually expensive wherever you stay - but what I'm against is the sneaky hidden fees. I'd much rather the hotel was honest and just charged more for each dish. (3) SEMI-complimentary breakfasts. supposedly as a reward for being a "starwood preferred guest", they give you a free breakfast. but when you get to the restaurant, you find that if you want the mediocre breakfast buffet, you'll have to add $5 per person (plus taxes and service, of course) to have that. otherwise you get a couple of slices of bread. or something like that. sure made me spit-polish my SPG card. (4) gift shop water. this isn't such a big deal, except the sales person in the gift shop is terribly crabby. $4 for bottled water. can you spell "rip-off"? not to mention, it's such a big hotel that you could die in your room and probably no one would notice for days. except perhaps when they try to charge you for something and you don't pay up. DON'T stay here. unless someone puts a gun to your head and tells you to. i guess a couple of nights in their tiny, weirdly-shaped, and poorly decorated rooms is better than dying. p.s. if you're an exhibitionist, ask for a room near the elevator shafts. everyone riding up and down the elevators can see right into your room. just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Gang Land”
Reviews.Author: Josie1977
Reviews.Content: The room was good and the bed was comfortable but the location was like nothing we have experienced before. Riding by bus to LA was one of the scariest things we have done and i was suprised we made it back from the so called 'jewellery district' alive. We walked around the area not knowing what to expect and stepped into Ghettos. It was horrific and i honestly feared for my life each day. The in house shops were far from boutique but you don't have alot of choice when your trapped in your room after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LizzieNC
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference scheduled at this hotel and we were able to get a decent price for the room. I have noticed there are a lot of bad reviews on this site about this hotel, especially about the decor. The room was smaller than most, but we had a king bed with an awesome view of the city. The quality of the bedding was wonderful. I did not want to get out of the bed. The linens and quality of the mattress were great. The bathroom was average size and the quality of the fixtures was good. The staff was very nice and helpful with information about area resturants and sites. Internet was not free. It was a charge of 12.00 a day. The elevators are glass which run outside of the building, offering a great view of the city. the hotel breakfast buffet was average. I would suggest walking down the block to the The Daily Grill. This hotel is also located near the 7th street metro which made it convenient. It was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK once you are in your room”
Reviews.Author: Bokk
Reviews.Content: We liked our room on the whole - very comfy bed, floor to ceiling window so we liked the view, bathroom ok. It was smaller than other US hotels we have stayed in but adequate for our needs. I didn't like the lifts on the outside, but then I am not good with heights so I don't recommend it if you are not either. The lobby and stairs are very strange. A bit like a 1960s English bus station, UK readers will perhaps understand that. The pool is overlooked on all sides by office blocks so we gave that a miss. It was only a short walk to the metro station which we found useful for getting around. We liked the revolving restaurant at the top. We didn't eat here but we had a coffee and watched the world go round. It is an OK hotel if you want to be in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the name fool you”
Reviews.Author: Miller5
Reviews.Content: Don't let the "WESTIN" name fool you into staying at this hotel; I can't believe they own this property. It is like no other Westin I have ever stayed in. We stayed here for seven nights for a conference. It is true that the hotel is located in the Financial district and the streets roll up after 4:00 and there is nothing to do unless you take a $60.00 taxi ride out of the area. The hotel is set up in the "colored tower" system and you get placed in one. You can get to any other tower from the one you are staying in, but if you want to get to an elevater to get to your room, that can be tricky. If you are on the first through the sixth floor you need to be on an odd numbered floor to get an elevator to your room; it is the wierdest thing I have ever seen in a hotel. If you want to go to dinner at the steak house on the top floor and overlook the city, you need to go to the red tower; it is the only elevator to take you there. You might want to bring dinner with you though, it took 20 minutes to even get a waitress to walk by to tell us she would be with us in a minute; we just wanted drinks and dessert; we walked out. The rooms can be small and we had one of the smaller rooms; two double beds up against the wall and the windows. With four people you will tripping over yourselves trying to move around. The shower dripped the entire time we were there even with three calls to the front desk. WE didn't HAVE ANY HEAT in our room the entire time we were there. I called for service five times. I finally stopped the service guy in the hall because he was working on the connecting unit next door. The heat worked for about an hour and then was blowing cold (in mean air conditioner cold) air the rest of the time. I did again tell them on checkout and got an "I'm sorry" from the clerk. I bought a new pair of slippers for the trip for the room; when I left, from the room only, they were black on the bottom; YUK. There is only one small outdoor pool and no jacuzzi anywhere in the hotel. You have to pay for internet service and to use the workout room. The downstairs bar and restaurant(s) are terrible and over priced. A child's order of pancakes from room service was $13.00 (tax, tip, delivery incl.). We did go to the garment district shopping. If you take the bus it is at 7th and Figeuroia and it is the E DASH bus. It only costs a quarter but the bus is always full and everyone pushes and shoves to get on it; it is the primary transportation system for the Hispanic population in LA and the bus driver was not fluent in Enlgish to help get off at the right stop; get a map from the hotel before you go. A taxi is $8.00 one way. The American Girl doll store is also located in LA; there are only four in the US and one is here. My girls loved the store and we took a doll home. It is about a 25 minute cab ride without heavy traffic from the hotel. The cab is cheaper from the hotel to the store than the cost for the ride back. You can take the metro bus 316 express but its a few blocks walk etiher way and not recommended at night. I hope this reveiw helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, But Dated!”
Reviews.Author: badlittledog
Reviews.Content: Descent Hotel, but no way a 4 star hotel. Maybe 10 or 15 years ago. The room was fine and the service was good, but there was noticeable wear on the furniture and the bathroom. I didnt pay that much for the room, but I was shocked to find out that parking was raised to $42 a day. As of a month ago it was $35. In my opinion, the parking at a hotel shouldnt cost nearly 1/3rd of the price of the room. I have stayed at many downtoen LA hotels and the parking is never more then $25 or $30. If you can get a great online deal, then maybe its worth it. Otherwise stay at the Omni, or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Average but ok”
Reviews.Author: Sursf
Reviews.Content: Rooms were pretty average...small and old-fashioned and not particuarly well kept-not a typical westin hotel. Location is good though for driving to theme parks, hollywood etc. Hotel needs to be updated and modernised (rooms, and service). Waiting staff in breakfast restaurant were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bucko_globetrotters
Reviews.Content: Touring California, we stayed here on the way through LA (having also done a night in Beverly Hills, Hollywood, and Santa Monica). The building is architectually impressive, and is well situated for downtown (where there isn't much to see - as tourists we shouldn't having bothered extending our trip to here). However, the hotel itself was great. We had a suite, with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Hollywood hills, and a gloriously comfortable bed. We really enjoyed our room. The hotel also has an impressive bar on the top floor, a perfect spot to watch the sunset. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “repeat Txgiving visit”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: Like many business hotels, dumped cheap rooms for Thanksgiving on auction sites. Average size room with excellent appointments. The parking garage was even more expensive than the previous year. Now $35. If I'm there again, I'll look for an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Need to update and learn customer service skills”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. It is a really cool building, and the lobby is large, but there is a serious need for updating too. Also, the worst valet parking I have ever seen. It is so bad that I had to ask them if they would let me go look for my car, because they had looked for my car for over an hour. It took me 2 minutes to find!!! Rooms are very very very tired, yet there is huge promise...TV's are very old, carpet worn, hallways worn...Housekeeping service always very friendly at this hotel, yet the customer service at this hotel, otherwise leaves a lot to be desired...Even managers do not follow through, typically when you need someone to get back with you...I guess I will take my business elsewhere... Rooftop revolving restaurant is one of the best views in the city...

Reviews.Title: “Over rated.”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little over rated in my opinion. Front desk staff and waiters in the main restaurants and the bar are very nice and helpful, but the hotel and the rooms (At least the one I stayed in) need some attention. Room, restaurant and bar area look old and worn down. My room had a cool view of the business center of LA, but IÂ´m not sure its enough for me to stay there again... Liked: View, staff, breakfast buffet ($20 pp.) Disliked: Room, bar and restaurant need to be renovated. The junk food restaurants on the 4th floor are NOT charming - its a 4-star hotel. Internet connection is $12.95 for a day - in all other hotels I stayed in on this trip, Internet connection was wireless and free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Westin”
Reviews.Author: claszyldy26
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend wanted to surprise me for my 24th b-day so he booked us a night at the Westin Bonaventure. He had read and heard that Westin is a very nice hotel. I have stayed at a few myself and have loved them all. He picked this one because it is in the center of downtown L.A. and thought the atmosphere would be good. I had nothing to do with the planning (it was all a surprise) so seeing his disappointment broke my heart! We were only staying one night because it wasn't far from home and because they are so expensive. He reserved a room one price level down from a suite, so he was expecting much more than we got. When we arrived they were doing some kind of remodel on the fountain so the smell of paint was everywhere. It also was a bit of an eyesore. My boyfriend was excited because he thought we had a really good view of the city in our room. However, when we arrived at our room it looked out across a street, nothing like what he was told. The room was big, it had a living room and a separate bedroom. But on the hotel's website it showed flat screen t.v.'s in every room. We had 2 20 inch regular t.v.'s, nothing like what the website said. Also, the bar area was old and paint was chipping off it. Maybe our standards are too high, but the little things do make a difference. Anyhow, we ordered room service which was pretty good and then went out for the night. My boyfriend surprised me with Cirque du Soleil tickets! The next morning we awoke and went downstairs to eat breakfast, which my boyfriend had bought a package for. However, when we arrived and gave the breakfast coupon to the waitress we were told it was only good for one person. We were told when we checked in that it would be good for 2 people. I was very upset at this point because of all the money and thought my boyfriend had put into this so I went to the front desk to ask why we were told one thing and now were being told another. They told me that when my boyfriend bought the package he bought he didn't put down that there was 2 of us. However, the package says a continentel breakfast for 2. They wanted to charge us an extra $20 for another coupon. I was irate at this point and almost in tears so I stormed back to the restaurant and was just going to order from the menu and pay the extra money. The only good thing about this hotel was the waiter who felt so bad for us that he bought my breakfast for me! I was very grateful to him. Other than that we ended up leaving early because we were so disappointed about this hotel. I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal if you can find one”
Reviews.Author: imaima
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Hotwire at a great price. Our room was updated more recently than those in the photos here on TA. The rooms, because of their wedge shape, are quite small and strangely designed. The Westin "Heavenly Beds" are always wonderful, and everything was very clean. I expected noise to be a problem because the rooms doors are all tightly clustered around a small circular hallway. The opposite was true-we did not hear a peep the whole time. As others have mentioned, because of the hotel's unique circular-wing design, many of the rooms face each other (or are near the glass elevators). This means that, particularly at night, you can see into other guests' rooms quite clearly. If you are in one of these rooms you will have to choose between enjoying the views or enjoying your privacy! The hotel is very... shall we say... "retro," even with some updated interiors. The lobby shops are abandoned, but there is a nice coffee bar in the center lounge. The rotating lounge on the top floor is also recommended - a little pricey, but you don't want to be walking around Downtown L.A. at night anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: MoBeans03
Reviews.Content: Got there Friday afternoon, left Sunday afternoon, and we have no complaints whatsoever. Before booking the trip we read a few reviews that complained about the parking, then again if you really must stay in downtown you dont want to park anywhere thats not covered and secure, the Bonaventure parking was 35, others without valet parking where five dollars less and you either had to walk across the street or a couple of blocks. That was the major complaint we came across. Once youre inside the hotel the staff is very helpful, polite and friendly. We stayed in the green tower, the elevators were pretty cool with an awesome view of LA. The room was great, at the front desk they told us our agent had booked a double bed room, but they were able to accomodate us with a single queen size room. I could write a lot more great things about this place, all i can say is that if youre going to stay in downtown this hotel is the way to go. The main reason we were there was to see our Dallas Stars play against the kings just a few blocks west of the hotel, i cant think of any other place i'd rather stay if we go back. GREAT PRICE>

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: yoch
Reviews.Content: we booked our stay on hotwire. We knew we may get this hotel and read reviews in advance but for the price we could not be beat. The AC is highly controlled and we were warm. we called the front desk and they said its november the air is off till summer. we can use the heat or fan. we were warm all night long. there are lots of resaurants in the hotel but the shops you read about are lousy they are selling a bunch of crap from the downtown fashion mart very over priced. Most of the shops are vacant not being rented by anyone. I would imagine in the mid 1980s this had alot of high end boutiques. All in all looking for a clean comfy bed at a cheap price this place is very okay. As long as being warm is okay with you! Dont pay too much you wont be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beldar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in early November '07. Room was very nicely decorated, nice bathroom, and the room was deathly quiet, making for a very relaxing stay. Bed was extremely comfortable, helping cure my jet lag. Was in the Blue tower, and had no issues that others have mentioned regarding room condition or cleanliness. Parking is $35, and could not fine a deal better than $30 without walking for blocks. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but overrated...”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: As participant at a medical congress the Westin Bonaventure was part of the proposed hotel.We choose it because it was possible to walk to the congress center.I've made the reservation the 1st day of the opening site, in June 2007. When we arrive at 8'50 pm, from France, we got the 1457 room, in the middle tower...Nice room, perhaps little in size for three(2 parents and our 14 years old daughter..) but not too little... Problem was the NOIZE...Beware, middle tower is where the vending and ice machine are and they are ANTIQUES... So, I go down and they relocate us to the 1051...in a lateral tower, far from those machines...Rooms here are smaller but as we are not a long time in it(a lot to do...)it was OK...But the tenth floor is the first floor of guest rooms and so you have the "ventilation" fan from the lobby on the "roof" , a little noisy(less than ice machine..). I go down to try to get a room on a higher floor and come the usual sentence : sorry but as you check in late, you've got the last rooms and so in the lower floors...Even with my Starwood card impossible to change...They were sold out... It's not the first time I've this respons in US and I find this policy a litlle...stupid!!! Whe I was student, I've worked in the hotel industry and in France, sooner you reserve and better is the room you have in the category of price you request...Here, just to check in early and you have the best... For the last 2 nights we have had a room adjacent for our daughter, at the same rate, they said...By chance, I verify and on the note, the rate was the one of a triple occupancy...So I've to go to reception to have the correction...(double occupancy for the last 2 nights of the 1051 and single occupancy for the 1052 where was our daughter..). So, nice location in downtown, not far/Stapple center, chinatown, metro...but this hotel has now its "age" and need to be rethinked in size of rooms and room's attribution policy... Erik.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: muffyf
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and paid very little, so we were okay with the downtown location for a touring trip. However they gave us the smallest room (it did not have room for a closet) that was right next to the elevators, because we were paying so little. We went to Catalina Island one day, and the hotel location was actually really good for that because it is right next to the entrance for the harbor freeway. Parking was very expensive and wireless internet was not free. We liked the gym and the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Westin”
Reviews.Author: RonJon949
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for the low price I got, but this Westin isn't nearly up to the standards of other locations. Carpet and furnishings are due for an upgrade. The hotel in general is a very dated. Not a terrible place, but easy to do better downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - overrated and overpriced for the experience!”
Reviews.Author: twooSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This was my first and last stay at this hotel â€¦ let me paint the picture â€¦ as I initially arrive I am impressed with the entrance and the size of the facility and I am expecting a high level of quality. This was not the case. The front desk staff was friendly who checked me in. I went to my room and as I walked in I realized that the room had not been made up! â€“ the bed was messy with hair on the sheets, towels on the floor â€¦ not what you would expect at a good hotel. So after a quick call to the front desk, I was assured that I would be immediately moved to a fresh room â€¦ (after a long day Iâ€™m obviously tired and just want to get settled in) â€¦ so after a 35 minute wait in the dirty room someone finally brings me new keys to a different room. The next room has been cleaned and had fresh bedding, but was not sparking clean to the standards you would expect at an upscale hotel â€¦(the remote control had bits of food on it, the side table still had rings where drinks had sat) regardless I was happy to get settled in and get some sleep. However, â€¦ as it turns out Iâ€™m in a room which has the capability to join to the next room so the sound barrier between these 2 rooms is not as good as it would be in a separate room â€¦ shortly into the evening the guests in the next room begin making noise that was very unpleasant and frankly disgusting (screaming and moaning and slapping and more screaming â€“ a bit scary really) I called the front desk to ask to have security stop by â€¦. 25 minutes went by and no security, but the party next door carried on â€¦ (on and off for 2.5 hours) â€¦ so as the noise continued I called the front desk again and still nothing! This all made for a terrible experience and resulted in my leaving feeling very disgruntled. Service industry? Good luck with the future of this hotel if this type of service continues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: crashcase
Reviews.Content: Great location.. in the middle of town, starbucks across skybridge. Parking attendants quick and helpful. Rooms are small and could be updated, dbl queen good for 2 people, baths could use an update as well, but are acceptable. I always stay here when doing business in LA, and will continue to do so

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: downinit
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a place downtown since I was going to a party down there anyway. I got a great rate on Priceline (about half of the current rate), so for the money, it was an excellent hotel. But if I was paying the regular rate, I would have been disappointed. The Heavenly bed was not as nice as the one I slept on in Vegas last month, with far fewer pillows and just not as soft. The room and bathroom was long-overdue for a remodel, definitely an original. I would say it was a solid 3 star room, but not up to 4 star standards. The service and and lobby were very nice. The architecture is definitely interesting, as is walking from one end of a floor to the other, winding around the different columns. We were on the 30th floor, so we had a nice view of downtown, and glass elevators were quick and scenic. There are a number of restaurants and eateries in the atrium and across the street. Many of which rely on the downtown businesses, so they may only be open during the work week, but some are open every day. The location is only a few blocks walk to the red and blue line subway station, which gives you good access to Hollywood and Universal Studios, as well as LAX access via the blue and green lines. You can also get to San Diego and Disneyland via the red line to Union Station. So you could theoretically stay here and not have to rent a car to see most of Southern California, although Santa Monica and Venice beach access would require a bus or car. But personally, I hate driving, LA traffic is very ugly(even nights and weekends can be a pain depending on when and where you are going), and parking is not cheap (especially downtown). If staying downtown is an option, this is a good place to stay if you can get a good deal on the room. Otherwise, wait for a remodeled room or get a suite if you want a 4 star experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: SamNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The check in was easy. However, the service for check out was slow. The hotel is very large, but well marked so it is not hard to get around. The rooms are small, but clean. The maid service is adequate. The Gym is small, but there is adequate equiptment. The pool is small and in the shade most of the day. The sun is blocked by the large surrounding buildings. There is no lifeguard. The restaurants are expensive or just fast food. The hotel is centally located. You will need a car to see the city. Parking is expensive at $35 daily. The parking people are pleasant and helpful. The Internet and telephone service are expensive. Overall my experience was adequate and I would stay there again. The prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay - -the staff was superb.”
Reviews.Author: TruNYer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a biz trip and overall was very pleased with my stay. The staff was completely amazing, each and every person there could not have been more helpful and friendly. In addition to the usual, the room was full of the amenities I crave -- coffee maker, robe, lots of towels -- and some bonus ones -- disposable razor, toothpaste and more. The one negative I had was with the building structure itself. The building could not be more confusing and difficult to navigate, sometimes downright dopey. Lobby/registration on the lower level, entrance on the 2nd, food on the 4th -- in both cases, one has to walk or take an escalator to the 2nd or 4th floor from the Lobby or 3rd floor (just re-reading this makes my head spin!). The same confusing architecture in the room, I have never seen so many angles, and thus so much wasted space. EVERYTHING was angled, the bed, the bathroom sink, even the toilet! Plus the desk was placed perpendicular to the TV, which made for difficult working time (yes, I like the tv on when I work at a hotel room). And I was also frustrated with how slow it took to get elevators to/from the room. All that said, I still would recommend this hotel. The location was also very convenient for my needs and I was able to walk to MoCA, Little Tokyo and other spots -- and no, didn't get arrested for walking in LA :)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful convention hotel in downtown los angeles”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: i attended a very lare conference (3700 people) held at this hotel - the rooms are tip top - the adjoining galleria with shops and restaurants was handy - the food at these restraurants was less expensive than those owned by the hotel - the meeting rooms were wonderful - the main ballroom, the california ballroom, was large enough to accomodate most of the attendees for the main saturday night event - only a few had to go to the overflow area in the santa barbara ballroom - the pool deck was nice i would recommedn this hotel for anyone, especially those who are organizing a convention for more than 2000 people

Reviews.Title: “Travel back in time... to the 80s”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here at $139/night on Travelocity over Labor Day weekend, and was satisfied with the room, but not the hotel in general. I found metered street parking Saturday afternoon. Check-in was a breeze even though I was there early, around 2:30pm. The layout of the hotel is comical.
