Reviews.Title: “Corporate blah, but overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: emnmike
Reviews.Content: For leisure, this hotel would not be my choice to visit. But I was visiting as part of a conference, and it was better than most corporate- type hotels. The room was small, but the dual headed shower and the HUGE window was great. THe decor was very nice and the desk was very useful. Besides adding a fridge, the room amenities were more than adequate. The hotel itself is huge and confusing to navigate. However, there are lots of bars, restaurants- both fast food and sitdown- and shops inside the hotel. I didn't leave the hotel at all one day! The staff were very friendly. The concierge was very helpful and the front desk was as well. One suggestion- what is with the $13/day internet????????? You are a conference hotel- enough with the nickel and diming! Also $24 room service breakfast is ridiculous, even for a 5* hotel, which it aint. Overall, Starwood did a pretty good job with this one. Character? no. Charm? no. Adequate? More than.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!! WHAT A PLACE”
Reviews.Author: mattywebster2000
Reviews.Content: I cant quite work out some of the comments made on this hotel. I recently vivited the Bonaventure as part of a west coast tour - so dont know how much i paid. however this hotel is superb - nothing wrong with the lifts or the cleaners. I found the rooms a little small - but there was just the 2 of us so it was fine. Go to the top floor for the revolving bar - and buy a cocktail and get the novelty glass remembering that this isthe 4th most photographed building in the world. the 4th floor offers a variety of food outlets of which we used the same one each day (cant remember the name-sorry!!) - but you could get a fry up and a tea/coffe/juice for about Â£2.50!!! I would also note that this is very close to the tube station which offers easy access to the airport and hollywood/universal studios - and the american tube is nothing like the ones in london. everything is so clean. for Â£1.50 you get a day pass which we used to go to the above.also i didnt come across one tramp/begger/bum whilst on the tube/station - again unlike those who are unlucky enough to have experienced the london underground. all in all - great hotel , great position , great place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the bonaventura in mid november 2004 and wow what a building! as me and my friend pulled up in our taxi we knew we had made an excellent choice check in was very fast and the staff friendly. it was a little confusing finding our rooms at first we stayed in the red tower and our room was amazing with a great view it had a strange shape ut that didn't bother me we had nice bathroom with a heavenly shower which is an experience you shouldn't miss! as for the heavenly beds as soon as you sat on them you didn't want to get up i had the best night's sleep ever! in these beds so soft you just didn't want to get out of the bed in the morning we ate at the revolving cocktail lounge it was alittle expensive but you do get to keep the glass which makes a great souvenier. the hotel is in a good location as the metro stop is only a short walk away and a great way to get around buy an all day ticket for $3 it also takes you to universal city home of universal studioes a great day out on our last night we treated ourselves to a meal at the L.A Prime resturant on the 35th floor the views were amazing and so was the atmosphere the waiter was great and didn't mind taking our picture for us i would recommend the steak it is the best i ever tasted however it was a little expensive but worth it we ended up with doggy bags as we ordered too much. if you are on a budget there are some shops on the lower floors and fast food places we only had 1 problem and that was on our last night after returning from an evening out when we returned to our room our key card would not work we went to reception and they told us they would call security they also wanted I.D but it was in our room we went to our room and had to wait 30 minutes for security to arrive at this point me and my friend were a little worried he was very helpful he then told we had been mistakenly checked out and had to go to reception to check ourselves back in we were not that pleased at reception we were told it was nothing to worry about and that was that! we went back to our room without an apology or anything. apart from this incident everything was great i would def return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 girlfriends stayed in this magical hotel June 2004. When we arrived it wasn't busy, and I was pretty much expecting a whole herd of people waiting to be checked in. It's amazingly spacious, and the people behind the desks were professional. The lobby is presented in such a way that you are left staring! Fountains and water features everywhere! Our bags were taken up for us to our room which was (from my recollection) in the yellow block. The rooms were lovely, the bathroom was big enough (seeing as there were girls rushing in and out of there 247) and the beds were huge. Everything was clean in that room, and the sheets were divine! Clean towels were bought up each day. The hotel itself is what I call Heaven!! When riding up in the elevator a fellow tourist commented on how the revolving restaurant (food) didn't live up to his expectations-so we didn't actually bother- However I wish I didn't listen now! The only downfall of this hotel was it's location. Thankfully we had a friend in California who was able to drive us around, but frankly had we been on our own there we wouldn't have survived. Seemed like everything was out of reach. Although if you are looking to pay for a room at this hotel I am sure you can afford the few bucks to get a cab from A to B. The running track is useful for those who intend to keep up with their daily exercise regimes. The pool wasn't in use during the month of June-still quite chilly. All in all, if you have in mind the means of transport you intend to use then this hotel is the best! It's clean, modern and everything you'd expect from a high class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff at check in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure on March 5, which was the evening before the LA Marathon. Granted, they were exceptionally busy, but the hotel parking lot was full and they very rudely told us to park in an independent lot across the street. I had called 4 days prior to my stay requesting non-smoking with two double beds. At check in, the receptionist informed me that as a Priceline customer, I would get "any run of the mill room." In this case, smoking. The carpets are dated and stained. The rooms are smallish, but decent. The lobby area is nice. Overall, not 4 star hotel quality and if you book on Priceline, be prepared to be treated like a second class guest and they will tell you this to your face at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: filmbuff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from LA and I really enjoyed our one night at the Bonaventure. My wife is still talking about the beds- best ever. The rooms are somewhat small but fine for two. Top notch decor and bedding. Floor to ceiling windows and a view of the Hollywood sign on Oscar night- great fun. Our room was quiet on 17th floor of the blue tower. Watched commercials being filmed on streets below- Sunday downtown was deserted. Lots of food options. $25 parking is a bit much. If you don't need pampering- this is a great spot for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great city views”
Reviews.Author: Ryanoles
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Bonaventure overall was a positive one. The staff is very friendly and helpful (possibly the only exception is the "manager" of the concierge, who is a stern woman) and the hotel offers basically anything you need. My room was on the 26th floor of the red tower, and the view from the floor to ceiling windows were incredible. Not that I'm an expert on decor or anything, but I know what I like and don't like, and the wallpaper in the room was just awful and very outdated. The beds were extremely comfortable and I had great sleeps on it nightly. I did feel, however, that the TV was placed in a weird position to the bed as it was on the side wall and I had to turn it so I could watch it from my bed, which was kind of weird. The pool was outside and it was rather small and looked a little gross upon first look, but I ended up swimming in it and it was just fine, nothing special but not horrible. The elevators in the hotel and kind of cool as they having windows that let you look around at the views. I felt the location was very good in downtown Los Angeles, and I would return to the Westin Bonaventure if I was back in downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful at the Bonaventure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure is a like a city within a hotel. You never have to leave, which is a good thing with all of the rain. We were happy to be able to buy any kind of moderately priced, good quality food right there. That is the good news. The elevators are very slow, and often not working. There are ample stairs, but many security issues since they are open to the food court and shopping areas. We had a man exposing himself several times to teenagers near the stairs and elevators. Be careful!

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: wjdawson
Reviews.Content: The staff was very responsive, the room was smallish but very nice: tastefully decorated, clean, comfortable (LOVE the heavenly bed); but indeed, the walls are thin and I was thankful that the person in the room on the other side of the connecting door kept his TV low. Paid $139/night, which I thought a good value for downtown L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Norma Desmond's Spirit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure reminds me of Norma Desmond in the film "Sunset Boulevard." Except here, the decade that the calendar remains stuck to is 1970, not 1910. This hotel needs some serious work on its aging infrastructure. During a three night stay, the water to most guest rooms had to be turned off for part of one day, the water temperature in the shower was cool and the cold tap ran hot. Much worse was a screeching external elevator - possibly caused by the rust in the elevator shafts that's clearly visible upon looking that meant sleeping with earplugs. If you do stay here, avoid the Red tower - partly because of the screeching elevators, but also because these elevators are the only ones that lead to the rooftop bar and restaurant, and are thus mobbed in the evening. For $60 on Priceline it was ok, but I would not stay here again if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great”
Reviews.Author: sirsteve
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Bonaventure, everything was great, the Heavenly beds are just that...the BEST bed I ever slept in. The room was very good, shower excellent. We were next to an elevator but it caused absolutely no problems. There is plenty available in the hotel especially on the 4th floor, take a look. Parking is $25 overnight but you have in/out privilages. I was extremely satisfied....room service however is a little overpriced. Will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is...Damn!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was here for the IMTA convention representing Barbizon ATL. The first day there, me and my roommate got lost inside the hotel for about 3 hours trying to find our room. This place has everything you could possibly need just inside!! Look out Hollywood...I'm COMING BACK FOR GOOD!! -superstar CHRIS BOWEN ATL GA

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wonkadog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Westin on New Year's Eve this year. It was a nice place to stay in despite some complaints you'd see on this site. I was worried about the location being a bit shady, however that couldn't be further from the truth. It is in an upscale portion of downtown and I didn't feel threatened whatsoever. The rooms are small but it was an awesome view from the 24th floor. I am from Iowa so it was entertaining to be able to open our window and look into the other skyscrapers surrounding the hotel. It was also cool to people watch in other rooms out your window (since the hotel is round). There was also a nice store inside the actual hotel where you could buy alcohol...that was really nice. All in all a good place to stay if you're looking to spend a little more money....our room was $165.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pro's 1) Fantastic service: We used hotel services quite often and the response was fast and very friendly. Food was excellent. 2)Great location. 3) Great beds Con's 1) Room are small.....what the heck...your there to sleep:)

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherineandjohn134
Reviews.Content: Hip and different, the Westin Bonaventure is a cool, signature LA hotel in a fantastic location. After Disneyland our LA vacation included stops at the California Science Center, Hollywood and Universal Studios. The Bonaventure was in the perfect location to hit all these spots then have easy access to LAX on our departure day. The hotel is very cool with great views of the city, odd shaped rooms, a heavenly bed, and heavenly shower. There are a ton of options for dining in the hotel, everything from take-out, to a plush steakhouse at the top of the building offering good food and fantastic atmosphere. I am a member of the Starwood Preferred Guest program and I highly recommend joining this fantastic rewards program. We booked our reservation on-line at westin.com and got a better rate than on the travel websites and cheaper than anything in Hollywood or the Universal City area. The one downside is parking. At $20 per day it is pricey. Overall, we really enjoyed our time at the Westin Bonaventure in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you need a cheap place to stay downtown, this is great--$60 through priceline. Not the most updated place, but perfectly fine, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to LA for her 70th birthday. We didn't rent a car and wanted to stay downtown because we had tickets to a concert at the Walt Disney Concert Hall. I chose the Bonaventure from this website and was not disappointed. The staff was excellent--very friendly and helpful. While the decor of the room was a little dated, the views from the huge windows of our suite were wonderful, and it was so helpful to have two bathrooms and a door to close between rooms. Everything was clean and the staff promptly brought up whatever we asked for. Having shops and many small restaurants on the various floors of the lobby area was also a plus. We came to LA partly for the architecture, it was a joy to stay in a hotel with such an interesting, open, modern design.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bonaventure: Power showerheads”
Reviews.Author: ainge
Reviews.Content: Staying twice at the Westin Bonaventure Hotel and Suites...it has a nice lobby, good scenery, overall, feels very big and high-class. Elevators are cool with 4 towers of elevators. Shops and restaurants are plentiful in this hotel. On the room...a basic room has all the basic amenties. A little run down in my opinion, with holes in the walls and just wear and tear over the years. For my bathroom, I threw up in the sink (just a few chunks of chicken), and the next morning, it was draining very slow. Tub was draining slow for my shower, too (no I didn't throw up in the tub). The shower was a HIGH Pressure double-headed monster (which is good). Walls are very thin (25th floor, the Starwood Preferred Floor).

Reviews.Title: “People just love complaining!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people make such a fuss! After planning a 4 day trip to LA and San Diego in late June, I ended up booking two rooms at the Westin Bonaventure because of the location and close proximity to both Santa Monica Fwy and the Hollywood Fwy. Then I found out about the existence of tripadvisor.com and read some of the negative reviews here. Having already pre-paid for the rooms, I couldn't cancel and was very very nervous about our stay at the hotel. Turns out, there was nothing to worry about. Yes - the hotel is a little too "urban" and can come accross as very crowded. But at the same token, the floors were quiet. The check-in was fast and efficient and we got both of the rooms on one floor, close to each other. It is true that you could potentially lose your way around the floor because of the different towers, but it's not THAT big of a deal. Both rooms were great, clean and well decorated. They were a little small and oddly-shaped but not to a point where it bothered us. The view was beautiful, especially at night (well, we were lucky to be up high in the building). Here comes the most wonderful part of the hotel though - the HEAVENLY beds! What an appropriate word to describe my sleep there. Super-extra-comfortable, luxurious, warm, cozy, soft... Not any less wonderful are the heavenly showers which make you want to stay in the shower cabin all day long. The bathrooms are beautiful, spacious enough and equipped. Note to ladies - take shampoo and soap from home because my girlfriend claimed that the soap and shampoo smelled like a guy's cologne. Overall the hotel presents good value if you get discount room rates (we paid $150 per night per room). It's great to be able to get on the two highways close by and be in Hollywood in 15 minutes or in Santa Monica in 30. The one major downside is the mandatory $20 per day valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Westin Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: liatgodwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure recently during a very busy weekend. The staff was incredible, and went above and beyond for us. When we called down for an additional blanket, it was sent up immediately, we had at least two of the hotel employees that stopped by the room during our stay to ask if there was anything that they could do to make us more comfortable. I will definitley stay there again. The rooms are cozy, but very beautiful. The only problem I encountered during by stay was that the sausage at breakfast wasnt hot, other than that...they get 5 stars from me!

Reviews.Title: “WB: Westin, not Warner Brothers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure was convention headquarters for an organization of musicians in early July. In downtown LA, the location was fine for bus trips to the Cathedral and the new Disney Concert Center. We could have walked there. Inside, the hotel is a maze of colors and shapes throughout the building. The elevators seem to work either very quickly or very slowly. It took several days to become accustomed to the locations of the various conference rooms, restaurants, lobbies aand elevators. The rooms were OK, but on the small side for two full sized beds. Airconditioning worked well and was easy to operate. There was no refrigerator in the room; when I requested one, I was put on a waiting list. The coffee pot's lid kept coming off, but the machine did produce coffee. I did not have time to check out the TV, nor to try the fitness center or the various items of physical training in small areas along the center. Nor did I have the opportunity to visit the restaurant on the 35th floor, atop the tall tower. Energy conservation policy is in effect; if you want the sheets washed, leave the official note on the bed. If you want the towels washed, leave them on the floor of the bathroom. Otherwise, they would not be changed during your stay. Unfortunately, our convention occurred over the 4th of July weekend. Most restaurants were closed on the 4th and 5th. That meant only two workers on duty Monday morning for 2,000+ hungry people who had to catch a bus by 7:30 AM. Breakfast of low-fat granola cereal, a 2 oz container of milk, one glass jar of juice and 1 medium coffee cost $14.24. The banquet, for the most part, was well done; at my table one person collected the tickets reflecting choice of entree; two other waiters seemed terribly confused as to the number of chicken and beef dinners desired. The outdoor reception (for which convention guests paid $15 each) left something to be desired. The champagne flowed freely; reaching the hors d'oeuvres required standing in a long line. Price for convention goers was $155 per night for 1 or 2 per room, plus 14% tax and 0.8% surcharge. If you want downtown location, you have the choice of the WB or the Wilshire Grand.

Reviews.Title: “bleak”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dark, bleak and depressing. Small old rooms even on refurbished level. NO safes in room, and odd shaped. Good price if you need to stay downtown. Lobby and interior DARK with little in the way of shops and dining. Would NOT stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in June 2004 at the Bonaventure on a Hotels $100/night room rate. Overall, our stay was good - the bed was amazingly comfortable and on the 25th floor, we had a beautiful view of downtown (and all the lights at night). I had the SAME problem as another reviewer - I reserved and pre-paid for a king sized bed online, and arrived to find we had been assigned a queen sized bed, right next to the elevator (like someone mentioned - anyone in the glass elevator could see right in our room if our curtains were open). I called the front desk and asked to be moved to a king sized bed room, and the woman was very friendly and accomodating and told me to come right down to get a room change. But when I went downstairs, I got a bit of attitude from a different front desk attendant, who said, "What? You don't like your room?" and sort of acted like I was being funny to request to move to the type of room I had pre-paid for. I wish I had known about the $6 parking around the corner! I did pay $22, but the staff was very nice and let me stay more than 24 hours (From 11:00 a.m. to about 4 p.m. the next day, and I was charged for only one day/overnight stay.) The rotating rooftop bar was a cute place to see the downtown buildings while drinking fruity, pricey drinks. The "mall/food court" part of this hotel is pretty cheesy, 1980s style (orange plastic tables with chairs bolted to the ground) and depressing, but there are plenty of better places to eat outside the hotel. I was very happy with my re-assigned room - great bed, pillows, shower, and view, and no one from the elevator could see in after I moved. I would stay here again. Also, it's close to the Standard, so you can stay in the Bonaventure (if you're a bit older or not up for a party atmosphere all night), and just get a couple drinks at the Standard to check out the action there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, especially if you are running the marathon...”
Reviews.Author: claudiaspiandorim
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the westin bonaventure for 5 nights in march, with our 4-year-old daughter. as soon as we checked-in, my daughter was offered a nice kids bag, containing a cup with straw and a cap. my husband was running the marathon, and the hotel was right between the start and finish lines! the staff was nice and attentive, and the concierge always happy to help. I must say I was a bit unsure after reading some reviews, but we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and found the room to be very comfortable. we reccomend this hotel if you are planning to stay in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!! Loved the Bonaventure!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Impressive service. Little things like using my name, SMILING, quick responsive service, asking for my feedback--in addition to my insanely comfortable bed and 29th floor stunning view--made for an impeccable stay. The Westin Bonaventure is at the top of my list. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: gelert
Reviews.Content: Basically this hotel is a jainormous monstrosity. But the room was nice enough -- what you'd expect from a Westin -- and the location worked well for our purposes.
